Consumer complaint narrative: Fraud and data sharing in credit reporting are governed by laws like the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), ensuring accuracy and consumer protection. Issues include identity theft, synthetic fraud, and data breaches like Equifax ( 2017 ). Consumers should monitor reports, while companies must secure data and comply with privacy regulations to prevent misuse.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent off certified mail to National Credit System, requesting validation of an alleged car loan debt they claim I owe. The letter was sent in accordance with my rights under the Fair DEBT Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and was delivered, as confirmed by tracking. 

As of today, more than 30 days later, I have not received a response. Despite this, the company has not ceased collection efforts, which is a violation of the FDCPA. I believe this lack of response is non-compliant with their legal obligation to validate the debt before pursuing further collection actions. 

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that the XXXX XXXX XXXX either validates the debt or ceases collection efforts immediately. Additionally, I request that this alleged debt, if unverifiable, be removed from my credit report to prevent further harm.

On XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, to ask for permission to rent out our property while we are away. I was told as long as it is at least XXXX -months lease, I am allowed to rent out. 

I also ask for the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX, I was told it is not yet generated. Therefore, they assisted me to set up my email XXXX in the system so I can receive the bills and documents and all communications while I go to foreign country. They helped me reset the online account to make payment when the statement was available. I also asked for a copy of XXXX XXXX  and received a copy of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the email that they just set up. 

While in XXXX, I only received a few messages about the XXXX  meetings.. I have never received any communication about my bills. I had trouble logging in to the XXXX  payment portal and it was also difficult to make phone calls back to the XXXX to reach someone in XXXX. 

Around XX/XX/XXXX, I finally found the XXXX phone number that I was able to talk to a live representative. I tried to get help because the XXXX XXXX new payment system did not take my payment. I was told that my account was blocked and I was placed in collection with XXXX XXXX. I argued that I have never received any email about my bills being behind, however, the office XXXX refused to talk to me and she instructed me to discuss with XXXX XXXX because the account is sold to them. 

I contacted XXXX to ask for the breakdown and they sent me the bill with my XXXX  amount due is {$410.00} for XX/XX/XXXX and {$910.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, plus their collection fees, the total amount is {$7700.00}. 

I explained to them that I want to pay for my XXXX  due, but not their collections fees because I have never received any notice from them nor the XXXX about how much I owe. 

The XXXX is currently denied to take my payments, as well as upcoming XXXX assessments. I have to make the payment will XXXX XXXX. Thus, if I do not pay {$7700.00}, I do not have any way to pay my assessments due with knowing it will clear my XXXX  account. My XXXX fee is supposed to be bill {$410.00} semi-annually. 

I requested XXXX to send me something in writing that when I make {$2400.00} ( I believe this will cover all my assessments from XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ), and confirm with me that money will go to the HOA account and I disputed their Collection fees because I have not received any contact from the XXXX nor XXXX XXXX before. 
However, I keep getting misleading statements with higher and higher collection bills over time. 

I am reaching out to get help, I want to pay for my XXXX fee and keep my property account up to date. It is not fair for me due to the XXXX XXXX lack of communication, and I am in the collection trap of XXXX XXXX I believe my rights are violated by these companies.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, AZ XXXX Subject : Dispute of Charge-Off Account in my Credit Report Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this letter finds you in good health. I am writing to dispute certain inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. The items in question are related to alleged charge-off accounts, which I believe are incorrect and misleading. 

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), I have the right to dispute incomplete or inaccurate information in my credit file. In compliance with this act, I formally dispute the following charge-off accounts : Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX The reason for the dispute is the documents that were sent to me were for the original lease I havent received the new lease that they state is from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 

Please investigate these matters and correct the disputed items as soon as possible. If you need additional information to resolve this dispute, kindly contact me at your earliest convenience. 

I would also like to highlight that under Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) of the FCRA, the entities providing this information to you have an obligation to correct, VALIDATE, VERIFY and update relevant information to ensure its accuracy. If they have failed to do so, they may be in violation of the FCRA and in turn these accounts need to be deleted from my consumer file immediately if they cant be validated and verified.

In addition, according to Section 623 ( b ) of the FCRA, upon receipt of my dispute, you must notify the information provider of my dispute. If you find that any of these accounts are indeed inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified or validated, I kindly request their immediate removal as per Section 605 of the FCRA, which stipulates that any information that is found to be inaccurate or can no longer be verified or validated must be removed from a consumer 's credit file. If you cant provide me with the original contract with my wet ink signature, and the name and title of the person you spoke to about the above listed accounts showing validation and verification please delete the above listed account Lastly, I want to draw your attention to the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) amendment to the FCRA, which provides me the right to obtain one free copy of my credit report in cases where a change has been made as a result of the dispute.

I have attached a copy of my credit report with the disputed items highlighted for your convenience. Please provide a detailed response to my dispute in writing within 30 days of receipt of this letter, as required by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, [ Your Name ] Attachments : Copy of Credit Report with Disputed Items Highlighted
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a call and letter on XX/XX/year> from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
About a collection I am currently disputing ( National Credit System ) Account # XXXX I replayed asking for a debt validation request dated XXXX XXXX, XXXX. After reviewing the documentation they provided, I have identified inaccuracies and insufficiencies in their response. 
Specifically, the resident charge/payment ledger they provided contains discrepancies that do not accurately reflect the alleged debt 's history. I was requesting that the firm address the following : 1. Inaccuracies in the Ledger : Please provide a detailed and accurate explanation of the discrepancies identified in the ledger. Include all supporting documentation that verifies the accuracy of the charges and payments, such as invoices, receipts, and transaction histories.

2. Full Disclosure of Purchase Agreements : As part of your obligation to validate this debt, I formally request full disclosure of all purchase agreements or assignments related to this alleged debt. This includes but is not limited to : A copy of the original agreement with the creditor. 
The chain of title and all transfer/assignment documents showing ownership of the debt. Any terms and conditions outlining the agreement 's enforceability. 
Please note that under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), they are required to provide this information to validate the debt. Without such documentation, your claim to collect this debt is not substantiated. 
The law office did not reply.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I was notified by XXXX that my Ach payment did not bounce from my closed Santander account but was receivedby them. This wasn't much of a surprise because I had a negative balance of XXXX dollars ( and thats the reason my account closed in XXXX this year because even though i didnt know i could even overdraft on my account..since it was overdrafted for 33 days they closed my XXXX XXXX XXXX account thats never been negative bc i probably aged out of the non overdraft student account but i digress... i logged into my mobile banking on the XXXX day because they sent an email that if i was negative for much longer after 20 days that i would be fined..no notice of account closer and no warning from app! I was ready to pay the fines not deal with account closer ) so fast forward a couple months to the present day XXXX took their money and supposedly sent a check to my last address on file ... is what I was told by a Santander representative on the phone on the XXXX. 

My surprise came in because I had called Santander on XX/XX/XXXX asking about the check but a representative had then told me that no open accou ts were found so there's no way a check was routed and it had to bounce. On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX confirmed a transfer or check number to Santander with my info. 

The Santander representative that I spoke to told me that the check had to be en route because " They have 10 days to send the check. '' By that Day it was the XXXX business day ( taking away XXXX for XXXX ) or XXXX business day, so I had started to ADVIDLY watch for the mail... today is XX/XX/XXXX and there still has been no check in the mail or confirmation that it's been at least canceled in anticipation of it being rerouted to a Santander branch for my pick up. 

So because this payment was sent from my job on/around XX/XX/year> and I was in anticipation of the moniess... XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I called Santanders XXXX number to try to cancel the check and pick it up at a branch and a Santander representative said that it might best to do this all at a branch. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I went to the XXXX XXXX branch in MA and the branch manager advised me she could help me, not the worker, asked for my story again about trying to cancel the check, then got on the phone with the " back office '' as I retold them my issue for the third time she assured me that the back office would be able to handle it. She gave me her card to email her. 


On XX/XX/XXXX I checked in through email and she replied " Thank you. I have submitted a request for you. As soon as I hear from the department that handles this request I will inform you of next steps. 
XXXX XXXX Branch Manager '' On XX/XX/XXXX she emailed me that she was " still awaiting a response from the processing team to see if I could pick up the check at a branch, '' so I wouldn't have to play this mail game anymore. 

My email lost storage so I emailed her from a different email on XX/XX/XXXX asking if they've ( processing team? ) updated her with anything and she said that she " had just emailed them again and included her district executive. '' I've received no correspondence from Santanders Ach team or any back office for clarification, the branch manager being an ignorant middleman might not be the best course of action. Im turned off that the systems that should've alerted me to a check on the way even with my closed account were not in effect and that's the start to this issue, because with the check not arriving in the mail... it's on my mind that its been cashed. 
That leads to my other issues, which are regarding the time in which " theyre '' in handling this. I don't want to badger the middle man branch manager and I don't want to go to a seperate branch and raise a fraud alert, so reddit told me to come here.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have reached out to MOHELA on several occasions when I can actually get through to someone despite long wait times. Each time to speak with someone about removing a voluntary forbearance, I am assured it will happen, and the interest accrued will be reversed, months later it still has not happened. I am on the SAVE plan so I should be automatically enrolled in the general interest free forbearance but that has not been done.

Mohela has told me so much conflicting information each time I speak with them. First when I spoke with them they directed me to XXXX  and stated they needed to resolve the interest refund. Then when I spoke with XXXX, they directed me back to the servicer saying there was nothing they could do. Then, I was told they just needed to remove the forbearance ( which would take 10 days ) and I would be refunded and now 2 months later it still has not happened. 

I reached out to the AGO. They told me XXXX XXXX. XXXX  XXXX instructed servicers not to effectuate the 0 % interest SAVE forbearance until such voluntary forbearances ended. This information is shared NOWHERE for borrowers to see and understand. They also told me there was nothing they could do and then directed me to lodge a complaint here. 

I am in an extremely difficult position where it appears this servicer has customer service agents that are uniformed and misdirecting me and also not changing my forbearance status despite my multiple requests. Their website has never directed me that I was supposed to remove my voluntary forbearance, it states I would be automatically enrolled into the interest free general forbearance. The communication and direction I am receiving is fraudulent and purposely misleading it seems. It needs to be resolved now. I

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request the deletion of inaccurate, re-inserted, and fraudulent accounts present on my consumer credit reports and to bring to your attention the failure of XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX to provide the necessary proof of debt validation within the stipulated time frame of 30 days. I have previously sent certified dispute letters to these companies to rectify my credit report 's inaccuracies and ensure compliance with the FCRA. Still, these companies have yet to respond to me with verifiable documentary proof, original consumer contract, or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it, 30 days went by. I received nothing from these companies and these accounts were reinserted with no permissible purpose and without my consent. 

As outlined in the FCRA, failure to provide documented and verifiable proof within the specified time frame obligates the removal of unverified, invalid, derogatory accounts and information from my consumer report. Despite the receipt of my dispute letter and the lapse of 30 days, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX  have neither provided the requested proof nor rectified the inaccuracies in the reported information. They didnt respond to me at all and therefore by law, I'm demanding the deletion of these accounts on my credit report immediately.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Experian for failing to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by refusing to remove unauthorized credit inquiries from my credit report. 
On my XX/XX/2024 credit report, I discovered several unauthorized credit inquiries on my Experian credit report. I promptly disputed these inquiries, as I did not authorize any of them. However, Experian advised me that I needed to contact the creditors responsible for these inquiries to obtain a letter from them acknowledging the unauthorized inquiry. This is in direct violation of the FCRA. 
As per the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete consumer reports. Experian, as a consumer reporting agency, bears the responsibility of investigating my dispute and ensuring the accuracy of the information on my credit report. I am not responsible for obtaining any documentation from the creditors involved. 
By shifting the burden to me and refusing to remove the unauthorized inquiries, Experian has failed to uphold its legal obligations under the FCRA. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and compel Experian to remove these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report.

This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unfair Late Payment Reporting by XXXX  XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint regarding an unfair negative remark on my credit report caused by XXXX  XXXX XXXX failure to process my account closure request properly. Despite multiple attempts to resolve this matter with the bank and Experian, the issue remains unresolved, and I am requesting your assistance in addressing this violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Details of the Issue In XX/XX/year>, I requested the closure of my XXXX  XXXX XXXX account via a phone call. At the time of my request, the account balance was XXXX. I was assured that the account would be closed. However, due to the bank 's failure to process my closure request, the account remained open, and I was subsequently charged two {$15.00} fees. These fees resulted in late payments being reported to the credit bureaus, unfairly damaging my otherwise exceptional payment history. 

I have disputed these late payments with Experian, requesting verification of their accuracy. Experian has responded, claiming the information is accurate. However, the negative remarks on my credit report are the direct result of XXXX  XXXX XXXX failure to process my account closure request as promised, making this reporting unfair and inaccurate. 

Impact These unfairly reported late payments have caused a significant drop in my credit score and tarnished my impeccable credit history. This is unjust, given that the fees and subsequent late payments resulted solely from the banks error in failing to close my account as instructed. 

What I Am Requesting I request the CFPBs assistance to : 1Investigate this matter with XXXX  XXXX XXXX and Experian. 
2Require XXXX  XXXX XXXX to remove the late payment reports from my credit history across all major credit bureaus. 
3Ensure compliance with the FCRA and prevent further harm to my creditworthiness.

Supporting Documentation I have attached : A summary of my account history, including the timeline of the account closure request. 
Copies of correspondence with Experian regarding the dispute. 
My Experian credit report showing the late payment remarks. 

Conclusion I believe this issue stems from XXXX  XXXX XXXX error and failure to act on my account closure request, making the late payments unjust and inaccurate. I appreciate the CFPBs attention to this matter and look forward to a resolution that restores the accuracy of my credit report. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general lf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request the deletion of inaccurate, re-inserted, and fraudulent late payments present on my consumer credit report and to bring to your attention the failure of XXXX XXXX  to provide the necessary proof of the accuracy of the alleged late payments within the stipulated time frame of 30 days. I have previously sent certified dispute letters to these companies to rectify my credit report 's inaccuracies and ensure compliance with the FCRA. Still, this company has yet to respond to me with verifiable documentary proof of the accuracy of these late payments. Thirty days went by I received nothing from this company and these late payments were reinserted with no permissible purpose and without my consent. 

As outlined in the FCRA, failure to provide documented and verifiable proof within the specified time frame obligates the removal of unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. Despite the receipt of my dispute letter and the lapse of 30 days, XXXX XXXX  has not provided the requested proof nor rectified the inaccuracies in the reported information. They didnt respond to me at all and therefore by law, I'm demanding the deletion of these late payments on my credit report immediately.

However, these late payments are still inaccurate and are continuing to report errors on my credit file, violating my rights and damaging my credit score at the same time. According to The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the information on a consumer 's credit report should be consistent across all three bureaus, as creditors and lenders may use any of the three to check a consumer 's credit history. XXXX XXXX  did not remove the inaccurate late payments furnished on my consumer file, and I have never given my consent to re-insert or furnish these late payments. No consent is Identity Theft. 

I formally request XXXX and EXPERIAN to update these late payments to paid on time never late on my credit report, as per the provisions of the FCRA. The failure of these companies to validate the inaccuracies within the statutory timeframe signifies their non-compliance with federal regulations and warrants the removal of the disputed accounts.

NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer, I am demanding the deletion of the unauthorized accounts and inquiries listed IMMEDIATELY!

Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute certain late payments listed on my consumer report, as obtained on XX/XX/XXXX. Upon reviewing the report, I have identified discrepancies in the information furnished by your agency. It has come to my attention that there are potential violations of federal consumer protection laws in the handling of my credit information. 

I would like to draw your attention to pertinent consumer laws established to safeguard individuals like myself in credit transactions. Under 15 USC 1666 ( B ) and 15 USC 1637 a ( a ), it is explicitly stated that reporting a payment as late on an open-ended credit plan is impermissible under any circumstances. Additionally, according to 15 USC 16819 ( B ), consent from the consumer is required before furnishing information on their behalf. To date, I have not granted such authorization to XXXX. 

Your failure to adhere to these regulations not only jeopardizes my financial standing but also undermines the integrity of my consumer report. This letter serves as a formal request to rectify the inaccuracies present in the following listings on my report : 1. Name of Account : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Late Payment Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX I request that you promptly investigate and update the aforementioned entries to reflect accurate information, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Any information provided must be thoroughly verified, and any erroneous data must be expeditiously removed. 

Please provide me with documentation regarding the resolution of my dispute and furnish an updated consumer report reflecting the amendments made. I remind you that this is my initial attempt at resolving this matter amicably and in accordance with legal protocol. 

Kindly address this matter with utmost urgency to prevent any further harm to my creditworthiness. I anticipate your prompt response and cooperation in resolving this dispute. 

Best regards, XXXX, XXXX Without Prejudice All Natural Inalienable Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Experian, While reviewing my most recent credit report, I noticed multiple credit inquiries that I do not recognize or recall authorizing. Over the past few years, I have been impacted by numerous data breaches, and I am concerned these inquiries may be fraudulent. Thankfully, these inquiries are not attached to open accounts, but their presence on my credit report is highly concerning. 

I am formally requesting that you investigate the following inquiries and provide documentation demonstrating permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 1681b ( c ), for these companies to access my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX | XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX : I do not recall authorizing this inquiry. Please investigate and remove it from my credit report immediately. 

Under the FCRA, I am entitled to know the permissible purpose under which these companies accessed my credit report. I demand validation for each inquiry, including documentation bearing my signature, authorizing these entities to perform a credit inquiry. 

If these inquiries can not be validated or verified, I demand their immediate removal from my credit report to prevent further harm to my creditworthiness and privacy. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 30 days, as required under the FCRA.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute an inaccurate item on my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The account referenced above is reported as charged off, yet it also shows an outstanding balance. This reporting is both inconsistent and potentially misleading. 

According to standard accounting practices and regulatory guidance, when an account is charged off, the creditor has written off the balance as a loss. Reporting both a charge-off and an outstanding balance is improper, as the debt is no longer active on their books. This error adversely affects my credit standing and must be corrected immediately. 

To support my claim, I am requesting the following : 1. Verification of the balance being reported.

2. Evidence that the creditor has retained the right to report a balance on this charged-off account.

If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this account or the reported balance, I demand that this account either be updated to reflect a {$0.00} balance or removed entirely from my credit report. 

I have enclosed documentation relevant to this dispute : [ Include any receipts, account statements, or correspondence related to the charge-off or balance dispute. ] As required by law, you have 30 days to investigate and resolve this dispute. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide written documentation of your findings once the investigation is complete. 

Failure to resolve this matter promptly will result in my filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potentially seeking legal action to protect my credit rights. 

I expect your swift attention to this matter. Thank you for your cooperation.

Re : Urgent Request Fraudulent and inquiries block under section 605B of the FCRA Account in Dispute : XXXX  XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$480.00} Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$810.00} Account In Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$340.00} To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to urgently request the removal of fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report due to identify theft. The inaccurate information is causing significant harm to my credit, and I expect immediate correction action. 
Per section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), the following fraudulent accounts must be blocked and permanently removed from my credit file. I am invoking my right to have fraudulent information blocked and permanently removed from my credit report within ( 4 ) business days from the date of receipt of this letter. 
Account in Dispute : XXXX  XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$480.00} Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$810.00} Account In Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$340.00} Additionally, I request the removal of all unauthorized inquiries to this identify theft : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Failure to comply with this request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action. If this fraudulent information is not blocked and removed, I will file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and I will seek monetary damages for the harm caused by continued reporting of these inaccuracies. 
I also demand the immediate removal of all unauthorized inquiries related to this identity theft, which were are not authorized by me and negatively impacted my credit. If these inquiries are not promptly removed, I will escalate this matter to the appropriate legal authorities. 
I expect written confirmation by XX/XX/XXXX, confirming that the fraudulent XXXX XXXX XXXX accounts and any related unauthorized inquiries have been fully removed from my credit report. 
This is a time sensitive matter, and you are now officially on notice. Failure to act promptly will result in further legal action to protect my rights and restore my credit. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: I, the consumer d/b/a- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX I have reclaimed the principal security interest, by ways of novation 's and notice to claims to the principal 's security interest- to transfer the principal 's security interest to the principals account for set off. Capital one Bank is refusing to credit the account with the interest owed to these accounts. I have been returning the fully indorsed bill of exchange along with my claims to the principal 's security interest in letter form, also sending capital one a power of attorney making the bank aware the agent has the authority to transfer the principal 's security interest for set off. I have been in contact with the call center, I have mailed a number of letters to capital one bank XXXX XXXX XXXX Capital One Bank XXXX trying to resolve this issue, but capital one bank is absolutely refusing to credit the principals account with the interest owed to the account. stating the consumer needs to send money to satisfy these accounts. 18 USC 8 states the bill of exchange is the same as united states dollars. Capital One Bank wants me to make overpayments to these accounts as per 15 USC 1615 states. as the consumer I know this account was pre-paid as per the Federal Reserve Act section 16 states, 18 USC 8 states the bill of exchange is the obligation of the United States also an acceptable form of payment. the bill of exchange act states the only way to pay a bill is with interest via a bill of exchange. Capital One Bank has refused to credit these accounts with the bill of exchange and Capital One Bank has now filed a Lawsuit against the consumer stating non-performance. As the consumer has been performing since XXXX of XXXX. Capital one Bank has made a claim in the XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Ohio XXXX Case No. XXXX claiming the Consumer owes {$7600.00} as a result of non-performance. as the consumer has been performing since XXXX of XXXX  by way of the bill of exchange. Capital One has refused to credit the account with the principal 's security interest owed to the account, to set off the account to a zero balance as instructed to do in the consumers payment orders. even though Capital One has not returned to the consumer 1 bill of exchange stating any defect. Capital One has accepted each tender of payment through certified and registered mail. Performance is payment in law and delivery is acceptance. Capital One Bank has closed these accounts stating non-performance and now their suing the consumer attempting to extort the consumer for overpayments.12 USC 1431 states the powers and duties of the banks ; it's the banks job to borrow money and to pay interest not the consumers, the consumers are to perform by way of the bill of exchange. 15 USC 1602 ( g ) ( 2 ) defines the consumer as the creditor. Capital One Bank has damaged the consumers credit rating stating non-performance to all 3 credit bureaus making it very difficult for the consumer to obtain credit and very expensive once credit is obtained. As the consumer I have been following the Law and performing as expected Capital One has not performed as the law states. Also Bills of exchange have also been sent to the Treasury dept for set-off, if these have been paid Capital One Bank , NA. has not credited the account for those bills of exchange sent to the UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPT, REMITTANCE OFFICE. those also haven't been credited to these accounts.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary of Complaint : XXXX XXXX is inaccurately reporting an account on my credit report, despite the same account being removed from both XXXX and XXXX due to inaccuracies or unverifiability. XXXX has failed to properly investigate my dispute and continues to report the account on XXXX, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This inconsistent reporting is damaging to my creditworthiness. 

Details of Complaint : The account in question has already been removed by XXXX and XXXX, indicating its inaccuracy or lack of verifiability. However, it remains on XXXX. 
XXXX has claimed the account is being reported correctly but has failed to address the discrepancies across credit bureaus.

I have requested a reasonable investigation as required by Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA, but XXXX has failed to resolve the inaccuracies.

Laws Violated : FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must report information with maximum possible accuracy.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers must ensure the accuracy of the data provided to credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) : XXXX failed to conduct a reasonable investigation into my dispute.

CFPA ( Consumer Financial Protection Act ) : Discover 's refusal to correct inaccurate data may constitute unfair and deceptive practices.

Attached you will find a copy of my id, a copy of my social security card, a copy of my most recent bill, a copy of my FTC complaint, a screenshot of the account removed from XXXX and the letter for Experian.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft. I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law.

This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer.

Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately ADDRESSES INQUIRES NAMES ACCOUNTS COLLECTIONS These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint against Experian for inaccurately reporting a late payment on my credit report. Despite providing official documentation from XXXX XXXX  that clearly shows a late fee for XX/XX/XXXX was waived, Experian removed the XXXX late payment but incorrectly shifted it to XX/XX/XXXX. 

This misreporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Failure to ensure maximum accuracy in reporting.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Failure to correct inaccurate information after a formal dispute.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) Re-reporting inaccurate information after being notified of the error.

I have attempted to resolve this issue directly with Experian by submitting supporting documents from XXXX XXXX. However, Experian failed to fully correct the error. This inaccurate reporting continues to negatively impact my credit profile. 

I am requesting that Experian remove the late payment from XX/XX/XXXX and update my credit report to reflect the accurate status of my account as confirmed by XXXX XXXX. 

I have attached all relevant documents, including the official statement from XXXX XXXX, to support my claim. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and request prompt resolution in accordance with the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary of Complaint : XXXX XXXX is inaccurately reporting an account on my credit report, despite the same account being removed from both XXXX and XXXX due to inaccuracies or unverifiability. XXXX has failed to properly investigate my dispute and continues to report the account on XXXX, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This inconsistent reporting is damaging to my creditworthiness. 

Details of Complaint : The account in question has already been removed by XXXX and XXXX, indicating its inaccuracy or lack of verifiability. However, it remains on XXXX. 
XXXX has claimed the account is being reported correctly but has failed to address the discrepancies across credit bureaus.

I have requested a reasonable investigation as required by Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA, but XXXX has failed to resolve the inaccuracies.

Laws Violated : FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must report information with maximum possible accuracy.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers must ensure the accuracy of the data provided to credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) : XXXX failed to conduct a reasonable investigation into my dispute.

CFPA ( Consumer Financial Protection Act ) : XXXX 's refusal to correct inaccurate data may constitute unfair and deceptive practices.

Attached you will find a copy of my id, a copy of my social security card, a copy of my most recent bill, a copy of my FTC complaint, a screenshot of the account removed from XXXX and the letter for Experian.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the validity of the debt you claim I owe and to request full validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. You are hereby notified that I am exercising my rights under federal law to request proper validation of this debt.

I am requesting that you provide the following documentation to substantiate your claim : 1.Proof of Ownership of the Debt A complete chain of title demonstrating that your company legally owns this debt and is authorized to collect it.

2.Proof of My Obligation to Pay A signed contract, agreement, or original application bearing my signature, indicating that I entered into this obligation and agreed to the terms.

3.Verification of the Amount Allegedly Owed A detailed and itemized statement of the debt, including the original creditor, dates of debt accrual, and an explanation of all fees, interest, and charges.

4.Verification of Your Right to Collect Evidence that you are licensed and legally authorized to collect debts in my state.

5.FCRA Verification of Reporting Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), if this debt has been reported to any credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ), I request that you immediately verify the accuracy and completeness of the information. 
Please provide : Evidence that the debt has been properly verified as accurate. 
Proof of the specific method ( s ) used to verify the debt with the original creditor.

Failure to verify the accuracy of this reporting will constitute a violation of the FCRA and will require the immediate removal of this debt from all credit reports.

Until I receive all the above documentation, I do not acknowledge this debt and request that you cease all collection activities, including reporting this debt to credit bureaus. Unverified debts can not be reported under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I demand that you cease and desist all forms of communication with me, including calls, letters, emails, or any other contact, except to provide the requested verification or to notify me of legal actions taken. 

Failure to comply with these requests will be viewed as a violation of both the FDCPA and FCRA. I will not hesitate to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney Generals office if my rights are disregarded. 

Please respond within 30 days from the date you receive this letter, as required by law. Send all correspondence to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your cooperation in resolving this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to request the immediate deletion of a Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ) account from my credit report. This account contains inaccuracies, disputed charges, and information related to identity theft. Furthermore, NFCU 's handling of my billing dispute and related inquiries has been unprofessional and in violation of multiple federal and state laws. Relevant Legal Violations : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Under the FCRA, I have the right to request the removal of fraudulent or inaccurate information from my credit report. NFCU has failed to correct inaccuracies related to this account, specifically refusing to remove it despite its connection to identity theft and unauthorized charges. Violation : NFCUs refusal to remove this fraudulent information from my credit report violates my rights under the FCRA. Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) 15 U.S.C. 1666 The FCBA requires creditors to promptly investigate billing disputes and provide written explanations of their findings. NFCU failed to conduct a thorough investigation regarding a { {$1000.00} } debit card charge associated with this account and did not provide an adequate explanation. Violation : NFCUs mishandling of the billing dispute violates the FCBA 's investigation and dispute resolution provisions. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) 15 U.S.C. 1693f The EFTA governs the resolution of unauthorized electronic fund transfers. The { {$1000.00} } charge is unauthorized, and NFCU has not investigated or reversed the transaction, despite my provision of sufficient documentation. Violation : NFCU has violated the EFTA by failing to investigate and resolve unauthorized charges as required by law. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692c The FDCPA prohibits unfair and deceptive collection practices, including reporting inaccurate or disputed debts. NFCU continues to report this account as charged off or past due, despite the ongoing dispute, which has harmed my credit score and financial standing. Violation : NFCUs reporting of this account as delinquent, despite the ongoing dispute, constitutes a violation of the FDCPA. Ohio Consumer Sales Practices Act ( CSPA ) Ohio Rev. Code 1345.02 The Ohio CSPA prohibits suppliers from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or unconscionable acts in consumer transactions. NFCUs failure to investigate my billing dispute and unauthorized charges, along with their lack of clear communication, falls under deceptive practices as defined by Ohio law. Violation : NFCUs conduct constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under the Ohio CSPA. Ohio Identity Theft Law Ohio Rev. Code 2913.49 Ohio 's identity theft laws protect consumers from the adverse effects of fraudulent information. NFCU has refused to correct or remove fraudulent information from my credit report, which continues to harm my financial standing. Violation : NFCUs refusal to remove identity theft-related information from my credit report violates Ohios identity theft law. Summary of Violations : Inaccurate Information Reporting ( FCRA ) : NFCU has failed to remove inaccurate information despite evidence of its connection to unauthorized charges and identity theft. Failure to Investigate Billing Disputes ( FCBA ) : NFCU has not properly investigated my billing dispute. Unauthorized Charges ( EFTA ) : The { {$1000.00} } charge is unauthorized, and NFCU has failed to investigate or reverse it. Unfair Debt Collection Practices ( FDCPA ) : NFCU continues to report the account as delinquent despite the ongoing dispute. Deceptive Practices ( Ohio CSPA ) : NFCUs mishandling of my dispute and failure to correct inaccuracies constitute unfair practices. Failure to Correct Identity Theft Information ( Ohio Identity Theft Law ) : NFCUs refusal to remove identity theft-related information is unlawful. Desired Outcome : Immediate Deletion of the NFCU Account : I request that NFCU be required to delete this disputed account from my credit report across all credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). This account contains fraudulent charges and disputed information that have not been resolved appropriately. Reimbursement of { {$1000.00} } for Unauthorized sharing of non public information to a third party : I seek reimbursement for the { {$1000.00} } unauthorized sharing of non public information to a third party. If NFCU can not provide this reimbursement, I request that they block and delete the account from my credit report immediately. Correction of Credit Report : NFCU must notify all credit bureaus of the account deletion and ensure that any derogatory marks related to this account are permanently removed from my credit file. Conclusion : I trust that the CFPB will take prompt action to ensure my rights as a consumer are upheld. NFCU has failed to follow federal and state laws in handling my dispute and reporting accurate information. I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that NFCU corrects the ongoing damage to my credit report. Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently obtained copies of my credit reports from the consumer reporting agencies, I discovered some inaccuracies on my credit reports and proceeded to file disputes with each agency. All three agencies reported a late payment about ( Account Name : XXXX XXXX ) with account number XXXX. I have, however, always maintained timely payments on this account, and the late payment is inaccurate. Despite my dispute, XXXX and Experian are still inaccurately showing this late payment, with XXXX showing a late payment in XXXX of XXXX  while Experian is showing a late payment in XXXX of XXXX  ; again, this account has always been paid as agreed, and there were no late payments in either of those months. 

I request that the CFPB conduct a thorough investigation into these discrepancies and provide evidence of the lateness of these payments. If such evidence can not be provided, I ask that the late payments be removed from my credit report promptly and that my payment history be updated to reflect its accurate and on-time status.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Credit Report Errors and Collections Dear CFPB, Experian failure to correct the disputed accounts in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( i ) is a violation of federal law. As of this date, I demand : 1. Immediate removal of the erroneous entries.

2. A written confirmation of corrective action within 5 business days. 

I demand that Experian immediately cease and desist from reporting inaccurate and unverified debt information in my credit report. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I dispute : Disputed Accounts with Creditor Names and Account Numbers : Collection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian previously reported these accounts as verified, but I requested proof in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) ( 7 ) AND Fair Credit Reporting Act 609, and Experian has failed to provide any of the following : 1.Verification documents 2. Name of the original creditor 3. The creditors address and telephone number 4. Name of verifying individual 5. Copy of contract between me and Disputed Creditor 6. Purchase agreement of debt XXXX. Insurance claim documentation XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) with original creditor XXXX. Statute of limitations documentation 10. Date of last missed payment 11. The documentation used to verify the dispute If Experian is unable to respond in a timely manner and provide the above items, please delete the accounts from my credit report to prevent further damage and if these actions are not completed promptly, I will pursue statutory and punitive damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n. Experian intentional non-compliance will also be reported to the FTC, CFPB, Florida Attorney General and state regulatory agencies. 

Remove these disputed accounts immediately and permanently, ensuring 100 % accuracy and send me a written confirmation of corrective action within 5 business days. 

Documentation : Complaint ID with CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Also, as asked Experian before, they need to please correct and delete the following personal information : Delete Address History :

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
There are multiple companies involved, including : 1. XXXX XXXX ( original mortgage lender, who initiated the original loan and escrow ) 2. XXXX XXXX ( insurance broker ) 3. PNC Bank ( current mortgage company ; XXXX sold my loan to PNC ) 4. XXXX- the insurance company that has owned all the loans for the home at XXXX XXXX XXXX -- those that I've paid, and also those that my mortgage company has paid. 

I am trying to resolve the overpayment and continued double payment of concurrent policies on my home at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, California XXXX since XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  when my homeowners insurance lapsed. One policy has been placed by my mortgage company via escrow. One policy has been started by me due to the failure of my mortgage company ( originally XXXX XXXX, now PNC bank to pay from escrow ). 

I have notified both institutions that I have been paying homeowners insurance and continue to be paying that amount through escrow. Because of this mismanagement, I wish to end any and all escrow as soon as possible and be refunded the full amount of the overpayment. 

Here 's a timeline : ORIGINAL POLICY ( XXXX XXXX via XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX - Original policy ( XXXX ) bound by XXXX  Agency Owner XXXX XXXX through XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - Home closing with XXXX XXXX ; {$910.00} paid into escrow for insurance XX/XX/XXXX - Supplemental bill of {$64.00} sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX - Original policy cancelled for non-payment XX/XX/XXXX - I discover insurance had lapsed XX/XX/XXXX - I notify XXXX XXXX about the insurance situation XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - Policy XXXX written with XXXX XXXX  ( {$950.00} premium paid via credit card ) XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX First renewal ( XXXX ) with {$1200.00} premium XX/XX/XXXX - Refund of {$100.00} issued by XXXX Insurance to your credit card for overpayment ( Reported by XXXX, I am still verifying the receipt of this payment ) MORTGAGE TRANSFER PERIOD XX/XX/XXXX - Loan transferred to PNC Bank XX/XX/XXXX - PNC Bank makes escrow disbursement of {$1300.00} for homeowners insurance XX/XX/XXXX - Second renewal ( XXXX ) with {$1300.00} premium paid via credit card XX/XX/XXXX - Two refunds issued by XXXX Insurance to your credit card ( {$110.00} and {$110.00} ) for overpayment ( Reported by XXXX, I am still verifying the receipt of this payment ) CURRENT PERIOD XX/XX/XXXX - Third renewal ( XXXX ) with {$1800.00} premium XX/XX/XXXX - PNC Bank makes escrow disbursement of {$1300.00} for homeowners insurance XXXX XXXX- I contact PNC Bank about double payments XX/XX/XXXX- I provide insurance documentation to PNC Bank and contact XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - Latest escrow XXXX XX/XX/XXXX- PNC Bank sends letter about escrow removal process Late XXXX XXXX  XXXX - I send letter back to PNC requesting escrow removal Late XXXX - I am contacted by a local PNC branch to resolve, but referred to another branch. 
XX/XX/XXXX- I have resubmitted the requested letter a second time. 

FORMAL CORRESPONDENCE XX/XX/XXXX - California Department of Insurance sends opening letter regarding complaint file number XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX sends response letter reporting : XXXX term : All payments made via credit card XXXX term : One credit card payment and one escrow check received ; {$100.00} refund issued on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX term : Two credit card payments and one escrow check received ; two refunds ( {$110.00} & {$110.00} ) issued on XX/XX/XXXX ( I'm still verifying these amounts ) XXXX term : All payments made by credit card so far ; no overpayments to date Notes that PNC Bank has been trying to obtain policy information but can not due to not being listed on the account XX/XX/XXXX - Goosehead Insurance Agency sends response letter confirming : Original policy XXXX XXXX XXXX was bound on XX/XX/XXXX Original policy cancelled for non-payment on XX/XX/XXXX Second policy ( XXXX ) written on XX/XX/XXXX with credit card billing Goosehead was not informed of mortgage transfer until XX/XX/XXXX XXXX can not provide refunds as they are not the ultimate recipient of premiums

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On or about XX/XX/XXXX  I used my affirm account to purchase tires from XXXX online. The tires were the wrong size and no services or tires were received. A refund for the services was placed back to my affirm account, but the cost of the tires was not. Upon contacting both XXXX and Affirm to investigate this matter ; to date still no refund has been issued. Affirm placed a letter in my account dated XX/XX/XXXX  that the loan was deemed true and I was responsible. I again reached out to affirm who directed me to XXXX and stated they were not able to assist further. I explained I am a customer in good standings and don't understand why you would attempt to charge me for items I did not receive without a full and thorough investigation. At this time XXXX is still promising a refund and Affirm states they have no information of such and refuse to pursue a refund on my behalf.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as a natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft, I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law. 
This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy rights.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately Addresses, Collections, Inquires, Names, Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX across the XXXX credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Experian ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : [ Insert Account Number ] Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : XXXX & Experian : {$5400.00} XXXX : {$5300.00} Discrepancy : Conflicting balances across credit bureaus. 
2. Date of Last Activity : XXXX & Experian : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Discrepancy : The conflicting dates indicate inaccurate and inconsistent reporting. 
3. Last Payment Date : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Experian : Not reported. 
Discrepancy : Inconsistent last payment dates among bureaus. 
4. Payment Status : XXXX XXXX Experian : XXXX XXXX : Late XXXX  Days Discrepancy : Differing payment statuses create confusion about the true state of the account. 
5. Dispute Status : XXXX & Experian : Account not disputed XXXX : Consumer disputes- reinvestigation in progress Discrepancy : Conflicting information on whether or not the account is currently disputed. 
6. Credit Limit : All three bureaus report a credit limit of {$3600.00}, yet the high balance exceeds this limit, raising questions about the accuracy of reporting. 

Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with.

Their business address, name, and phone number.

3. Documentation proving the validity of the account balance, payment history, and charge-off status.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by : 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information.

2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Falsely reporting payment activity and account status.

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 


Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Summary Credit Card Dispute Issue with Capital One Description of Issue : On XX/XX/year>, I was charged {$4000.00} by XXXX for a service that was misrepresented. The company promised real estate referrals, but instead, they provided a XXXX system and training videosservices that were not what was advertised or agreed upon. 

I contacted the merchant on XX/XX/year>, to request a refund and inquire about the missing referrals. They failed to respond. As a result, I initiated a dispute with Capital One on XX/XX/year>, and followed their instructions for submitting documentation to support my claim. 

Key Issue with Capital One Handling : On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with two different Capital One managers. One manager stated that I still had time to dispute the charge, while another claimed the dispute window had expired on XX/XX/year>. 
This conflicting information led to the premature closure of my case, despite my compliance with their process and deadlines. 
Evidence Provided During Dispute : Dispute Letters and Supporting Documents Including correspondence with the merchant and Capital One. 
Timeline of Communications Phone calls made to Capital One on XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>, showing efforts to resolve the issue. 
Proof of Misrepresentation Invoice and emails demonstrating the merchants failure to deliver the promised service. 
Request for Resolution : I am requesting that the CFPB reviews my case and asks Capital One to reopen my dispute. Additionally, I ask that Capital One reevaluates the evidence provided and reverses the {$4000.00} charge due to the merchants misrepresentation and failure to deliver the agreed-upon service. 

Attachments : Copies of Capital Ones responses, letters, and evidence submitted during the dispute process.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Credit Reporting Agency, I am writing to formally dispute the continued reporting of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ( Account # XXXX ) on my credit report. The information being reported is inaccurate, unverifiable, and constitutes multiple violations of my rights under federal and state laws. 

a. False or Misleading Representations ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) If XXXX continues to report the debt as collectible despite it being charged off or forgiven, this constitutes false representation. 
Failure to clarify the status of the debt, especially if it was canceled or forgiven, is misleading. 
b. Failure to Cease Collection on Disputed Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) If a debt is disputed, the collector ( or creditor, in this case ) must cease all collection activityincluding reporting to CRAsuntil the debt is validated. If the dispute has been ignored or dismissed without validation, this is a violation. 
XXXX. Misrepresentation of Debt Status a. Inaccurate Reporting of Balance Reporting a balance greater than {$0.00} on a charged-off account misrepresents the account status. A charge-off means the creditor has deemed the debt uncollectible and written it off, so the balance should reflect {$0.00} unless sold to a collection agency. 
b. Violation of Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ), creditors must provide accurate billing and disclosure. If the reported balance is inconsistent with the charge-off classification, this violates TILA.

Additionally, the reporting of a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is inaccurate and misleading. If this account has been charged off, the balance should reflect {$0.00}, as required under proper credit reporting standards. 

Violations of My Rights XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) I submitted dispute letters dated XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX and XX/XX/year>, requesting documentation to validate this account, including : Authenticated double-entry accounting records. 
Original signed agreements or contracts.

A copy of the 1099-C form ( if applicable ).

You failed to conduct a reasonable investigation and instead relied solely on unverifiable information provided by the creditor. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), if disputed information can not be verified, it must be deleted from the credit report. 
XXXX. Failure to Provide Documentation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ) ( 1 ), you are required to provide all information in the consumers file upon request. Despite my repeated demands, you have failed to provide : Proof of validation.

Documentation supporting the charge-off classification.

A copy of the 1099-C form required under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the debt has been canceled or forgiven. 
Your failure to produce these documents violates this provision. 

XXXX. Reporting Inaccurate and Inconsistent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 
XXXX has already removed this account as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inaccurately. This inconsistency among credit reporting agencies directly violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Further, if this account has been charged off, the balance must be reported as {$0.00}, as the creditor no longer considers it collectible. Reporting a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is both inaccurate and misleading.

4. Continuing to Report Unverifiable Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) You are required to delete any information that can not be verified within 30 days. It has been over 50 days since my initial dispute, and you have failed to provide proper validation.

This is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), as you continue to report unverifiable information despite my multiple requests.

5. Violation of Consumer Disclosure Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ), you are required to include a notation that an account is disputed. If this dispute notation is missing from my credit report, you are in violation of this provision.

6. Failure to Issue a 1099-C Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If this account was charged off and is considered forgiven or canceled, the creditor was required to issue a 1099-C form for debts exceeding {$600.00}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity of the charge-off and its reporting. 
XXXX. Violation of Permissible Purpose ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) If XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency can not produce signed contracts proving my authorization, the continued reporting of this account may constitute a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for reporting information. 
XXXX. Illegal Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) If the Date of First Delinquency ( DOFD ) on this account has been altered to make the debt appear newer than it is, this constitutes illegal re-aging.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ), negative accounts must be removed from credit reports after seven years from the XXXX. 
XXXX. Inadequate Explanation of Reinvestigation Results ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), credit reporting agencies are required to provide a description of the reinvestigation process and the procedure used to verify disputed information. Simply stating that the account was verified by the creditor without providing supporting documentation does not satisfy this requirement. 
Immediate Actions Required XXXX. Failure to Remove Data Breach-Related Accounts ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), I am entitled to request the removal of any account resulting from a data breach. I informed you that my information was compromised in a data breach, and this account is directly tied to the fraudulent use of my information. You have failed to comply with your obligation to remove this unverifiable and fraudulent account. 

XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), you are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and provide documentation verifying the accuracy of the account.

I requested authenticated double-entry accounting records, original signed contracts, and a 1099-C form if the debt was charged off, forgiven, or canceled. 
Your failure to produce this documentation demonstrates that the account can not be verified, making its continued reporting a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 
XXXX. Reporting Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information in consumer reports. 

XXXX has already removed this account from my credit file as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inconsistently. 
Additionally, if this account has been charged off, the balance must reflect {$0.00}. Reporting a non-zero balance is inaccurate and misleading, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). 
XXXX. Failure to Block Fraudulent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ) ) Under FACTA and 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ), you are required to block disputed information related to a data breach or identity theft within four business days after receiving evidence of the breach. Your failure to block or remove this account constitutes a violation of my rights under this provision.

XXXX. Failure to Provide Consumer Disclosures ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) I requested copies of all information related to the disputed account, including contracts, applications, and validation records, under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ). You have failed to provide these documents, violating my right to access information in my file. 

XXXX. Failure to Issue a 1099-C Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If the account has been charged off or canceled, XXXX XXXX XXXX was required to issue a 1099-C form to both me and the IRS for debts exceeding {$600.00}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity and accuracy of the charge-off and makes the reporting of this account fraudulent. 

XXXX. Violation of FTC Data Security Standards As part of my FTC complaint, I reported that my information was exposed in a data breach. Your continued failure to investigate or remove accounts linked to this breach constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under FTC standards, as well as a breach of your obligation to safeguard consumer data. 

Remove the Account : Since you have failed to provide proper validation, this account must be deleted from my credit report immediately in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ).

Update the Balance to {$0.00} : If you continue to report this account, it must reflect a {$0.00} balance, as required for charged-off accounts. 
Provide Validation Documentation : If you intend to continue reporting this account, provide the following within 10 days : Authenticated double-entry accounting records. 
Original signed agreements or contracts.

A copy of the 1099-C form, if applicable. 
Notice of Escalation If you fail to take the necessary corrective actions or provide proper documentation, I will escalate this matter by : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) for violations of the FCRA. 
Reporting the issue to the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) for failure to issue a 1099-C form.

Consulting with legal counsel to pursue claims for statutory and actual damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( willful noncompliance ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681o ( negligent noncompliance ).

I trust you will address this matter promptly and ensure compliance with your obligations under federal law. Please confirm the removal or correction of this account within 10 days.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.
