Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information present in my credit report, as furnished by your agency. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I request an immediate investigation into the following discrepancies and the removal of any unverifiable or incorrect data. This communication also serves as a pre-arbitration notice in the event that this matter is not resolved in accordance with applicable laws and consumer protections. 
Disputed Information : Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Discrepancies Identified : Multiple Entries : The same debt appears multiple times with slight variations in account numbers and details, which is misleading and potentially damaging. Status Inconsistencies : One entry lists the account as " Open, '' while another indicates it is " Closed, '' creating confusion about the actual status. Activity Dates : There are conflicting last activity dates between the entries, raising questions about the accuracy of the reported information. Lack of Payment History : The absence of payment history on these accounts does not provide a complete picture and may misrepresent my creditworthiness. Inconsistent Comments : Some entries lack detailed comments, while others include remarks such as " Account Seriously Past Due Date, '' leading to potential misinterpretation. Legal Basis for Dispute : Under the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information in their credit reports. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Mandates that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation if a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Requires the deletion or modification of information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable after reinvestigation. Additionally, case law such as Dalton v. Capital Associated Industries , Inc., 257 F.3d 409 ( 4th Cir. 2001 ), underscores the importance of reasonable reinvestigation by credit reporting agencies. Failure to comply with these standards may constitute a violation of the FCRA and open the agency to liability. Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed copies of my credit report highlighting the disputed entries, along with any relevant correspondence and documentation that support my claim. Please review these documents as part of your investigation. 

Pre-Arbitration and Litigation Notice : Should this dispute remain unresolved, I reserve the right to pursue remedies under arbitration or litigation. If an arbitration provision is applicable under any agreement between us, I will initiate arbitration proceedings. Be advised that arbitration may incur the following costs, which could become your responsibility in the event of an adverse decision against your agency : Filing Fees : Up to {$200.00}, per the rules of most arbitration forums, unless waived for financial hardship. Administrative Fees : Between {$750.00} and {$1500.00}, depending on the arbitration provider. Arbitrator Fees : Ranging from {$1500.00} to {$3500.00} or more for multi-session arbitrations. If no arbitration provision applies, I will pursue this matter through litigation, seeking all remedies provided under the FCRA, including but not limited to statutory damages, actual damages, punitive damages, and the reimbursement of attorneys fees and legal costs. 

Requested Action : I urge you to : Conduct a thorough investigation into the disputed entries. Delete or correct any information that is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation. Furnish me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting any changes made. 

Conclusion : Inaccurate information on my credit report can have serious implications for my financial well-being. I trust that you will address this matter with the urgency and diligence it requires, ensuring compliance with the FCRA and safeguarding my rights as a consumer. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within 30 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice Enclosures : Copy of credit report with disputed entries highlighted Supporting documents and correspondence Note : Please consider this letter as a formal pre-arbitration notice.

Please inform me of the resolution at your earliest convenience. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX This letter serves as formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), to cease all communication with me regarding the above-referenced account. This request applies to any and all forms of communication, including but not limited to telephone calls, text messages, emails, letters, and any other medium of communication. Additionally, this directive explicitly includes any communication via my consumer report, as defined by the term " communication '' within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 2 ).

As per the FDCPA, once a debt collector receives a written request to cease communication, they are required to comply, except to notify the consumer that further collection efforts are being terminated or that specific actions may be taken as allowed by law. Any further communication in violation of this request will be reported to the appropriate regulatory agencies, and I will pursue all available legal remedies. 

This letter is not to be construed as an acknowledgment or validation of any alleged debt. Please provide written confirmation that you have received and will comply with this cease-and-desist request. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : 2nd Request for Assistance Regarding Credit Bureau Non-Compliance with Consumer Laws To CFPB Representative, I am writing to convey my serious concerns and frustration regarding the credit bureaus continued failure to comply with their legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This ongoing issue has caused considerable emotional and financial strain, and I am hopeful that your office can assist in resolving this matter promptly. Understanding the Impact As a consumer, I expect that the credit bureaus will follow the law and act in good faith to ensure the accuracy of my credit report. Unfortunately, my recent experience has demonstrated the exact opposite. After filing multiple disputes regarding unauthorized and inaccurate accounts on my credit report, I have been met with repeated non-responses and a lack of follow-through. This has resulted in a growing sense of anxiety and frustration, as my creditworthiness continues to be impacted by errors that I can not control.

It is extremely disheartening to feel like the credit bureaus, entities entrusted with the responsibility of managing consumer credit, are ignoring or disregarding my rights. This situation has left me feeling powerless and as though my concerns are not being treated with the urgency and seriousness they deserve.

Request for Intervention and Assistance I understand that the CFPBs role is to ensure that credit bureaus adhere to consumer protection laws, and it is with this in mind that I humbly request your intervention.

Specifically, I am asking the CFPB to take action to ensure that credit bureaus are held accountable for their failure to : 1. Properly investigate my disputes within the legally required 30-day period under 15 U.S.C. 1681i of the FCRA.

2. Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the information reported, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

3. Take swift action to block fraudulent or unauthorized information on my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2.

The emotional toll of dealing with inaccurate credit reporting is often underestimated, but it is a real and ongoing burden that affects both my daily life and long-term financial stability. I sincerely hope that the CFPB can help ensure that credit bureaus fulfill their duties to consumers, providing a timely and fair resolution to this issue.

I am grateful for your time and attention to this matter, and I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to ensure that credit bureaus act in compliance with consumer protection laws. I look forward to your response and appreciate any guidance or support you can offer as I navigate this challenging situation.

Thank you for your understanding and for the work you do to protect consumers like me. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Deletion or Validation of Discrepancies Across Credit Reports XXXX XXXX  Account I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) across the three credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Experian ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : Reported as {$21000.00}, despite the account being closed since XXXX, with no verifiable explanation. 
2. Last Payment Date : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Experian : Not listed 3. Date of Last Activity : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX 4. Payment History : Ongoing late payments are reported in XXXX ( XXXX & Experian ), despite the account being charged off in XXXX. 
5. Dispute Status : XXXX : Account not disputed XXXX : Consumer disputes after resolution Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with. 
Their business address, name, and phone number.

3. Documentation proving the validity of the late payments and charge-off reporting.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by : 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information.

2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Manipulating the statute of limitations by updating old accounts with false late payments.

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 
2. Updated credit reports reflecting the removal of this account or corrected information.

Supporting Documentation : I am attaching : 1. Copies of my credit reports from XXXX, XXXX, and Experian, highlighting the discrepancies. 
2. Previous dispute letters sent to the credit bureaus. 
3. Any correspondence related to the XXXX XXXX account. 

Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and Experian for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, Experian used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : 3. Despite my dispute, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations. 

Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o Experian violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested.

o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation.

2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o Experian failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15
U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). 
o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputes and Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by Collection Agency I am filing this complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and Experian for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, Experian used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : 3. Despite my dispute, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations. 

Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o Experian violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested.

o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation. 
2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o Experian failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ). 
3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting XXXX  ( Report Number : XXXX ) Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate and misleading information being reported by XXXX  on my credit report. The details of the account are as follows : Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Repossession ( {$8100.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX ) Original Balance : {$18000.00} This account contains several inaccuracies and reporting issues that violate federal credit reporting standards. 

Grounds for Dispute : 1. Repossession Reporting : The account status indicates a repossession dating back to XX/XX/XXXX, yet the payment history lists ongoing repossession statuses through XX/XX/XXXX. This creates a misleading representation of the account. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, creditors are required to furnish accurate and consistent data.

2. Inconsistent Payment History : The payment history redundantly lists repossession for multiple months ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and prior months ), creating confusion and potential over-reporting of derogatory marks. This redundant reporting must be corrected. 

XXXX. Validation of Debt and Balance : The current balance of {$8100.00} is inconsistent with prior communications regarding the debt. XXXX has not provided adequate documentation to validate the amount owed, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

4. Failure to Correct Prior Dispute : This account was previously disputed, as noted in the reinvestigation details dated XX/XX/XXXX. However, XXXX failed to fully address or correct the inaccuracies identified in the dispute, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Requested Resolution : 1. Remove Duplicate Repossession Entries : Correct the payment history to eliminate redundant repossession statuses for months following the initial repossession in XX/XX/XXXX. 

2. Validate the Debt and Balance : Provide a detailed validation of the {$8100.00} balance, including a breakdown of charges, payments, and fees. If the debt can not be validated, delete the account entirely from my credit report.

3. Ensure Compliance with FCRA : Verify that all reporting related to this account complies with federal regulations, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ). 

4. Amend Credit Reporting : Update the accounts reporting to accurately reflect its status and remove any redundant or misleading information. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that DriveTime/Bridgecrest complies with its legal obligations. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates regarding your investigation. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Regarding Loan # XXXX serviced by " The Mr. Cooper Group '' formerly Nationstar Mortgage Company. I have been subjected to unfair practices since XX/XX/XXXX, when they acquired the mortgage from XXXX  XXXX XXXX. I have repeatedly been a victim of unfair practices from this company and its employees, I have fulfilled every request that they asked for, paid for all the trial modifications and submitted all required paperwork except for my ex-wife 's signature I am estranged from my ex-wife, and she has refused to communicate with me since she left the house in the year XXXX about 21 years ago. The Mr. Cooper Group falsely claimed that her signature was necessary for my loan modification. To my surprise it was not required, as evidenced by the guidelines of XXXX XXXX and clarified by the court decision in an order to show cause granted dated XXXX XXXX, by Honorable Judge XXXX XXXX XXXX , Index # XXXX. 
The court stated : " Here, Plaintiff has improperly interpreted XXXX XXXX guidelines, among other things, and erroneously refused to accept and approve the loan modification applications submitted by XXXX XXXX XXXX. Based on the foregoing, Plaintiff has not demonstrated its right to proceed with this case. '' The malicious business practices that " The Mr. Cooper Group '' has perpetrated, has made it exceedingly difficult for me to deal with. They are solely interested in foreclosing on my home. I have attached numerous complaints and lawsuits and class action lawsuits that The Cooper Group, formerly Nationstar Mortgage, has accumulated over the years.

My concern is that The Mr. Cooper Group has consistently claimed to have not received my applications and other correspondences through mail, fax, or website uploads, and has imposed unfair fees as a result. I have attached all supporting documents stating thecontrary. After this, I also requested extra time to gather all the required documents. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, The Mr. Cooper Group scheduled my residence for auction without proper cause or proper jurisdiction ( see attached court order ). They failed to notify me of the sale, which is a violation of my rights. Supporting documents prove that I have sent the applications through various means on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, including faxes, website upload attempts, and The Mr. Cooper XXXX website messages. 

To compound matters, in a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, The Mr. Cooper Group stated, " We found that our prior reviews for modification assistance do not show that we requested XXXX XXXX ' Signature for a workout assistance. Our records show that XXXX XXXX has not accepted an approved request for modification assistance previously. '' This is totally false. I made every good faith attempting to rectify this situation dating back to year XXXX until the present ( even through XXXX shutdowns ). Look at all the documents attached stating the contrary. 

Besides wrongfully denying my numerous loan modification applications along with what appears to be unnecessary assorted fees, Mr. Cooper now has come up with another underhanded tactic in order to frustrate me concerning my latest application. The Mr. Cooper Group required me to provide a profit and loss statement about my business. I provided The Mr. Cooper Group with the profit and loss statement for the time period requested. It was submitted in printed form. with the exhibits along with the XX/XX/XXXX, The Mr. Cooper Group letter and Mr. Cooper 's XXXX XXXX, letter concerning the profit a loss statement submitted in response to the XX/XX/XXXX letter. I was told by The Mr. Cooper Group that they were not accepting my profit and loss statement as submitted. Instead, if you can believe it, The Mr. Cooper Group told me I have to submit the profit and loss statement in handwritten form. This is just another absurd example of the tactics used by The Mr. Cooper Group to frustrate me at every step in the application process.

15 U.S. Code 1681 c-2 a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identify theft, not later than 4 business days after the date receipt. It has been 30 days, and you are in VIOLATION of this law because I am a victim of identity theft! Please delete these items IMMEDIATELY!

These Accounts should not be furnished in my consumer report as they are in VIOLATION!!! Under, 15 U.S. code 1681b-Permissible purpose of a consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other. ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protect consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTIFY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for a new Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. It was approved on line for only {$1700.00}. I expected at least a {$10000.00} credit line and searched on line for a customer service phone number. After calling that number ( XXXX ) their response was that I had to, first, finish a request for a free gift worth {$200.00}. I repeatedly told them my issue and that I did NOT want a free gift. After some badgering and bullying, I finally relented, was passed off to another call and they wanted some other info, including a checking account number and the bank name and routing number. After some argumentation, I reluctantly and finally gave them that info. They gave me a code number to give back to the previous caller to complete the " verification ''. When passed back to him, he asked for the code. I changed my mind and hung up on him. It just didn't feel right. I looked up the number I called and finally traced it to : XXXX XXXX, XXXX TX, which SEEMED legit. It still seemed fishy. So in order to precisely protect our check acct., I called my bank 's Fraud Hotline. We came up with/ this solution : 1. Block the checking account from ANY DEBIT TRANSACTIONS. 2. open a new checking account in person ( it'll have a DIFFERENT acct. number ). 3. Transfer all money to the new acct., and 4. completely close the old account. Meanwhile advise any company involved w/ deposits or debits of the new account number. I thank God for urging me to call the bank fraud line. I DO know better than to EVER give out bank and/or checking account info. I was just badgered HARD to relent so I could get answers to my credit limit inquiry. MY OPINION : Scammers " faked '' a website, under Bank of America 's name, that gave me a bad phone number for customer service. They likely " stole '' the ( XXXX ) XXXX number from XXXX XXXX, XXXX TX and disguised it for their fraudulent purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : REQUEST TO REMOVE UNAUTHORIZED CREDIT INQUIRY Inquiry made by : Capital One Bank Inquiry made on : XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to dispute the following information in my file I recently received a copy of my credit report and I notice there is an authorized credit inquiry Made by the company listed above. To my knowledge I have not signed any documents authorizing the company in question to view my credit report. The listed inquiry was without authorization and for no legitimate business purposes. As such it is very serious error in reporting. I never authorized such Action and this constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act 604 as well as a violation of my rights to privacy. I am requesting your credit bureau to initiate an investigation and to determine responsible parties in this unauthorized credit inquiry. As part of your investigation please send the names, business addresses, and phone numbers of those who made the unauthorized credit inquiries so I may contact them directly. In addition I respectfully request a copy of any documents authorizing credit inquiry, and signed on my behalf so that I may verify its validity.

If you find that I was not the one who authorized this inquiry I ask that it be removed immediately from my credit file. Please be kind as to forward me documents that you have had the Authorized inquiry removed. If you find thats its a error please show proof to me. Finally, I am requesting an updated copy of my Report, which should be sent to the address listed above. According to the provisions 612 ( 15USC 1681j ) there should be no charge for this report. 

Your immediate attention to this matter is appreciated. 

Sincerely XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint & Dispute Inconsistent Reversal Notifications, Resulting Late Fees, and Damaged Credit To Whom It May Concern at the CFPB and Capital One : I am writing in reference to my Capital One Platinum Card ( account ending in XXXX ) to formally dispute the negative outcomes stemming from multiple reversed payments in XXXX and XX/XX/year>. While Capital One has claimed these reversals resulted from Insufficient Funds, my core contention is that Capital One failed to provide consistent or timely returned payment notifications, depriving me of the ability to promptly address any account shortfall or technical issue.

Background : Payment Attempts & Reversals XX/XX/year> {$68.00} payment, reversed on or about XX/XX/XXXX I did eventually receive a returned email noticethough it arrived days later, after late fees were assessed. 
XX/XX/year> {$68.00} payment, reversed on or about XX/XX/XXXX I did receive a reversal email on XX/XX/XXXX, which was again post-late-fee, preventing me from rectifying the situation in a timely manner. 
XX/XX/year> {$120.00} payment, reversed on XX/XX/XXXX I have no record whatsoever of any returned payment email or notification. 
XX/XX/year> {$570.00} payment, reversed on XX/XX/XXXX I also have no returned payment notice for this reversal. 
In each case, I did receive emails about the payment being scheduled and posted, which reasonably led me to believe the payments cleared successfully. Without a prompt reversal notice, I was unaware the account remained unpaidleading to late fees, negative credit reporting, and the eventual closure of my account. 
Why This Is Unfair ( UDAAP & Regulation Z Concerns ) Inconsistent Notifications : Capital Ones own patternsometimes sending a reversal email days late, sometimes sending none at allconstitutes inadequate disclosure.

Unfair & Deceptive Acts or Practices ( UDAAP ) : Consumers must be clearly informed if a payment is reversed so they can take corrective action. Failing to do so, or doing so inconsistently, causes avoidable harm ( late fees and credit damage ).

Regulation Z ( Truth in Lending ) : Requires that changes to a credit account ( including reversed payments leading to a past due status ) be disclosed in a timely, clear manner. If I never received or only belatedly received these notices, that disclosure obligation was not met.

Financial Ability & Willingness to Pay Ample Funds : I have provided XXXX  XXXX XXXX statements ( and other documents ) proving I had the financial means to cover these payments. Even if there was a legitimate NSF on the specific linked account, I had more than enough funds in my broader finances to rectify any shortfall immediatelyif only I had been notified. 
No Intent to Default : My payment history across multiple accounts shows I am not in the habit of missing payments. These reversals were entirely unexpected due to the lack of timely communication from Capital One. 

Negative Outcomes Late Fees & Interest : Imposed because I inadvertently remained past due, unaware the payments were reversed.

Damaged Credit : Late/missed payment reporting to the credit bureaus negatively impacted my credit score.

Account Closure : Capital One ultimately closed my account, citing business concerns allegedly unrelated to my creditworthinessyet it was triggered by the repeated returned payments.

Requested Resolution Removal/Correction of Negative Credit Entries Because these negative marks arose from inadequate or missing notifications, I request that Capital One correct my credit reports, removing any late-payment notations connected to the reversed payments.

Refund of Late Fees & Interest I ask that all late fees and interest charges stemming from these reversals be refunded or credited, as I was not given a fair opportunity to remedy the situation.

Documentation of Email Notices I request a comprehensive timeline from Capital One showing each date/time they claim a returned payment email was sent, along with any proof ( e.g., server logs or headers ) demonstrating successful delivery.

Reinstatement of Account ( If Applicable ) If possible, I ask Capital One to consider reinstating my account ( under normal terms ) given that these past-due incidents were precipitated by faulty or late communicationnot an unwillingness or inability to pay.

Conclusion and Complaint Summary My chief complaint : Capital Ones inconsistent reversal notification process caused me to unknowingly remain delinquent, incurring fees and negative credit marks. Had I received timely, reliable notices of these reversals, I would have promptly covered any shortfall from my ample financial resources. I strongly believe this situation constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under UDAAP and violates the spirit of Regulation Zs disclosure requirements.

I respectfully request that both the CFPB and Capital One review this matter carefully. I look forward to a fair resolution that acknowledges the communication failures in reversing my payments and restores my account standing and credit file to an accurate, fair state. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, TN XXXX XXXX | XXXX Email associated with capital one account : XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an account by CAPITAL ONE BANK USA XXXXn my credit report, which I believe is inaccurate. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 USC 1692c ( c ), I am requesting the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. On [ XX/XX/year>, I sent a written request to CAPITAL ONE BANK USA requesting that they cease all communications with me regarding the alleged debt. This written request was made pursuant to 15 USC 1692c ( c ), which clearly states that a debt collector must cease communication with a consumer once a request is made in writing to do so, except in certain circumstances ( such as to notify the consumer of legal actions being taken ). Since I have exercised my right to request that CAPITAL ONE BANK USA cease communication, I believe that the continued reporting of this account on my credit report is in violation of the law. As a result, I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and assist in removing this account from my credit file. I would greatly appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm in writing that this dispute has been received and is under investigation. If you require any further documentation or information from me, do not hesitate to contact me. Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX I am writing to formally dispute your claim of ownership and collection rights over the debt associated with the account in question. After conducting a thorough review of the records pertaining to this account, I have identified the following issues : Transfer of Debt to Capital One XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) and Capital One XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX  ) : I have clear and indisputable evidence that the debt in question was transferred to the Capital One XXXX XXXX under reporting file number XXXX. As such, ownership of this debt was legally transferred to the trust, and there is no record indicating that it was subsequently reassigned or transferred back to you. Therefore, you no longer have the legal standing to collect on this debt. 

Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued reporting of this debt under your name is a direct violation of the FCRA. Reporting inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies undermines the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile, causing unnecessary harm to my financial standing. 

I am formally requesting that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this debt and ensure that all references to this debt are removed from my credit reports with all consumer reporting agencies. Failure to comply with this request may leave me with no choice but to pursue legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and any other applicable laws. 

Please confirm in writing within 30 days of receiving this letter that : You have ceased all collection activities related to this account. 

All references to this debt have been removed from my credit reports. 

If you believe this matter requires further clarification or documentation, please contact me in writing at the address provided above. I expect your prompt attention to this matter and resolution in accordance with applicable laws. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't work with you while you're going through financial hardship
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Bank of America 's financial assistance department to renew my financial hardship agreement, which is set to expire on XX/XX/XXXX. During the call, one of their phone agents informed me that my account was four months delinquent and that the financial hardship agreement I entered into on XX/XX/XXXX, had never been approved. This news shocked me, as my past due amount had grown to over {$1400.00}.

When I entered into the financial hardship agreement on XX/XX/XXXX I was in good standing. Under this agreement : I was to pay XXXX XXXX  monthly for six months on the XXXX  of each month at 0 % interest. 
The monthly payments were to be deducted automatically from my checking account. 
I agreed not to use my BofA Visa card for the duration of the agreement.

I also received a confirmation letter outlining the terms of the agreement.

I had followed all of these terms. However, the agent could not explain how my account became delinquent despite the automatic withdrawals I had authorized. He apologized for the inconvenience, stated he did not know why it was not approved after the agreement had already been issued, and offered me a new financial assessment instead of a resolution.

I pushed for answers, explaining that I had made all the required payments on time and had never been notified that there were any issues. I had even called Bank of America twice since entering into the agreement, and neither time did either of the phone agents mention any problems with my account. Specifically in XX/XX/XXXX, I called to ask if I could pay more than my monthly {$140.00}. I initially reached the outgoing BofA recording stating my balance and became alarmed upon hearing that my account was past due. I expressed concern when I was eventually connected to an agent and asked her if this was true, explaining that I had recently been put on a payment plan. She told me the recording was likely an error and confirmed my payments were current and my account was in good standing.

On my XX/XX/XXXX call, I told the first agent I spoke with that I had received a letter in XX/XX/XXXX outlining the agreements terms, as well as a letter received on XX/XX/XXXX, stating my final payment would be due on XX/XX/XXXX ( the latter being the catalyst for my phone call ). Yet, Bank of America failed to notify me that the hardship agreement had not been approved or inform me that my account had become past due ( despite my previous two calls to the bank ). Neither agent on XX/XX/XXXX asked me to verify my contact information to see why I had not received any notifications regarding the status of my account or the change in status of my financial hardship agreement. 

Additionally, I told the agent that I had lived up to my side of the agreement in terms of not using my BofA XXXX. In fact, I had even let my card expire because I was so adamant about not breaching my part of the agreement with BofA. The agent asked me if I received a notification about my credit card being canceled and I thought it was because my credit card was expiring so I disregarded it. I was determined to not use this card and use this opportunity to pay down my debt with a 0 % interest rate until XXXX, XXXX. 

During my call on XX/XX/XXXX, the first agent conducted a financial assessment, but the call was subsequently disconnected. I called back and was connected to a different agent, who explained that they could not identify the prior agent and did not keep records of who handled my call. 

The second agent reviewed my case and concluded that the agent who had set up my financial hardship agreement in XXXX acted in error. She explained that the agent did not have the authority to issue the agreement and should have offered financial counseling instead. At this point, I was in disbelief. I had lived up to my end of the agreement, only to discover that the agreement with BofA was never valid and my account had accumulated interest, finance charges, and late fees over the past XXXX months. Furthermore, my past due amount had ballooned to over {$1400.00}. 

This agent asked if I wanted to proceed with another new financial assessment. In tears, I agreed. After placing me on hold several times, she returned with XXXX options : Pay 80 % of my total balance ( approximately {$11000.00} ) by XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX months from now ). I explained that being on XXXX leave and not currently working, I could not afford to pay this much money in this timeframe while I was paying a mortgage and not earning an income. It seemed like lunacy to even suggest this as an option. 

Credit counseling I was given a phone number, and when I asked who the credit counseling service was, the agent only said that BofA worked with several different credit counseling services. It was ambiguous who I would be working with, and I was suspicious if they would have my best interest at XXXX or would try to exploit me again, as I was already feeling quite vulnerable from my financial hardship agreement not being honored. 

When I asked if there was anything Bank of America could do for me immediately, she suggested I call back in a few days or later in the month. This response was confusing : why would Bank XXXX XXXX hardship protocol change in a matter of days? What are the variables? What determined the threshold? 

In frustration and out of fear, I paid $ XXXX months worth of paymentsover the phone using money from my savings account which I use to pay my mortgage. Despite this, my account remains delinquent, and I owe a past-due amount that I can not afford at this time. If BofA had honored the agreement it made with me on XX/XX/XXXX, my account would be current, as all monthly payments we agreed upon have been withdrawn automatically from my account each month. 

I firmly believe Bank XXXX XXXX actions constitute a bait-and-switch tactic, a conflict of interest, or, at best, gross negligence and exploitation. Bank of America continued to charge interest, finance charges, and late fees while withdrawing the agreed-upon {$140.00} payments from my account. I was not notified, warned, or given any opportunity to rectify the situation until it was too late. I am requesting that BofA honor the original agreement set up on XX/XX/XXXX and refund me the late fees and finance charges incurred as a result of their error. I also request that my credit report be adjusted to reflect no delinquency on my part. Consumers deserve transparency, fair treatment, and good-faith agreements when seeking financial assistance

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XX/XX/year>, I have been disputing fraudulent and inaccurate items on my credit reports with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. Despite multiple identity theft reports and disputes, the credit bureaus continue to add incorrect items, remove them, and then add them back without my consent. This constant manipulation of my credit file violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), including 15 U.S. Code 1681s ( Duty of Fairness and Accuracy ), 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Noncompliance ), and 15 U.S. Code 1692 ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ). 

Additionally, these actions appear to involve the unauthorized use and monetization of my personal data, potentially implicating the private securities market. I have requested a forensic securities audit to further investigate this matter. 

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate these violations and take appropriate action. I am also seeking compensation for damages from the credit bureaus totaling {$50000.00} each for their negligence and violations of my rights.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative: I am on the SAVE repayment plan with MOHELA for my federal student loans. On XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from MOHELA informing me that my loans were placed in a forbearance due to a judicial stay from a federal lawsuit. The letter stated that the interest would not accrue during the forbearance. However, my loans have continued to accrue interest. On XX/XX/scrub>XXXX I received another letter from MOHELA informing me that interest has been accruing and will continue to accrue while placed on this forbearance. Although the letter states that my interest rate is 0 %, interest has continue to accrue on my loans. I currently have interest on my loans because of this. Additionally, I have made payments since the forbearance started so I have already paid some interest because those payments were put toward the interest that erroneously accrued. MOHELA has not resolved this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request the deletion of inaccurate, re-inserted, and fraudulent late payments present on my consumer credit report and to bring to your attention the failure of XXXX XXXX to provide the necessary proof of the accuracy of the alleged late payments within the stipulated time frame of 30 days. I have previously sent certified dispute letters to these companies to rectify my credit report 's inaccuracies and ensure compliance with the FCRA. Still, this company has yet to respond to me with verifiable documentary proof of the accuracy of these late payments. Thirty days went by I received nothing from this company and these late payments were reinserted with no permissible purpose and without my consent. 

As outlined in the FCRA, failure to provide documented and verifiable proof within the specified time frame obligates the removal of unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. Despite the receipt of my dispute letter and the lapse of 30 days, XXXX XXXX has not provided the requested proof nor rectified the inaccuracies in the reported information. They didnt respond to me at all and therefore by law, I'm demanding the deletion of these late payments on my credit report immediately. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX claimed to have completed a reasonable investigation with the furnisher of information and verified the late payments listed below as reporting 100 % accurately. However, these late payments are still inaccurate and are continuing to report errors on my credit file, violating my rights and damaging my credit score at the same time. According to The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the information on a consumer 's credit report should be consistent across all three bureaus, as creditors and lenders may use any of the three to check a consumer 's credit history. XXXX XXXX did not remove the inaccurate late payments furnished on my consumer file, and I have never given my consent to re-insert or furnish these late payments. No consent is Identity Theft. 

I formally request TRANSUNION and XXXX to update these late payments to paid on time never late on my credit report, as per the provisions of the FCRA. The failure of these companies to validate the inaccuracies within the statutory timeframe signifies their non-compliance with federal regulations and warrants the removal of the disputed accounts. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681b- Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) by the WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federally protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer, I am demanding the deletion of the unauthorized accounts and inquiries listed IMMEDIATELY!

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report and no other : By the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

15 U.S.C 1666b ( a ) A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Deletion or Validation of Discrepancies Across Credit Reports XXXXXXXX XXXX Account I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) across the three credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature.

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : Reported as {$21000.00}, despite the account being closed since XXXX, with no verifiable explanation. 
2. Last Payment Date : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Not listed 3. Date of Last Activity : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX 4. Payment History : Ongoing late payments are reported in XXXX ( XXXX & XXXX ), despite the account being charged off in XXXX. 
5. Dispute Status : TransUnion : Account not disputed XXXX : Consumer disputes after resolution Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with.

Their business address, name, and phone number.

3. Documentation proving the validity of the late payments and charge-off reporting.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by : 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information.

2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Manipulating the statute of limitations by updating old accounts with false late payments.

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 
2. Updated credit reports reflecting the removal of this account or corrected information.

Supporting Documentation : I am attaching : 1. Copies of my credit reports from TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX, highlighting the discrepancies. 
2. Previous dispute letters sent to the credit bureaus.

3. Any correspondence related to the XXXX XXXX account. 

Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute Regarding Price Change and Use of MVR and Insurance Score To Whom It May Concern : I am submitting this dispute to address concerns about a price change for my insurance policy based on information obtained from my Motor Vehicle Record ( MVR ) and credit history ( insurance score ). Below are the details of the issue and my request for clarification and resolution : Details of the Dispute 1. Motor Vehicle Record ( MVR ) : I was informed that my rate was updated based on driver-history details, including a record of an incident dated XX/XX/year> ( Failure to yield, stop, comply, or yield to pedestrian ). 
I am requesting a detailed explanation of how this information impacted my rate, given that the incident occurred over three years ago. 

2. Insurance Score and Credit History : My insurance score was cited as a factor in determining my revised premium. 
I understand that my score was obtained from TransUnion Corporation ( Consumer Relations Disclosure Center ). 
The notice indicated that TransUnion does not determine my premium and can not explain the pricing decision. However, I am seeking clarity on the specific factors from my credit report that contributed to the change. 

3. Transparency and Compliance : The notice stated, Take note that your Final Price is subject to underwriting verification. However, it did not adequately explain the specific underwriting criteria used to determine the rate change. 
I am concerned about the transparency of how my information was used and whether this decision complies with the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

My Requests : 1. A detailed explanation of how my MVR and insurance score specifically influenced the price revision.

2. Verification of the accuracy of the information used in determining my premium.

3. Confirmation that the companys actions comply with all relevant laws, including the FCRA.

4. Guidance on how to correct or dispute any inaccuracies with the reporting agencies involved. 

I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. I have also requested a copy of my consumer report from TransUnion to verify the accuracy of the information they provided. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Credit Inquiries What Happened? 
I previously submitted an official complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries appearing on my credit report. The complaint was filed on XXXX XXXX, under FTC Reference Number XXXX. 
Complaint Description : My credit report reflects unauthorized inquiries that were made without my explicit consent. I have contacted the creditors responsible for these inquiries, and they have confirmed they possess no evidenceneither written nor verbalthat I authorized or initiated these inquiries. This clear lack of valid authorization constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
I have formally demanded the immediate removal of these inquiries, as they are baseless and negatively impact my credit profile. However, the credit bureau in question has failed to provide a satisfactory resolution or appropriate action. This failure to address unauthorized inquiries prompted me to escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the FTC. I urge the immediate removal of these illegitimate inquiries to ensure compliance with federal regulations and to restore the integrity of my credit report. 

Details of Disputed Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I have attached a copy of the formal complaint submitted to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) to further support this claim. This document highlights the absence of my authorization for these inquiries and underscores the insufficient response provided by the credit bureau, reinforcing my request for the immediate removal of these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report. 
Formal Request : I am formally requesting a thorough and manual investigation of the disputed inquiries and their removal if there is no verifiable documentation. I reserve the right to take legal action and file an additional complaint with the CFPB and my state 's Attorney General. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX.

This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting XXXX  ( Report Number : XXXX ) Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate and misleading information being reported by XXXX  on my credit report. The details of the account are as follows : Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Repossession ( {$8100.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX ) Original Balance : {$18000.00} This account contains several inaccuracies and reporting issues that violate federal credit reporting standards. 

Grounds for Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX : The account status indicates a repossession dating back to XX/XX/XXXX, yet the payment history lists ongoing repossession statuses through XX/XX/XXXX. This creates a misleading representation of the account. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, creditors are required to furnish accurate and consistent data.

2. Inconsistent Payment History : The payment history redundantly lists repossession for multiple months ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and prior months ), creating confusion and potential over-reporting of derogatory marks. This redundant reporting must be corrected. 

3. Validation of Debt and Balance : The current balance of {$8100.00} is inconsistent with prior communications regarding the debt. XXXX has not provided adequate documentation to validate the amount owed, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

4. Failure to Correct Prior Dispute : This account was previously disputed, as noted in the reinvestigation details dated XX/XX/XXXX. However, XXXX failed to fully address or correct the inaccuracies identified in the dispute, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Requested Resolution : 1. Remove Duplicate Repossession Entries : Correct the payment history to eliminate redundant repossession statuses for months following the initial repossession in XX/XX/XXXX. 

2. Validate th

e Debt and Balance : Provide a detailed validation of the {$8100.00} balance, including a breakdown of charges, payments, and fees. If the debt can not be validated, delete the account entirely from my credit report. 3. Ensure Compliance with FCRA : Verify tha
t all reporting related to this account complies with federal regulations, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ).

4. Amend Credit Reporting : Update the accounts reporting to accurately reflect its status and remove any redundant or misleading information.

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that DriveTime/Bridgecrest complies with its legal obligations. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates regarding your investigation. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX across the three credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : [ Insert Account Number ] Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : TransUnion & XXXX : {$5400.00} XXXX : {$5300.00} Discrepancy : Conflicting balances across credit bureaus.

2. Date of Last Activity : TransUnion & XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Discrepancy : The conflicting dates indicate inaccurate and inconsistent reporting.

3. Last Payment Date : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Not reported. 
Discrepancy : Inconsistent last payment dates among bureaus.

4. Payment Status : TransUnion XXXX XXXX : Collection/Chargeoff XXXX  : Late XXXX  Days Discrepancy : Differing payment statuses create confusion about the true state of the account.

5. Dispute Status : TransUnion & XXXX : Account not disputed XXXX : Consumer disputes- reinvestigation in progress Discrepancy : Conflicting information on whether or not the account is currently disputed.

6. Credit Limit : All three bureaus report a credit limit of {$3600.00}, yet the high balance exceeds this limit, raising questions about the accuracy of reporting.

Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with.

Their business address, name, and phone number.

3. Documentation proving the validity of the account balance, payment history, and charge-off status.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by
: 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information.

2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Falsely reporting payment activity and account status.

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 


Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Case No. XXXX ) The information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX/ Balance : $ XXXX Opened : XXXX. XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Balance : $ XXXX Opened : XXXX XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX Balance : XXXX XXXX Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$840.00} /Opened : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX / Identity Theft It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. There has been no legal proof of the marks has been provided or proven. I have reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the supporting documents, including the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. This unauthorized reporting has negatively impacted my credit standing. I respectfully request that the FTC, FDIC, & CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that the erroneous and derogatory information is removed from my credit report. I am also pursuing complaints at federal levels to address these violations because my consumer rights have been violated and belittled.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute of Credit Reporting XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint and dispute regarding inaccurate and misleading information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report. The information provided below does not accurately reflect the circumstances of my account, and I am requesting your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring compliance with federal credit reporting laws. 

Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan ( Joint Responsibility with XXXX XXXX ) Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Reported Status : Charged off ( {$16000.00} written off ; {$16000.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ) Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Grounds for Dispute : 1. Charge-Off Reporting : The charge-off and balance information ( {$16000.00} ) is being reported inaccurately. Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, creditors are required to report only accurate and verifiable information. I have not received sufficient validation for this debt or evidence justifying the charge-off amount. 

2. Repossession Reporting : The account history indicates a repossession in XX/XX/XXXX, but the vehicle was redeemed. Per UCC 9, Part 6, repossessions followed by redemption must not continue to be reported inaccurately. 

3. Duplicate Reporting of Negative Events : The account history redundantly lists late payments, repossession, and charge-off statuses from XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  through XX/XX/XXXX. These entries appear to overlap and create an unfair representation of the accounts status. 

4. Compliance with FCRA and Investigation Obligations : I previously disputed this account, as noted in the comment section of my credit report. However, the reinvestigation completed in XX/XX/XXXX failed to address all errors comprehensively, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. 

Requested Resolution : 1. Delete the inaccurate charge-off reporting and balance information.

2. Remove the repossession entry, as the vehicle was redeemed, per applicable law.

3. Ensure compliance with federal regulations, including proper validation of the debt and correction of redundant and inaccurate reporting. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in ensuring that XXXX XXXX XXXX complies with its obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related statutes. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates regarding the investigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX is inaccurately reporting an account on my credit report, despite the same account being removed from both XXXX and XXXX due to inaccuracies or unverifiability. XXXX has failed to properly investigate my dispute and continues to report the account on TransUnion, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This inconsistent reporting is damaging to my creditworthiness. The account in question has already been removed by XXXX and XXXX, indicating its inaccuracy or lack of verifiability. However, it remains on TransUnion. 
XXXX has claimed the account is being reported correctly but has failed to address the discrepancies across credit bureaus. 
I have requested a reasonable investigation as required by Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA, but XXXX has failed to resolve the inaccuracies. 
Laws Violated : FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must report information with maximum possible accuracy.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers must ensure the accuracy of the data provided to credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) : XXXX failed to conduct a reasonable investigation into my dispute. 
CFPA ( Consumer Financial Protection Act ) : XXXX 's refusal to correct inaccurate data may constitute unfair and deceptive practices.

attached you will find a copy of my most recent utility bill for proof of address, my id, my social security car, a screenshot of the account removal from XXXX, a copy of my FTC complaint and my formal letter with the complaint

Consumer complaint narrative: District Court for Northern District of Georgia XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Customer Data Security Breach Litigation ; Case XXXX I am filing CFPB complaint against Trans Union for fraudulent accounts that have appeared on my credit report. I have been stressing to Trans Union that these accounts are a result of Identity Theft stemming from XXXX XXXX XXXX. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. The erroneous, fraudulent accounts are : Fraud Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ; Balance : {$26000.00} The listed accounts are not mine, never been authorized by me, and are frivolous, I am being harassed, and I demand the fraudulent items listed to be removed, or I will hire an attorney and proceed with legal ramifications. Trans Union continues to badger, bully me. I need verifiable proof of these credit transactions were not initiated by me, as well as proof of identity to confirm who applied for these frivolous debts. I know my consumer rights under Federal laws. I have attached a copy of proof from FTC Identity Theft Complaint. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), s15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you immediately : Block and remove all fraudulent information from my credit file ; notify any third parties to whom this fraudulent information may have been reported ; and provide confirmation in writing that the requested changes have been made to my credit report. I certify under penalty of perjury that the information provided in this notice and its attachments is accurate I will seek legal actions, for violating my consumer rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, D.C. XXXX Subject : 2nd Request for Assistance Regarding Credit Bureau Non-Compliance with Consumer Laws To CFPB Representative, I am writing to convey my serious concerns and frustration regarding the credit bureaus continued failure to comply with their legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This ongoing issue has caused considerable emotional and financial strain, and I am hopeful that your office can assist in resolving this matter promptly. 
Understanding the Impact As a consumer, I expect that the credit bureaus will follow the law and act in good faith to ensure the accuracy of my credit report. Unfortunately, my recent experience has demonstrated the exact opposite. After filing multiple disputes regarding unauthorized and inaccurate accounts on my credit report, I have been met with repeated non-responses and a lack of follow-through. This has resulted in a growing sense of XXXX  and frustration, as my creditworthiness continues to be impacted by errors that I can not control. 

It is extremely disheartening to feel like the credit bureaus, entities entrusted with the responsibility of managing consumer credit, are ignoring or disregarding my rights. This situation has left me feeling powerless and as though my concerns are not being treated with the urgency and seriousness they deserve. 

Request for Intervention and Assistance I understand that the CFPBs role is to ensure that credit bureaus adhere to consumer protection laws, and it is with this in mind that I humbly request your intervention. Specifically, I am asking the CFPB to take action to ensure that credit bureaus are held accountable for their failure to : 1. Properly investigate my disputes within the legally required 30-day period under 15 U.S.C. 1681i of the FCRA.

2. Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the information reported, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

3. Take swift action to block fraudulent or unauthorized information on my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. 

The emotional toll of dealing with inaccurate credit reporting is often underestimated, but it is a real and ongoing burden that affects both my daily life and long-term financial stability. I sincerely hope that the CFPB can help ensure that credit bureaus fulfill their duties to consumers, providing a timely and fair resolution to this issue. 

Conclusion I am grateful for your time and attention to this matter, and I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to ensure that credit bureaus act in compliance with consumer protection laws. I look forward to your response and appreciate any guidance or support you can offer as I navigate this challenging situation. 

Thank you for your understanding and for the work you do to protect consumers like me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act this creditor has violated my rights under 15 USC 1681 Section 702 states I have the right to privacy ( 15USC 1681 Section 604a Section 2 ) It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions under 15 USCS 1666b a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose.

I have not given permission for these inquiries and therefore, they are in violation of mg rights under the FCRA. I am demanding that these inquiries be removed from my credit report without delay. Under Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute and request the removal of any inquiries that were not authorized by me.
