Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as a natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft, I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law.

This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy rights.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately Addresses, Collections, Inquires, Names, Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX  These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to dispute and request an update to my personal information in your records. I recently obtained a copy of my credit report and discovered that some of the personal information listed is inaccurate or outdated. I kindly request that you investigate and make the necessary updates to ensure the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile. 

Please find below the specific details of the incorrect or outdated information : 1. Name : My current legal name is XXXX XXXX XXXX, but it is listed incorrectly on my credit report as XXXX XXXX XXXX. I request that my name be updated to reflect the correct information. 

2. Address : My current residential address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX, but my credit report shows an outdated address as [ Old Address ]. I request that my current address be updated accordingly. 

3. Contact Information : The phone number listed on my credit report, XXXX, is no longer in use. I request that my new phone number, [ Your Current Phone Number ], be updated as my primary contact number. 

I have enclosed copies of supporting documents to verify the accurate information provided above. The documents include : A copy of my SSN or passport displaying my correct name. 
A recent utility bill or bank statement showing my current address. 
A copy of my phone bill or any other official document that displays my correct phone number. 

Additionally, please provide me with a written confirmation once the updates have been made, and send me an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the changes. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Should you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at [ Your Phone Number ] or via email at [ Your Email Address ]. Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> To : TRANSUNION XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX Subject : Request for Removal of Unverifiable Late Payment and Update of Credit Report Dear TRANSUNION I am writing to formally notify you of a recent update to my credit report and to request the removal of an unverifiable late payment from my file. My name is XXXX XXXX, and I have been actively monitoring my credit reports. I recently disputed a late payment on my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year>, which was fully investigated and resolved by XXXX. On XX/XX/year>, XXXX removed the disputed late payment from my report after concluding that it was inaccurate and unverifiable. 

As a result of this update, I respectfully request that you review my credit report, specifically the account in question, and remove the unverifiable late payment that is currently being reported by your bureau. If XXXX has deemed the late payment to be unverifiable and has removed it from my credit report, the same logic should apply to your investigation of this account. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information on their credit reports. Specifically, Section 1681i of the FCRA requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation when a dispute is made and to remove any information that can not be verified. If the late payment in question is not verifiable, it must be removed from my credit file.

Moreover, under Section 1681e ( b ) of the FCRA, credit bureaus are required to maintain accurate and up-to-date information on consumer credit reports. If any information is found to be unverifiable, it is in violation of my rights as a consumer, and I am entitled to have it removed.

I kindly request that you remove this unverifiable late payment from my credit report within 30 days from the receipt of this letter. Failure to do so will result in further action, including but not limited to filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and taking legal action, including potential claims under the FCRA, for failing to comply with my rights to accurate credit reporting.

If the late payment is not removed within 30 days, I will be forced to explore all available legal options, including filing a lawsuit for damages related to the inaccurate reporting. Under the FCRA, consumers are entitled to seek statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorney fees for violations of the Act.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide me with a response within the required 30-day period. I expect your prompt attention to this matter and trust you will comply with the law.

Thank you for your time and cooperation. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- Consumer Rights and Relevant Laws : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C . 1681 : Protects consumers by ensuring the accuracy and privacy of information in credit reports.

FCRA Section 1681i : Ensures that disputed information is investigated, and any unverifiable information is removed from the consumers credit report.

FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : Requires credit bureaus to maintain accurate and up-to-date information.

Potential Legal Action : If the credit bureaus do not comply, you can pursue legal action for damages under the FCRA.

Recently, I did an investigatio

n on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

I am writing to file a complaint against this credit reporting agency for persistently reporting inaccurate information despite my repeated attempts to dispute and correct the errors. The credit reporting agencies actions have violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and I am seeking your assistance in rectifying this matter. I have been diligently monitoring my credit reports and have noticed that they are continuing to report inaccurate information regarding my credit history. I have previously filed disputes with therf to rectify these errors, providing all necessary supporting documentation. However, the agency has failed to conduct a reasonable investigation as required by the FCRA and has neglected its obligation to correct the inaccurate information. FCRA Rights Disregarded : The right to have inaccurate information corrected promptly ( Section 611 ( a ) ( 1XA ) ) The right to a reasonable investigation of disputed information ( Section 611 ( aX2 ) ) The right to receive written notice of the results of the investigation ( Section 611 ( aX6 ) ) The right to delete or modify inaccurate information ( Section 611 ( aX5 ) ) XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX I don't recall authorizing this inquiry. It could be fraudulent. Remove it from my credit report IMMEDIATELY!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 
To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act, the list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

The accounts below have violated my rights.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) ( a ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Please send an updated credit report once the changes are complete to my contact information listed.

My contact information is as follows : Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  SSN : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX  Sincerely XXXX XXXX Enclosed : copy of State ID and Utility bill showing proof of address

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request the deletion of an inaccurate, re-inserted, and fraudulent account present on my consumer credit report and to bring to your attention the failure of XXXX XXXX to provide the necessary proof of debt validation within the stipulated time frame of 30 days. I have previously sent certified dispute letters to these companies to rectify the inaccuracies in my credit report and to ensure compliance with the FCRA, but these companies never responded to me with verifiable documentary proof, original consumer contract, or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it, 30 days went by and I received nothing from these companies and these accounts was reinserted with no permissible purpose and without my consent. 

As outlined in the FCRA, failure to provide documented and verifiable proof within the specified time frame obligates the removal of unverified, invalid, derogatory accounts and information from my consumer report. Despite the receipt of my dispute letter and the lapse of the 30-day period, XXXX XXXX has not provided the requested proof nor rectified the inaccuracies in the reported information. They didnt respond to me at all and therefore by law I'm demanding the deletion of this account on my credit report immediately. 

I formally request TRANSUNION to remove the disputed, re-inserted, and inaccurate account XXXX XXXX from my credit report, as per the provisions of the FCRA. The failure of these companies to validate the debt within the statutory timeframe signifies their non-compliance with federal regulations and warrants the removal of the disputed account. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681b- Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) by the WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federally protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer, I am demanding the deletion of the unauthorized accounts and inquiries listed IMMEDIATELY!

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report and no other : By the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

15 U.S.C 1666b ( a ) A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Credit Inquiries What Happened? 
I previously submitted an official complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries appearing on my credit report. The complaint was filed on XXXX XXXX, under FTC Reference Number XXXX. 
Complaint Description : My credit report reflects unauthorized inquiries that were made without my explicit consent. I have contacted the creditors responsible for these inquiries, and they have confirmed they possess no evidenceneither written nor verbalthat I authorized or initiated these inquiries. This clear lack of valid authorization constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
I have formally demanded the immediate removal of these inquiries, as they are baseless and negatively impact my credit profile. However, the credit bureau in question has failed to provide a satisfactory resolution or appropriate action. This failure to address unauthorized inquiries prompted me to escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the FTC. I urge the immediate removal of these illegitimate inquiries to ensure compliance with federal regulations and to restore the integrity of my credit report. 

Details of Disputed Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have attached a copy of the formal complaint submitted to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) to further support this claim. This document highlights the absence of my authorization for these inquiries and underscores the insufficient response provided by the credit bureau, reinforcing my request for the immediate removal of these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report. 
Formal Request : I am formally requesting a thorough and manual investigation of the disputed inquiries and their removal if there is no verifiable documentation. I reserve the right to take legal action and file an additional complaint with the CFPB and my state 's Attorney General. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : XXXX [ Date ] TransUnion Dispute Resolution Team XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Resolution of Inability to Locate Credit Report Dear TransUnion Dispute Resolution Team, Your notification claiming you were " unable to locate a credit report '' for me is wholly unacceptable and indicative of a failure in your obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). My previous submissions contained all the necessary identifying information, and this inadequate response suggests either negligence or a deliberate attempt to avoid your obligations under the FCRA. 

To eliminate any further excuses, I am re-submitting my information and supporting documentation. Below are my details : Full Name : XXXX XXXX Current Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, PA XXXX Previous Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, PA XXXX Phone Number : XXXX Report Number : XXXX I have also included : A copy of my government-issued photo ID Proof of address ( utility bill or bank statement ) Your inability to locate my credit file raises serious questions about the integrity of your operations and compliance with FCRA requirements ( 1681i ). It is your legal obligation to : Ensure the accessibility of my credit file.

Conduct a proper reinvestigation of disputed information.

Provide timely and accurate responses to consumer disputes.

Let me be absolutely clear : I am demanding immediate action. You must locate my credit report, fully reinvestigate the disputed items, and provide written confirmation of resolution within 15 days of receiving this letter. Should you fail to comply, I will : File a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Pennsylvania Attorney Generals Office. 
Pursue all legal remedies available under the FCRA, including seeking damages for your failure to uphold federal and state consumer protection laws. 
Notify federal oversight authorities to audit your compliance practices. 
I expect written confirmation by the 15-day deadline that this issue has been resolved, including : Proof that you have located my credit report. 
A complete explanation of your investigation findings and any actions taken to delete inaccurate information. 
An acknowledgment of your responsibility for this delay and corrective measures to ensure such failures do not occur again. 
This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter before I take further action. I will not accept further delays, vague responses, or evasion of your legal obligations. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Enclosures : Copy of Government-issued ID Proof of Address

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for the XXXX XXXX XXXX Georgia ( Case No. XXXX ) The information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
Fraudulent Account/ Transaction/ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; Balance : {$9600.00} ; Opened : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. There has been no legal proof of the marks has been provided or proven. Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX This letter serves as formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), to cease all communication with me regarding the above-referenced account. This request applies to any and all forms of communication, including but not limited to telephone calls, text messages, emails, letters, and any other medium of communication. Additionally, this directive explicitly includes any communication via my consumer report, as defined by the term " communication '' within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 2 ).

As per the FDCPA, once a debt collector receives a written request to cease communication, they are required to comply, except to notify the consumer that further collection efforts are being terminated or that specific actions may be taken as allowed by law. Any further communication in violation of this request will be reported to the appropriate regulatory agencies, and I will pursue all available legal remedies.

This letter is not to be construed as an acknowledgment or validation of any alleged debt. Please provide written confirmation that you have received and will comply with this cease-and-desist request.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information present in my credit report, as furnished by your agency. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I request an immediate investigation into the following discrepancies and the removal of any unverifiable or incorrect data. This communication also serves as a pre-arbitration notice in the event that this matter is not resolved in accordance with applicable laws and consumer protections. 
Disputed Information : Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Discrepancies Identified : Multiple Entries : The same debt appears multiple times with slight variations in account numbers and details, which is misleading and potentially damaging. Status Inconsistencies : One entry lists the account as " Open, '' while another indicates it is " Closed, '' creating confusion about the actual status. Activity Dates : There are conflicting last activity dates between the entries, raising questions about the accuracy of the reported information. Lack of Payment History : The absence of payment history on these accounts does not provide a complete picture and may misrepresent my creditworthiness. Inconsistent Comments : Some entries lack detailed comments, while others include remarks such as " Account Seriously Past Due Date, '' leading to potential misinterpretation. Legal Basis for Dispute : Under the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information in their credit reports. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Mandates that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation if a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Requires the deletion or modification of information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable after reinvestigation. Additionally, case law such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, underscores the importance of reasonable reinvestigation by credit reporting agencies. Failure to comply with these standards may constitute a violation of the FCRA and open the agency to liability. Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed copies of my credit report highlighting the disputed entries, along with any relevant correspondence and documentation that support my claim. Please review these documents as part of your investigation.

Pre-Arbitration and Litigation Notice : Should this dispute remain unresolved, I reserve the right to pursue remedies under arbitration or litigation. If an arbitration provision is applicable under any agreement between us, I will initiate arbitration proceedings. Be advised that arbitration may incur the following costs, which could become your responsibility in the event of an adverse decision against your agency : Filing Fees : Up to {$200.00}, per the rules of most arbitration forums, unless waived for financial hardship. Administrative Fees : Between {$750.00} and {$1500.00}, depending on the arbitration provider. Arbitrator Fees : Ranging from {$1500.00} to {$3500.00} or more for multi-session arbitrations. If no arbitration provision applies, I will pursue this matter through litigation, seeking all remedies provided under the FCRA, including but not limited to statutory damages, actual damages, punitive damages, and the reimbursement of attorneys fees and legal costs.

Requested Action : I urge you to : Conduct a thorough investigation into the disputed entries. Delete or correct any information that is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation. Furnish me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting any changes made. 

Conclusion : Inaccurate information on my credit report can have serious implications for my financial well-being. I trust that you will address this matter with the urgency and diligence it requires, ensuring compliance with the FCRA and safeguarding my rights as a consumer. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within 30 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice Enclosures : Copy of credit report with disputed entries highlighted Supporting documents and correspondence Note : Please consider this letter as a formal pre-arbitration notice.

I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days.

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : Accounts : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Dispute Regarding Investigation Results Violation of FCRA Regulations Ref ( a ) File number XXXX Per Ref ( a ), I am writing to express my dissatisfaction and concern regarding your handling of my dispute related to the accounts listed below. Transunion response, claiming that the accounts were " verified as accurate, '' raises significant questions about the methods employed in your investigation. It is evident that your process is flawed, as the reporting on these accounts contains blatant inaccuracies that have not been questioned or corrected. 
Accounts in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX  Violations and Concerns : XXXX. XXXX Account : o The account inconsistently reports charge-offs in XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. How can these discrepancies coexist for the same account? This contradiction should have been flagged and addressed in any legitimate investigation. 
o The account reports 120 days late repeatedly in XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX of XXXX, which defies logical reporting practices. Your lack of scrutiny into such an obvious inconsistency is unacceptable. 
o The account has been re-aged as recently as XX/XX/XXXX. Re-aging an account without justification is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section XXXX. This action is both deceptive and detrimental to my credit score. 
XXXX. XXXX Account : o This account has been reported as " charged off '' every month since XX/XX/XXXX. A charged-off account can not continue reporting monthly as charged offit is a one-time status. 
o The account was also re-aged to XX/XX/XXXX, which violates the FCRAs provisions for accurate and timely reporting under Section 605.

Legal Violations : FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : You failed to conduct a proper reinvestigation of the disputed information, allowing XXXX and XXXX to provide inaccurate and contradictory reporting. 
FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Credit furnishers must provide accurate information. By accepting conflicting data from these furnishers without question, you are complicit in their violations.

FCRA Section 605 ( c ) : Re-aging an account violates the statute of limitations for reporting adverse items, creating undue harm to consumers.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : You are obligated to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. The errors in these accounts demonstrate a clear lack of such procedures. 
Harm Caused : Your actions and omissions have directly harmed my credit profile, costing me thousands of dollars in interest rates and financial opportunities. It is my legal right to have my accounts reported accurately and fairly. By failing to conduct a thorough investigation, you have disregarded this right. 

If these demands are not met within 15 days, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter. This includes filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and pursuing legal action to protect my rights. Furthermore, I will explore bringing this to media attention to highlight your predatory practices against consumers. 
Please consider this letter as formal notice and give this matter your immediate attention.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Credit Inquiries What Happened? 
I previously submitted an official complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries appearing on my credit report. The complaint was filed on XXXX XXXX, under FTC Reference Number XXXX. 
Complaint Description : My credit report reflects unauthorized inquiries that were made without my explicit consent. I have contacted the creditors responsible for these inquiries, and they have confirmed they possess no evidenceneither written nor verbalthat I authorized or initiated these inquiries. This clear lack of valid authorization constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
I have formally demanded the immediate removal of these inquiries, as they are baseless and negatively impact my credit profile. However, the credit bureau in question has failed to provide a satisfactory resolution or appropriate action. This failure to address unauthorized inquiries prompted me to escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the FTC. I urge the immediate removal of these illegitimate inquiries to ensure compliance with federal regulations and to restore the integrity of my credit report. 

Details of Disputed Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I have attached a copy of the formal complaint submitted to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) to further support this claim. This document highlights the absence of my authorization for these inquiries and underscores the insufficient response provided by the credit bureau, reinforcing my request for the immediate removal of these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report. 
Formal Request : I am formally requesting a thorough and manual investigation of the disputed inquiries and their removal if there is no verifiable documentation. I reserve the right to take legal action and file an additional complaint with the CFPB and my state 's Attorney General. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute an inaccurate item on my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The account referenced above is reported as charged off, yet it also shows an outstanding balance. This reporting is both inconsistent and potentially misleading. 

According to standard accounting practices and regulatory guidance, when an account is charged off, the creditor has written off the balance as a loss. Reporting both a charge-off and an outstanding balance is improper, as the debt is no longer active on their books. This error adversely affects my credit standing and must be corrected immediately.

To support my claim, I am requesting the following : 1. Verification of the balance being reported.

2. Evidence that the creditor has retained the right to report a balance on this charged-off account. 

If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this account or the reported balance, I demand that this account either be updated to reflect a {$0.00} balance or removed entirely from my credit report. 

I have enclosed documentation relevant to this dispute : [ Include any receipts, account statements, or correspondence related to the charge-off or balance dispute. ] As required by law, you have 30 days to investigate and resolve this dispute. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide written documentation of your findings once the investigation is complete. 

Failure to resolve this matter promptly will result in my filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potentially seeking legal action to protect my credit rights. 

I expect your swift attention to this matter. Thank you for your cooperation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Credit Report Errors and Collections Dear CFPB, TransUnion failure to correct the disputed accounts in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( i ) is a violation of federal law. As of this date, I demand : 1. Immediate removal of the erroneous entries.

2. A written confirmation of corrective action within 5 business days.

I demand that TransUnion immediately cease and desist from reporting inaccurate and unverified debt information in my credit report. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I dispute : Disputed Accounts with Creditor Names and Account Numbers : 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX TransUnion previously reported these accounts as verified, but I requested proof in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) ( 7 ) AND Fair Credit Reporting Act 609, and TransUnion has failed to provide any of the following : 1.Verification documents 2. Name of the original creditor 3. The creditors address and telephone number 4. Name of verifying individual 5. Copy of contract between me and Disputed Creditor 6. Purchase agreement of debt XXXX. Insurance claim documentation XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) with original creditor 9. Statute of limitations documentation 10. Date of last missed payment 11. The documentation used to verify the dispute If TransUnion is unable to respond in a timely manner and provide the above items, please delete the accounts from my credit report to prevent further damage and if these actions are not completed promptly, I will pursue statutory and punitive damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n.

TransUnion intentional non-compliance will also be reported to the FTC, CFPB, Florida Attorney General and state regulatory agencies. 

Remove these disputed accounts immediately and permanently, ensuring 100 % accuracy and send me a written confirmation of corrective action within 5 business days.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Credit Reporting Agency, I am writing to formally dispute the continued reporting of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ( Account # XXXX ) on my credit report. The information being reported is inaccurate, unverifiable, and constitutes multiple violations of my rights under federal and state laws. 

a. False or Misleading Representations ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) If XXXX continues to report the debt as collectible despite it being charged off or forgiven, this constitutes false representation. 
Failure to clarify the status of the debt, especially if it was canceled or forgiven, is misleading. 
b. Failure to Cease Collection on Disputed Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) If a debt is disputed, the collector ( or creditor, in this case ) must cease all collection activityincluding reporting to CRAsuntil the debt is validated. If the dispute has been ignored or dismissed without validation, this is a violation. 
XXXX. Misrepresentation of Debt Status a. Inaccurate Reporting of Balance Reporting a balance greater than {$0.00} on a charged-off account misrepresents the account status. A charge-off means the creditor has deemed the debt uncollectible and written it off, so the balance should reflect {$0.00} unless sold to a collection agency. 
b. Violation of Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ), creditors must provide accurate billing and disclosure. If the reported balance is inconsistent with the charge-off classification, this violates TILA. 

Additionally, the reporting of a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is inaccurate and misleading. If this account has been charged off, the balance should reflect {$0.00}, as required under proper credit reporting standards. 

Violations of My Rights XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) I submitted dispute letters dated XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>, requesting documentation to validate this account, including : Authenticated double-entry accounting records. 
Original signed agreements or contracts.

A copy of the 1099-C form ( if applicable ).

You failed to conduct a reasonable investigation and instead relied solely on unverifiable information provided by the creditor.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), if disputed information can not be verified, it must be deleted from the credit report. 
XXXX. Failure to Provide Documentation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ) ( 1 ), you are required to provide all information in the consumers file upon request. Despite my repeated demands, you have failed to provide : Proof of validation.

Documentation supporting the charge-off classification.

A copy of the 1099-C form required under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the debt has been canceled or forgiven. 
Your failure to produce these documents violates this provision. 

XXXX. Reporting Inaccurate and Inconsistent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Innovis has already removed this account as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inaccurately. This inconsistency among credit reporting agencies directly violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Further, if this account has been charged off, the balance must be reported as {$0.00}, as the creditor no longer considers it collectible. Reporting a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is both inaccurate and misleading. 
XXXX. Continuing to Report Unverifiable Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) You are required to delete any information that can not be verified within 30 days. It has been over 50 days since my initial dispute, and you have failed to provide proper validation.

This is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), as you continue to report unverifiable information despite my multiple requests. 
XXXX. Violation of Consumer Disclosure Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ), you are required to include a notation that an account is disputed. If this dispute notation is missing from my credit report, you are in violation of this provision. 
XXXX. Failure to Issue a 1099-C Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If this account was charged off and is considered forgiven or canceled, the creditor was required to issue a 1099-C form for debts exceeding {$600.00}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity of the charge-off and its reporting. 
XXXX. Violation of Permissible Purpose ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) If XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency can not produce signed contracts proving my authorization, the continued reporting of this account may constitute a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for reporting information. 
XXXX. Illegal Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) If the Date of First Delinquency ( DOFD ) on this account has been altered to make the debt appear newer than it is, this constitutes illegal re-aging. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ), negative accounts must be removed from credit reports after seven years from the XXXX. 
XXXX. Inadequate Explanation of Reinvestigation Results ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), credit reporting agencies are required to provide a description of the reinvestigation process and the procedure used to verify disputed information. Simply stating that the account was verified by the creditor without providing supporting documentation does not satisfy this requirement. 
Immediate Actions Required 1. Failure to Remove Data Breach-Related Accounts ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), I am entitled to request the removal of any account resulting from a data breach. I informed you that my information was compromised in a data breach, and this account is directly tied to the fraudulent use of my information. You have failed to comply with your obligation to remove this unverifiable and fraudulent account. 

XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), you are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and provide documentation verifying the accuracy of the account. 

I requested authenticated double-entry accounting records, original signed contracts, and a 1099-C form if the debt was charged off, forgiven, or canceled.

Your failure to produce this documentation demonstrates that the account can not be verified, making its continued reporting a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 
3. Reporting Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information in consumer reports. 

XXXX has already removed this account from my credit file as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inconsistently. 
Additionally, if this account has been charged off, the balance must reflect {$0.00}. Reporting a non-zero balance is inaccurate and misleading, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

4. Failure to Block Fraudulent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ) ) Under FACTA and 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ), you are required to block disputed information related to a data breach or identity theft within four business days after receiving evidence of the breach. Your failure to block or remove this account constitutes a violation of my rights under this provision.

5. Failure to Provide Consumer Disclosures ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) I requested copies of all information related to the disputed account, including contracts, applications, and validation records, under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ). You have failed to provide these documents, violating my right to access information in my file.

6. Failure to Issue a 1099-C Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If the account has been charged off or canceled, XXXX XXXX XXXX was required to issue a 1099-C form to both me and the IRS for debts exceeding {$600.00}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity and accuracy of the charge-off and makes the reporting of this account fraudulent. 

XXXX. Violation of FTC Data Security Standards As part of my FTC complaint, I reported that my information was exposed in a data breach. Your continued failure to investigate or remove accounts linked to this breach constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under FTC standards, as well as a breach of your obligation to safeguard consumer data. 

Remove the Account : Since you have failed to provide proper validation, this account must be deleted from my credit report immediately in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ).

Update the Balance to {$0.00} : If you continue to report this account, it must reflect a {$0.00} balance, as required for charged-off accounts.

Provide Validation Documentation : If you intend to continue reporting this account, provide the following within 10 days : Authenticated double-entry accounting records.

Original signed agreements or contracts.

A copy of the 1099-C form, if applicable.

Notice of Escalation If you fail to take the necessary corrective actions or provide proper documentation, I will escalate this matter by : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) for violations of the FCRA.

Reporting the issue to the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) for failure to issue a 1099-C form.

Consulting with legal counsel to pursue claims for statutory and actual damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( willful noncompliance ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681o ( negligent noncompliance ).

I trust you will address this matter promptly and ensure compliance with your obligations under federal law. Please confirm the removal or correction of this account within 10 days. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal dispute letter to TransUnion regarding fraudulent accounts that were opened in my name due to identity theft. I provided all necessary supporting documentation, including an FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of identity, and proof of address, requesting the removal of these unauthorized accounts and a copy of my updated credit report. Despite the legal requirement under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to respond within 30 days, TransUnion has failed to take any action or provide a response as of XX/XX/year>, making this my second attempt to resolve this issue. 

Additionally, TransUnion did not fulfill my request for a corrected copy of my credit report, which further violates my rights under the FCRA. This lack of transparency and failure to act has caused significant emotional and financial distress. 

The fraudulent accounts include : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have already investigated and confirmed these accounts as fraudulent, promptly removing them from my credit reports. TransUnions continued inaction is concerning and unacceptable. 

I also wish to address a correction to my previously submitted FTC Identity Theft Report, which originally listed an incorrect address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) instead of my correct address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The updated FTC report now accurately reflects my address and lists the fraudulent accounts. I have attached this updated report for your reference. 

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate removal of the fraudulent accounts listed above.

2. Written confirmation that the accounts have been removed and my records corrected.

3. Provision of an updated and corrected copy of my credit report.

I have enclosed the following supporting documents for your convenience : A copy of my government-issued ID ( passport ) A copy of my Social Security card Proof of my current address The updated and corrected FTC Identity Theft Report TransUnions failure to respond within the required timeframe is a violation of federal law. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I may pursue further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 15 U.S.C. 1681o for noncompliance. 

I look forward to your immediate attention and resolution of this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX is inaccurately reporting an account on my credit report, despite the same account being removed from both XXXX and XXXX due to inaccuracies or unverifiability. XXXX has failed to properly investigate my dispute and continues to report the account on TransUnion, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This inconsistent reporting is damaging to my creditworthiness. The account in question has already been removed by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, indicating its inaccuracy or lack of verifiability. However, it remains on TransUnion. 
XXXX has claimed the account is being reported correctly but has failed to address the discrepancies across credit bureaus. 
I have requested a reasonable investigation as required by Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA, but XXXX has failed to resolve the inaccuracies. 
Laws Violated : FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must report information with maximum possible accuracy.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers must ensure the accuracy of the data provided to credit bureaus. 
FCRA Section XXXX ( a ) : XXXX failed to conduct a reasonable investigation into my dispute. 
CFPA ( Consumer Financial Protection Act ) : XXXX 's refusal to correct inaccurate data may constitute unfair and deceptive practices. 
attached you will find a copy of my most recent utility bill for proof of address, my id, my social security car, a screenshot of the account removal from XXXX, a copy of my FTC complaint and my formal letter with the complaint

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, my name is XXXX XXXX. I Am writing to delete the following information from my credit report. Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I owe no debt. The companies listed below are violating my consumer rights to privacy pursuant to 15 USC 1681b 2. Company has also NO permission to report ANYTHING using my info pursuant to 15 USC 1681 4. There are also inquiries that were not authorized by me. With that being said, that also makes me avictim of identity theft. I demand that the inquiries and items listed are to be deleted to correct my credit report.Please delete the items as soon as possible.this is your **final and non-negotiable** demand to **immediately** delete all inaccurate information from my credit report. Your actions are not only a blatant violation of federal law, but they are also an intolerable assault on my rights as a consumer. **Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b**, you are illegally reporting and sharing my personal information without my explicit authorization. **You do not have my consent, and you have never had my consent** to access or report any information tied to my name. Your unlawful actions are an egregious breach of federal law, and I will no longer tolerate it.Additionally, my credit report contains **unauthorized inquiries** that I did not initiate, which makes me a **victim of identity theft**. **Under 18 U.S.C . 8**, I owe **absolutely no debt** to the companies listed. Your failure to delete these inaccuracies immediately will result in **severe legal consequences**. I will **not hesitate** to pursue every available legal avenue to hold you accountable, including but not limited to : 1. Filing formal complaints with the **Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) ** and the **Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) **. 2. Initiating civil lawsuits for violations of my rights under the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **. 3. Seeking **statutory and punitive damages** for your gross negligence and failure to comply with federal law.

You are hereby notified that you have **no further opportunity** to delay or ignore this matter. I **demand** that all incorrect entries and unauthorized inquiries be deleted **immediately** and **permanently**. This is your **final warning**, and I expect **written confirmation** of the deletions without delay.If I do not receive confirmation of the deletions within the next 10 business days, I will proceed with full legal action, which will result in **significant consequences** for your continued disregard of federal law.

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
You are in Violation of furnishing my consumer reports to person/s that do not have any permissible purpose or any legitimate business reason to receive those reports which is a clear violation of my right to privacy. 
On XXXX  you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX XXXX  AND XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX  XXXX, and on XX/XX/XXXX also you furnished my consumer report to XXXX XXXX without a permissible purpose as per 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) or knowingly without a legitimate business reason pursuant [ 15 U.S.C 1681b ( a ) 3 ( f ) ( I ).

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), [ 15 U.S.C 1681b ( a ) 3 ( f ) ( i )., for unlawfully furnishing my consumer report on XXXX XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX without my authorization or a permissible purpose under the 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA } and its guidelines for permissible purpose.

A person shall not use or obtain a consumer report for any purpose unless. 
XXXX. The consumer report is obtained for a purpose for which the consumer report is authorized to be furnished under this section. 
XXXX. The purpose is certified in accordance with section 1681b ( f ). XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
I hereby request pursuant rule 1002 the permissible purpose or legitimate business reason certification that authorized the furnish of my consumer report on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  TO XXXX XXXX AND XXXX  TO XXXX XXXX Be advised the advisory opinion of BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION 12 CFR Part 1022 Fair Credit Reporting ; Permissible Purposes for Furnishing, Using, and Obtaining Consumer Reports explains that the permissible purposes listed in FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) are consumer specific, and it affirms that a consumer reporting agency may not provide a consumer report to a user under FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) unless it has reason to believe that all of the consumer report information it includes pertains to the consumer who is the subject of the users request. The Bureau notes that disclaimers will not cure a failure to have a reason to believe that a user has a permissible purpose for a consumer report provided pursuant to FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ).

This advisory opinion also reminds consumer report users that FCRA section 604 ( f ) strictly prohibits a person who uses or obtains a consumer report from doing so without a permissible purpose. 
So why was a consumer report furnished to XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AND XXXX without a permissible purpose or legitimate business reason? 

15 USC 1681b ( c ) Furnishing reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer ( 3 ) Information regarding inquiries ; Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer.

616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] ( a ) In general. Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

I have been damaged as a result of your failure to follow the law I am requesting the DELETION of the inquiry that was placed on my consumer report on XXXX XXXX XXXX AND XX/XX/XXXX by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AND XXXXXXXX XXXX. 

Specified Remedy : Please send payment Via Check Payable to XXXX XXXX, Last Name to the address XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Yours Sincerely XXXXXXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Under Truth and lending you cant not put late payment on my credit nor charge me the late payment. Also I would like to have the whole loan reinvestigated under truth and lending act. I would like to recined the whole loan while investigating Here are the law and you havent proven anything with the late payment nor charges. I never had a chance to opt out. 15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information U.S. Code ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title. ( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. ( 2 ) Exception This subsection shall not prevent a financial institution from providing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party to perform services for or functions on behalf of the financial institution, including marketing of the financial institutions own products or services, or financial products or services offered pursuant to joint agreements between two or more financial institutions that comply with the requirements imposed by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, if the financial institution fully discloses the providing of such information and enters into a contractual agreement with the third party that requires the third party to maintain the confidentiality of such information. ( c ) Limits on reuse of information Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a nonaffiliated third party that receives from a financial institution nonpublic personal information under this section shall not, directly or through an affiliate of such receiving third party, disclose such information to any other person that is a nonaffiliated third party of both the financial institution and such receiving third party, unless such disclosure would be lawful if made directly to such other person by the financial institution. ( d ) Limitations on the sharing of account number information for marketing purposes A financial institution shall not disclose, other than to a consumer reporting agency, an account number or similar form of access number or access code for a credit card account, deposit account, or transaction account of a consumer to any nonaffiliated third party for use in telemarketing, direct mail marketing, or other marketing through electronic mail to the consumer. ( XXXX ) General exceptions Subsections ( a ) and ( b ) shall not prohibit the disclosure of nonpublic personal information ( XXXX ) as necessary to effect, administer, or enforce a transaction requested or authorized by the consumer, or in connection with ( A ) servicing or processing a financial product or service requested or authorized by the consumer ; ( B ) maintaining or servicing the consumers account with the financial institution, or with another entity as part of a private label credit card program or other extension of credit on behalf of such entity ; or ( C ) a proposed or actual securitization, secondary market sale ( including sales of servicing rights ), or similar transaction related to a transaction of the consumer ; ( XXXX ) with the consent or at the direction of the consumer ; ( XXXX ) ( A ) to protect the confidentiality or security of the financial institutions records pertaining to the consumer, the service or product, or the transaction therein ; ( B ) to protect against or prevent actual or potential fraud, unauthorized transactions, claims, or other liability ; ( C ) for required institutional risk control, or for resolving customer disputes or inquiries ; ( D ) to persons holding a legal or beneficial interest relating to the consumer ; or ( XXXX ) to persons acting in a fiduciary or representative capacity on behalf of the consumer ; ( XXXX ) to provide information to insurance rate advisory organizations, guaranty funds or agencies, applicable rating agencies of the financial institution, persons assessing the institutions compliance with industry standards, and the institutions attorneys, accountants, and auditors ; ( 5 ) to the extent specifically permitted or required under other provisions of law and in accordance with the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 [ 12 U.S.C. 3401 et seq. ], to law enforcement agencies ( including the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection [ 1 ] a Federal functional regulator, the Secretary of the Treasury with respect to subchapter XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of title I of Public Law 91508 ( 12 U.S.C. 19511959 ), a State insurance authority, or the Federal Trade Commission ), self-regulatory organizations, or for an investigation on a matter related to public safety ; ( 6 ) ( A ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ], or ( B ) from a consumer report reported by a consumer reporting agency ; ( 7 ) in connection with a proposed or actual sale, merger, transfer, or exchange of all or a portion of a business or operating unit if the disclosure of nonpublic personal information concerns solely consumers of such business or unit; or ( 8 ) to comply with Federal, State, or local laws, rules, and other applicable legal requirements ; to comply with a properly authorized civil, criminal, or regulatory investigation or subpoena or summons by Federal, State, or local authorities ; or to respond to judicial process or government regulatory authorities having jurisdiction over the financial institution for examination, compliance, or other purposes as authorized by law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputes and Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by Collection Agency I am filing this complaint against XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with TransUnion regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, XXXX used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : 3. Despite my dispute, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations. 

Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested. 
o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation. 
2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o XXXX failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

The identity of the entity or entities responsible for conducting the verification process.

That is a violation of 15 USC 168 1 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) Under 15 USC 168 1 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ). If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ) before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/year> my debit cards information was skimmed and someone started using it. I did not know this was happening until the beginning of XX/XX/year>. I went on vacation to XXXX in XX/XX/year>. While I was away my home was broken into and they took my cell phone, my wallet and other valuable out of my safe. When I got back home I noticed it was all missing and my accounts were completely drained and left negative. I called Wells Fargo and started the dispute process for more than XXXX transactions on XX/XX/year>. This is also where I learned of the transaction that started in XXXX. Wells Fargo denied my claim a mere few days later and sent me a letter stating that it was and their was not unauthorized transactions made. I called them immediately upon finding this out and told them Id like it reopened. They said I needed to give them proof that I was out of the country and proof that my phone was stolen and a police report and they told me I needed to email it to them in pdf format. I got the XXXX claim number for my replacement phone, the police report number and a copy of the visa I was issued and emailed it to them as they requested on XX/XX/year>. They assured me that it would only take XXXX hours at the most to review the proof that I send them and that my case would be reopened and I would get a provisional credit while they investigate it. On XX/XX/XXXX I had absolutely nothing from them yet so I called them again and they assured me that I would have my credit by the end of their business day, XX/XX/year> because that is how long they have until they have to give it to me. ( As she said it ) I told the lady I was talking to that I would like her to record my next words in her notes for all the workers to see and she said okay and that the phone call was recorded but for me to continue. I went on by saying that if my claim was not resolved in my favor and my money that was stolen from me returned by the date and time she just gave me ( XXXX, XXXX ) that I would be filing a complaint with the XXXX and the CFPB. I have waited and waited and even gave them a few extra days just to give them the benefit of the doubt and now XXXX tired of waiting and feel like XXXX being pushed around. I want my money returned to me. Every single cent including the overdraft fees I shouldnt have been charged!! I have included screenshots of the emails I sent them with the proof they wanted!

Product: Prepaid card
Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is not a duplicate. This is a new complaint based on continued issues with newly purchased card. Gift card was purchased on XX/XX/year> and an attempt to make a purchase were made on XX/XX/year>. Upon use of the card ending in XXXX, transactions were blocked at the merchant and subsequent merchants. It has been determined that there is a systematic scheme in place to purposefully deny use of the cards. I have attempted numerous times to use the card and resolve its issues with Incomm but to no avail. Incomm tells me to use the card at another merchant despite my attempts at different merchants. If a purchase attempt was at a specific merchant, why would one try to use it at another merchant? For example, if I was looking to pay my electric bill with the gift card, why would the solution be to NOT pay the electric bill and pay different merchant? Why am I not allowed to pay my electric company? This same issue is present with previous cards purchased. So instead of more replacement cards, I am respectfully requesting that a check with the purchase fee be sent to my address. Attached is copy of the receipt of the gift card purchase and the gift card itself. 

In response to a previous complaint reply from Incomm regarding a similar issue, the company stated that " enhanced security measures ... do not appear to function in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX desired capacity ''. I am respectfully requested the specifics on what is the " desired capacity ''. The gift card package of the product did not have specifics on how and when to spend the funds on the card. Without clear guidance on the package itself, how is a consumer able to know why declined transactions are for the sake of security? Is the intent of the gift card to spend the funds on the card that accepts XXXX? 

Why is it that when a consumer 's transaction is declined access to the funds on the card, that it is the consumer that is responsible to beg and plead to have the funds release for use? Per the letter, declining transactions on the card in addition to declining refund requests of the card itself effectively seals off the ability to use funds on the card. Is the consumer supposedly to simply throw away the card in the garbage if the transaction is declined and forfeit the funds since refunds will no longer be honored at the time of purchase?

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I have unauthorized accounts and inaccurate information being placed on my credit report. I have disputed these accounts multiple times by mail and online. I am in financial hardship with two kids. I am being denied because of my credit report. I'm unable to receive financial support/ gains due to the inaccuracies on my credit. I also look to see if my personal information was impacted by the data breach, and it was. It's too late file a claim. I AM IN NEED OF IMMEDIATE ATTENTION. I need these items removed from my credit. It's unfair and causing so much stress. 

As I study my consumer laws, I have to come to understand the rights and protections afforded to me under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other federal regulations. These laws are designed to ensure the accuracy, fairness, and privacy of information in the credit reporting system. It is disheartening to see these rights violated, as unauthorized accounts and inaccuracies on my credit report remain unsolved despite my efforts to dispute them. I am determined to hold the credit bureaus accountable to ensure compliance with these laws and protect my financial stability.

1. ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : The credit bureaus have failed to conduct a proper reinvestigation of my disputes within the required 30-day period.

2 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : The credit bureaus are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report, yet unauthorized and unverified accounts remain on my report. 
3. ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : The FCRA requires credit bureaus to block fraudulent or unauthorized information upon receipt of sufficient proof, which I have provided, but no action has been taken.

4. ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) Consumers can dispute a debt and request verification before further collection efforts.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as a natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft, I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law. 
This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy rights. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer.

Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately Addresses, Collections, Inquires, Names, Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response
