Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report : Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information : ( A ) In general, if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Urgent Request Fraudulent and inquiries block under section 605B of the FCRA Account in Dispute : Reported Balance : {$500.00} Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$810.00} Account In Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$400.00} To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to urgently request the removal of fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report due to identify theft. The inaccurate information is causing significant harm to my credit, and I expect immediate correction action. 
Per section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), the following fraudulent accounts must be blocked and permanently removed from my credit file. I am invoking my right to have fraudulent information blocked and permanently removed from my credit report within ( 4 ) business days from the date of receipt of this letter. 
Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : unable to see acct number info on Equifax website Reported Balance : {$500.00} Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$810.00} Account In Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$400.00} Additionally, I request the removal of all unauthorized inquiries to this identify theft : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Failure to comply with this request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action. If this fraudulent information is not blocked and removed, I will file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and I will seek monetary damages for the harm caused by continued reporting of these inaccuracies. 
I also demand the immediate removal of all unauthorized inquiries related to this identity theft, which were are not authorized by me and negatively impacted my credit. If these inquiries are not promptly removed, I will escalate this matter to the appropriate legal authorities. 
I expect written confirmation by XX/XX/XXXX, confirming that the fraudulent XXXX XXXX XXXX accounts and any related unauthorized inquiries have been fully removed from my credit report. 
This is a time sensitive matter, and you are now officially on notice. Failure to act promptly will result in further legal action to protect my rights and restore my credit. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this issue.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear Equifax Customer Service, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of information being reported on my credit file, as per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, I have identified an account that is being inaccurately reported, which includes an address and name that do not correspond with my Driver 's License or rental agreement.

According to 15 U.S. Code 1681, consumer reporting agencies are required to conduct a fair and reasonable investigation upon receiving a written dispute. Inaccurate credit reporting not only undermines my creditworthiness but also violates my rights as a consumer.

I request that you investigate this matter promptly and remove the inaccurate account from my credit report. Please find attached any supporting documentation that verifies my claim, including copies of my Driver 's License and rental agreement.

I am looking forward to your swift response and resolution of this matter. If you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at the phone number or email address provided above. 

Thank you for your attention to this important matter. 

Sincerely CFPB PLEASE REVIEW FOR VIOLATIONS

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the continued reporting of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ( Account # XXXX ) on my credit report. The information being reported is inaccurate, unverifiable, and constitutes multiple violations of my rights under federal and state laws. 
a. False or Misleading Representations ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) If XXXX continues to report the debt as collectible despite it being charged off or forgiven, this constitutes false representation. 
Failure to clarify the status of the debt, especially if it was canceled or forgiven, is misleading.

b. Failure to Cease Collection on Disputed Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) If a debt is disputed, the collector ( or creditor, in this case ) must cease all collection activityincluding reporting to CRAsuntil the debt is validated. If the dispute has been ignored or dismissed without validation, this is a violation.

2. Misrepresentation of Debt Status a. Inaccurate Reporting of Balance Reporting a balance greater than {$XXXX} on a charged-off account misrepresents the account status. A charge-off means the creditor has deemed the debt uncollectible and written it off, so the balance should reflect {$0.00} unless sold to a collection agency. 
b. Violation of Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ), creditors must provide accurate billing and disclosure. If the reported balance is inconsistent with the charge-off classification, this violates TILA. 

Additionally, the reporting of a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is inaccurate and misleading. If this account has been charged off, the balance should reflect {$XXXX}, as required under proper credit reporting standards. 
Violations of My Rights 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) I submitted dispute letters dated XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>, requesting documentation to validate this account, including : Authenticated double-entry accounting records.

Original signed agreements or contracts. 
A copy of the XXXX form ( if applicable ). 
You failed to conduct a reasonable investigation and instead relied solely on unverifiable information provided by the creditor.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), if disputed information can not be verified, it must be deleted from the credit report.

2. Failure to Provide Documentation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ) ( 1 ), you are required to provide all information in the consumers file upon request. Despite my repeated demands, you have failed to provide : Proof of validation.

Documentation supporting the charge-off classification. 
A copy of the XXXX form required under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the debt has been canceled or forgiven.

Your failure to produce these documents violates this provision.

3. Reporting Inaccurate and Inconsistent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Innovis has already removed this account as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inaccurately. This inconsistency among credit reporting agencies directly violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Further, if this account has been charged off, the balance must be reported as {$XXXX}, as the creditor no longer considers it collectible. Reporting a non-zero balance on a charged-off account is both inaccurate and misleading.

4. Continuing to Report Unverifiable Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) You are required to delete any information that can not be verified within 30 days. It has been over 50 days since my initial dispute, and you have failed to provide proper validation.

This is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), as you continue to report unverifiable information despite my multiple requests.

5. Violation of Consumer Disclosure Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ), you are required to include a notation that an account is disputed. If this dispute notation is missing from my credit report, you are in violation of this provision. 
XXXX. Failure to Issue a XXXX Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If this account was charged off and is considered forgiven or canceled, the creditor was required to issue a XXXX form for debts exceeding {$600.00}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity of the charge-off and its reporting. 
7. Violation of Permissible Purpose ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) If XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency can not produce signed contracts proving my authorization, the continued reporting of this account may constitute a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for reporting information. 
8. Illegal Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) If the Date of First Delinquency ( DOFD ) on this account has been altered to make the debt appear newer than it is, this constitutes illegal re-aging.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ), negative accounts must be removed from credit reports after XXXX years from the XXXX. 
9. Inadequate Explanation of Reinvestigation Results ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), credit reporting agencies are required to provide a description of the reinvestigation process and the procedure used to verify disputed information. Simply stating that the account was verified by the creditor without providing supporting documentation does not satisfy this requirement. 
Immediate Actions Required 1. Failure to Remove Data Breach-Related Accounts ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), I am entitled to request the removal of any account resulting from a data breach. I informed you that my information was compromised in a data breach, and this account is directly tied to the fraudulent use of my information. You have failed to comply with your obligation to remove this unverifiable and fraudulent account.

2. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), you are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and provide documentation verifying the accuracy of the account.

I requested authenticated double-entry accounting records, original signed contracts, and a XXXX form if the debt was charged off, forgiven, or canceled. 
Your failure to produce this documentation demonstrates that the account can not be verified, making its continued reporting a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ).

3. Reporting Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information in consumer reports. 

XXXX has already removed this account from my credit file as unverifiable, yet you continue to report it inconsistently. 
Additionally, if this account has been charged off, the balance must reflect {$XXXX}. Reporting a non-zero balance is inaccurate and misleading, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

4. Failure to Block Fraudulent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ) ) Under FACTA and 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ), you are required to block disputed information related to a data breach or identity theft within XXXX business days after receiving evidence of the breach. Your failure to block or remove this account constitutes a violation of my rights under this provision. 
5. Failure to Provide Consumer Disclosures ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) I requested copies of all information related to the disputed account, including contracts, applications, and validation records, under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ). You have failed to provide these documents, violating my right to access information in my file. 

XXXX. Failure to Issue a XXXX Form ( 26 U.S.C. 6050P ) If the account has been charged off or canceled, XXXX XXXX XXXX was required to issue a XXXX form to both me and the IRS for XXXX exceeding {$XXXX}. The absence of this form raises questions about the validity and accuracy of the charge-off and makes the reporting of this account fraudulent. 

XXXX. Violation of FTC XXXX Security Standards As part of my FTC complaint, I reported that my information was exposed in a data breach. Your continued failure to investigate or remove accounts linked to this breach constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under FTC standards, as well as a breach of your obligation to safeguard consumer data. 

Remove the Account : Since you have failed to provide proper validation, this account must be deleted from my credit report immediately in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 
Update the XXXX to {$XXXX} : If you continue to report this account, it must reflect a {$XXXX} balance, as required for charged-off accounts. 
Provide Validation Documentation : If you intend to continue reporting this account, provide the following within 10 days : Authenticated double-entry accounting records. 
XXXX signed agreements or contracts. 
A copy of the XXXX form, if applicable. 
Notice of Escalation If you fail to take the necessary corrective actions or provide proper documentation, I will escalate this matter by : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) for violations of the FCRA. 
Reporting the issue to the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) for failure to issue a XXXX form. 
Consulting with legal counsel to pursue claims for statutory and actual damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( willful noncompliance ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681o ( negligent noncompliance ).

I trust you will address this matter promptly and ensure compliance with your obligations under federal law. Please confirm the removal or correction of this account within 10 days.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX This letter serves as formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), to cease all communication with me regarding the above-referenced account. This request applies to any and all forms of communication, including but not limited to telephone calls, text messages, emails, letters, and any other medium of communication. Additionally, this directive explicitly includes any communication via my consumer report, as defined by the term " communication '' within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 2 ).

As per the FDCPA, once a debt collector receives a written request to cease communication, they are required to comply, except to notify the consumer that further collection efforts are being terminated or that specific actions may be taken as allowed by law. Any further communication in violation of this request will be reported to the appropriate regulatory agencies, and I will pursue all available legal remedies.

This letter is not to be construed as an acknowledgment or validation of any alleged debt. Please provide written confirmation that you have received and will comply with this cease-and-desist request.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Consumer complaint narrative:
You are in Violation of furnishing my consumer reports to person/s that do not have any permissible purpose or any legitimate business reason to receive those reports which is a clear violation of my right to privacy. 
On XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ON XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ON XX/XX/XXXX AND XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX, ON XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX also you furnished my consumer report to XXXX XXXX without a permissible purpose as per 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) or knowingly without a legitimate business reason pursuant [ 15 U.S.C 1681b ( a ) 3 ( f ) ( I ).

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), [ 15 U.S.C 1681b ( a ) 3 ( f ) ( i )., for unlawfully furnishing my consumer report on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX without my authorization or a permissible purpose under the 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA } and its guidelines for permissible purpose.

A person shall not use or obtain a consumer report for any purpose unless.

1. The consumer report is obtained for a purpose for which the consumer report is authorized to be furnished under this section.

2. The purpose is certified in accordance with section 1681b ( f ). XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
I hereby request pursuant rule 1002 the permissible purpose or legitimate business reason certification that authorized the furnish of my consumer report on On XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX, ON XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX also you furnished my consumer report to XXXX XXXX without a permissible purpose Be advised the advisory opinion of BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION 12 CFR Part 1022 Fair Credit Reporting ; Permissible Purposes for Furnishing, Using, and Obtaining Consumer Reports explains that the permissible purposes listed in FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) are consumer specific, and it affirms that a consumer reporting agency may not provide a consumer report to a user under FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) unless it has reason to believe that all of the consumer report information it includes pertains to the consumer who is the subject of the users request. The Bureau notes that disclaimers will not cure a failure to have a reason to believe that a user has a permissible purpose for a consumer report provided pursuant to FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ).

This advisory opinion also reminds consumer report users that FCRA section 604 ( f ) strictly prohibits a person who uses or obtains a consumer report from doing so without a permissible purpose.

So why was a consumer report furnished to XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AND XXXX without a permissible purpose or legitimate business reason?

15 USC 1681b ( c ) Furnishing reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer ( 3 ) Information regarding inquiries ; Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer.

616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] ( a ) In general. Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

I have been damaged as a result of your failure to follow the law I am requesting the DELETION of the inquiry that was placed on my consumer report on On XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ON XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ON XX/XX/XXXX AND XX/XX/XXXX you furnished my consumer reports to XXXX XXXXXXXX, ON XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX also you furnished my consumer report to XXXX XXXX without a permissible purpose rectified Remedy : Please send payment Via Check Payable to XXXX XXXX, Last Name to the address XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Yours Sincerely XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute of Credit Reporting XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint and dispute regarding inaccurate and misleading information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report. The information provided below does not accurately reflect the circumstances of my account, and I am requesting your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring compliance with federal credit reporting laws. 

Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan ( Joint Responsibility with XXXX XXXX ) Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Reported Status : Charged off ( {$16000.00} written off ; {$16000.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX ) Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Grounds for Dispute : 1. Charge-Off Reporting : The charge-off and balance information ( {$16000.00} ) is being reported inaccurately. Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, creditors are required to report only accurate and verifiable information. I have not received sufficient validation for this debt or evidence justifying the charge-off amount. 

2. Repossession Reporting : The account history indicates a repossession in XX/XX/XXXX, but the vehicle was redeemed. Per UCC 9, Part 6, repossessions followed by redemption must not continue to be reported inaccurately. 

3. Duplicate Reporting of Negative Events : The account history redundantly lists late payments, repossession, and charge-off statuses from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. These entries appear to overlap and create an unfair representation of the accounts status. 

4. Compliance with FCRA and Investigation Obligations : I previously disputed this account, as noted in the comment section of my credit report. However, the reinvestigation completed in XX/XX/XXXX failed to address all errors comprehensively, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. 

Requested Resolution : 1. Delete the inaccurate charge-off reporting and balance information.

2. Remove the repossession entry, as the vehicle was redeemed, per applicable law.

3. Ensure compliance with federal regulations, including proper validation of the debt and correction of redundant and inaccurate reporting. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in ensuring that XXXX XXXX XXXX complies with its obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related statutes. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates regarding the investigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: Truist bank publicly had an online marketing that a {$400.00} cash bonus is given to new checking account holders should it is open and meet the requirements of a direct deposit for {$500.00} or more and XXXX qualifying debit spending within 90 days of the account opening. On XX/XX/year> I opened a checking account at Truist bank situated at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I met all requirements to earn the cash {$400.00}. However, Truitt bank failed to honor their marketing promotion. I called and spoke with the relationship banker, XXXX XXXX and her manager, XXXX XXXX concerning the failure of Truist bank and their confirmed verification of my eligibility at the time of the account opening. Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputes and Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by Collection Agency I am filing this complaint against Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, XXXX used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection AgencXXXX : XXXX. Despite my dispute, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations. 

Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX DEPTEDXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Key Violations : XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested. 
o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation. 
2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o XXXX failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address
1099-C Non-Issuance : o XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally notify you that I am a victim of identity theft resulting from a recent data breach. I am requesting that you block and delete all fraudulent accounts and inquiries associated with my credit file, as permitted under 15 USC 1681c-2 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Attached to this letter, you will find the following documents to support my claim : A copy of my government-issued identification ( e.g., driver 's license or passport ) A copy of a recent utility bill or other proof of address A copy of the Identity Theft Report filed with [ name of law enforcement agency ] A list of accounts and inquiries that I believe to be fraudulent Please take immediate action to block the information identified in the enclosed documents from my credit report and delete it permanently, as required by law. I also request that you provide me with a confirmation letter detailing the actions you have taken.

If you need any additional information or documentation to process this request, please contact me at [ your phone number ] or [ your email address ].

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting XXXX  ( Report Number : XXXX ) Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate and misleading information being reported by XXXX  on my credit report. The details of the account are as follows : Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Repossession ( {$8100.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX ) Original Balance : {$18000.00} This account contains several inaccuracies and reporting issues that violate federal credit reporting standards. 

Grounds for Dispute : 1. Repossession Reporting : The account status indicates a repossession dating back to XX/XX/XXXX, yet the payment history lists ongoing repossession statuses through XX/XX/XXXX. This creates a misleading representation of the account. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, creditors are required to furnish accurate and consistent data.

2. Inconsistent Payment History : The payment history redundantly lists repossession for multiple months ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and prior months ), creating confusion and potential over-reporting of derogatory marks. This redundant reporting must be corrected. 

3. Validation of Debt and Balance : The current balance of {$8100.00} is inconsistent with prior communications regarding the debt. XXXX has not provided adequate documentation to validate the amount owed, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

4. Failure to Correct Prior Dispute : This account was previously disputed, as noted in the reinvestigation details dated XX/XX/XXXX. However, XXXX failed to fully address or correct the inaccuracies identified in the dispute, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Requested Resolution : 1. Remove Duplicate Repossession Entries : Correct the payment history to eliminate redundant repossession statuses for months following the initial repossession in XX/XX/XXXX. 

2. Validate the Debt and Balance : Provide a detailed validation of the {$8100.00} balance, including a breakdown of charges, payments, and fees. If the debt can not be validated, delete the account entirely from my credit report.

3. Ensure Compliance with FCRA : Verify that all reporting related to this account complies with federal regulations, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ).

4. Amend Credit Reporting : Update the accounts reporting to accurately reflect its status and remove any redundant or misleading information. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that XXXX complies with its legal obligations. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates regarding your investigation. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you Problem Description : These inquiries were not authorized by me and have negatively impacted my credit score. After reaching out to the companies listed, they confirmed that they have no record of performing these inquiries, which suggests a possible error or potential fraud. 

Legal Basis : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I have the right to dispute the accuracy of any information on my credit report. These sections establish that : -Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Credit bureaus must investigate disputes filed by consumers.

-Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) : Consumers have the right to access information in their credit reports.

-Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Regulates the circumstances under which a credit bureau can furnish a credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft. I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law.

This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer.

Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately ADDRESSES INQUIRES NAMES ACCOUNTS COLLECTIONS These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information present in my credit report, as furnished by your agency. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I request an immediate investigation into the following discrepancies and the removal of any unverifiable or incorrect data. This communication also serves as a pre-arbitration notice in the event that this matter is not resolved in accordance with applicable laws and consumer protections. 
Disputed Information : Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Discrepancies Identified : Multiple Entries : The same debt appears multiple times with slight variations in account numbers and details, which is misleading and potentially damaging. Status Inconsistencies : One entry lists the account as " Open, '' while another indicates it is " Closed, '' creating confusion about the actual status. Activity Dates : There are conflicting last activity dates between the entries, raising questions about the accuracy of the reported information. Lack of Payment History : The absence of payment history on these accounts does not provide a complete picture and may misrepresent my creditworthiness. Inconsistent Comments : Some entries lack detailed comments, while others include remarks such as " Account Seriously Past Due Date, '' leading to potential misinterpretation. Legal Basis for Dispute : Under the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information in their credit reports. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Mandates that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation if a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Requires the deletion or modification of information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable after reinvestigation. Additionally, case law such as Dalton v. Capital Associated Industries , Inc., 257 F.3d 409 ( 4th Cir. 2001 ), underscores the importance of reasonable reinvestigation by credit reporting agencies. Failure to comply with these standards may constitute a violation of the FCRA and open the agency to liability. Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed copies of my credit report highlighting the disputed entries, along with any relevant correspondence and documentation that support my claim. Please review these documents as part of your investigation.

Pre-Arbitration and Litigation Notice : Should this dispute remain unresolved, I reserve the right to pursue remedies under arbitration or litigation. If an arbitration provision is applicable under any agreement between us, I will initiate arbitration proceedings. Be advised that arbitration may incur the following costs, which could become your responsibility in the event of an adverse decision against your agency : Filing Fees : Up to {$200.00}, per the rules of most arbitration forums, unless waived for financial hardship. Administrative Fees : Between {$750.00} and {$1500.00}, depending on the arbitration provider. Arbitrator Fees : Ranging from {$1500.00} to {$3500.00} or more for multi-session arbitrations. If no arbitration provision applies, I will pursue this matter through litigation, seeking all remedies provided under the FCRA, including but not limited to statutory damages, actual damages, punitive damages, and the reimbursement of attorneys fees and legal costs.

Requested Action : I urge you to : Conduct a thorough investigation into the disputed entries. Delete or correct any information that is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation. Furnish me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting any changes made.

Conclusion : Inaccurate information on my credit report can have serious implications for my financial well-being. I trust that you will address this matter with the urgency and diligence it requires, ensuring compliance with the FCRA and safeguarding my rights as a consumer. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within 30 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice Enclosures : Copy of credit report with disputed entries highlighted Supporting documents and correspondence Note : Please consider this letter as a formal pre-arbitration notice.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX across the XXXX credit bureaus ( XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : Military Star Account Number : [ Insert Account Number ] Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : XXXX & XXXX : {$5400.00} Equifax : {$5300.00} Discrepancy : Conflicting balances across credit bureaus.

2. Date of Last Activity : XXXX & XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX Discrepancy : The conflicting dates indicate inaccurate and inconsistent reporting.

3. Last Payment Date : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Not reported. 
Discrepancy : Inconsistent last payment dates among bureaus.

4. Payment Status : XXXX XXXX XXXX : Collection/Chargeoff Equifax : Late XXXX  Days Discrepancy : Differing payment statuses create confusion about the true state of the account.

5. Dispute Status : XXXX & XXXX : Account not disputed Equifax : Consumer disputes- reinvestigation in progress Discrepancy : Conflicting information on whether or not the account is currently disputed.

6. Credit Limit : All three bureaus report a credit limit of {$3600.00}, yet the high balance exceeds this limit, raising questions about the accuracy of reporting.

Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with.

Their business address, name, and phone number.

3. Documentation proving the validity of the account balance, payment history, and charge-off status.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by : 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information.

2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Falsely reporting payment activity and account status.

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 


Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, my name is XXXX XXXX. I Am writing to delete the following information from my credit report. Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I owe no debt. The companies listed below are violating my consumer rights to privacy pursuant to 15 USC 1681b 2. Company has also NO permission to report ANYTHING using my info pursuant to 15 USC 1681 4. There are also inquiries that were not authorized by me. With that being said, that also makes me avictim of identity theft. I demand that the inquiries and items listed are to be deleted to correct my credit report.Please delete the items as soon as possible.this is your **final and non-negotiable** demand to **immediately** delete all inaccurate information from my credit report. Your actions are not only a blatant violation of federal law, but they are also an intolerable assault on my rights as a consumer. **Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b**, you are illegally reporting and sharing my personal information without my explicit authorization. **You do not have my consent, and you have never had my consent** to access or report any information tied to my name. Your unlawful actions are an egregious breach of federal law, and I will no longer tolerate it.Additionally, my credit report contains **unauthorized inquiries** that I did not initiate, which makes me a **victim of identity theft**. **Under 18 U.S.C . 8**, I owe **absolutely no debt** to the companies listed. Your failure to delete these inaccuracies immediately will result in **severe legal consequences**. I will **not hesitate** to pursue every available legal avenue to hold you accountable, including but not limited to : 1. Filing formal complaints with the **Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) ** and the **Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) **.

2. Initiating civil lawsuits for violations of my rights under the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **.

3. Seeking **statutory and punitive damages** for your gross negligence and failure to comply with federal law.

You are hereby notified that you have **no further opportunity** to delay or ignore this matter. I **demand** that all incorrect entries and unauthorized inquiries be deleted **immediately** and **permanently**. This is your **final warning**, and I expect **written confirmation** of the deletions without delay.If I do not receive confirmation of the deletions within the next 10 business days, I will proceed with full legal action, which will result in **significant consequences** for your continued disregard of federal law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax , Inc . XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for the Northern District of Georgia ( Case No. 1:17-md-02800 ) The information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
XXXX. Fraud Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX ; # XXXX ; Balance : {$26000.00} It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. There has been no legal proof of the marks has been provided or proven. I have reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the supporting documents, including the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. This unauthorized reporting has negatively impacted my credit standing. I respectfully request that the FTC, FDIC, & CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that the erroneous and derogatory information is removed from my credit report. I am also pursuing complaints at federal levels to address these violations because my consumer rights have been violated and belittled.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days.

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : Accounts : XXXX XXXX Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did

an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

This situation is causing undue stress and negatively affecting my credit report without justification. ''

Consumer complaint narrative:
I XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing on my own as a natural person and consumer who is a victim of identity theft, I am requesting the immediate removal of the following items from my consumer credit report in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This statute requires that any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft must be blocked from the consumer 's credit report within 4 business days of receipt of my request. It has been over 30 days since my initial request, and you are in violation of this law.

This dispute is not being made in error, nor is it based on any misrepresentation of fact on my part. The information I am disputing is fraudulent, and the entities that reported these items DO NOT have lawful authority to do so. According to the law, these companies are required to have tax documents or other forms of written consent to charge off or report these items under my name. I did not provide such consent, and as such, these items are in violation of my privacy Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b, consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I NEVER provided any written consent for any consumer reporting agency to report the information listed below on my behalf, and their failure to adhere to this law constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
Please delete the following items from my credit report immediately XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  These accounts should not appear on my consumer report, as they are the result of identity theft. Please ensure these fraudulent accounts are removed as required under the law. The companies reporting these items have failed to provide proof of my consent or authorization, which makes their actions unlawful. 
I respectfully demand that you take the necessary steps to delete these accounts from my credit report and send me written confirmation that these items have been removed. This request is made under the rights provided to me by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and related laws. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

Consumer complaint narrative: Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an account by XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on my credit report, which I believe is inaccurate. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 USC 1692c ( c ), I am requesting the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. On [ XX/XX/year>, I sent a written request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX requesting that they cease all communications with me regarding the alleged debt. This written request was made pursuant to 15 USC 1692c ( c ), which clearly states that a debt collector must cease communication with a consumer once a request is made in writing to do so, except in certain circumstances ( such as to notify the consumer of legal actions being taken ). Since I have exercised my right to request that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX cease communication, I believe that the continued reporting of this account on my credit report is in violation of the law. As a result, I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and assist in removing this account from my credit file. I would greatly appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm in writing that this dispute has been received and is under investigation. If you require any further documentation or information from me, do not hesitate to contact me. Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX Prior Cfpb Complaint Subject : Second Dispute Regarding Unauthorized Inquiry by XXXX Dear Equifax Dispute Department , I am writing to formally dispute an unauthorized inquiry appearing on my credit report related to " XXXX. '' This letter serves as a follow-up to my previous dispute, as Equifax 's prior investigation failed to adequately address or correct this matter. 

Details of the Dispute : Inquiry Name : XXXX Reason for Dispute : No written authorization was given for this inquiry. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), only authorized inquiries made with my explicit consent may be included in my credit file. I never provided written authorization for XXXX to access my credit information, and as such, this inquiry is unauthorized and should be removed immediately. 

The inclusion of this inquiry on my report is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. I demand that Equifax : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation into this matter.

Provide me with a detailed explanation of your findings and the steps taken to resolve the issue.

Remove the unauthorized inquiry from my credit report immediately.

Please find attached copies of the following supporting documents for your review : A copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed inquiry.

A copy of my previous dispute letter for reference.

Failure to resolve this matter satisfactorily may leave me no choice but to escalate the issue by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and considering legal action to protect my rights.

I expect a written response within the legally mandated time frame of 30 days. If additional information is required to complete the reinvestigation, please notify me promptly in writing.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust you will handle it with the seriousness it deserves. 

Sincerely, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year>XXXX  and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Deletion or Validation of Discrepancies Across Credit Reports XXXX XXXX  Account I am filing this complaint to address significant and harmful discrepancies in the reporting of an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) across the three credit bureaus ( XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX ). Despite prior disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, and I am requesting proof of the previous investigation or immediate deletion of this account from my credit reports due to its unverifiable nature. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Discrepancies Identified Across Credit Reports : 1. Account Balance : Reported as {$21000.00}, despite the account being closed since XXXX, with no verifiable explanation. 
2. Last Payment Date : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Not listed 3. Date of Last Activity : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX 4. Payment History : Ongoing late payments are reported in XXXX ( Equifax & XXXX ), despite the account being charged off in XXXX. 
5. Dispute Status : XXXX : Account not disputed Equifax : Consumer disputes after resolution Request for Proof of Investigation : I am now requesting : 1. Proof of the previous investigation conducted by the credit bureaus and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
2. A detailed method of the investigation, including : Records of who you spoke with. 
Their business address, name, and phone number. 
3. Documentation proving the validity of the late payments and charge-off reporting.

If this information can not be provided within three ( 3 ) days, I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from all three credit reports and an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the inaccurate information.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued discrepancies and lack of verifiable documentation violate the FCRA by : 1. Reporting inaccurate and conflicting information. 
2. Failing to validate disputed entries.

3. Manipulating the statute of limitations by updating old accounts with false late payments. 

Resolution Requested : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX account from my credit reports if proper validation can not be provided. 
2. Updated credit reports reflecting the removal of this account or corrected information. 

Supporting Documentation : I am attaching : 1. Copies of my credit reports from XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX, highlighting the discrepancies. 
2. Previous dispute letters sent to the credit bureaus. 
3. Any correspondence related to the XXXX XXXX account. 

Impact on Me : The ongoing discrepancies have caused significant harm to my credit score, limiting my ability to access financial opportunities. This is unfair, misleading, and a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving proof of the investigation or an updated credit report reflecting the deletion of this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding a charged-off account that continues to be reported on my credit report, despite qualifying as income under IRS guidelines . The reporting of this account without the issuance of a 1099-C form is both misleading and a violation of my rights under federal law.

Background The account in question was charged off by the creditor, which legally classifies the balance as canceled debt and, therefore, taxable income under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P. According to this provision, creditors are required to issue a 1099-C form for canceled debts exceeding {$600.00}, allowing the debtor to report it as income to the IRS. However, I have not received a 1099-C for this account, yet the creditor continues to report the balance to the credit reporting agencies as an active charge-off.

Legal Basis for Complaint Violation of IRC 6050P : The internal revenue code mandates that creditors report cancelled debt exceeding {$600.00} to the IRS and provide the debtor with a 1099-C form. The failure to Issue this form not only prevents me from property reporting my taxable income But also raises concerns about the creditor 's adherence to federal law Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 16815-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Creditors and furnishers are obligated to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Reporting a charged-off account as delinquent without issuing the legally required 1099-C creates an inconsistency between the IRS classification and the creditor 's reporting practices, constituting inaccurate reporting under the FCRA.

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) 1036 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) : It is considered an unfair, deceptive, or abusive act or practice ( UDAAP ) to report a charged-off account as collectible or delinquent when it should be classified as
income and documented through a 1099-C.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax , Inc . Customer Data Security Breach Litigation U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Georgia ( Case No. XXXX ) The information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
Fraudulent Account/ Transaction/ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX ; Balance : {$9600.00} ; Opened : XX/XX/XXXX It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. There has been no legal proof of the marks has been provided or proven. I have reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the supporting documents, including the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. This unauthorized reporting has negatively impacted my credit standing. I respectfully request that the FTC, FDIC, & CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that the erroneous and derogatory information is removed from my credit report. I am also pursuing complaints at federal levels to address these violations because my consumer rights have been violated and belittled.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
15 U.S. Code 1681C-2 A consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt. It has been 30 days and you are in VIOLATION of this law because I am a victim of identity theft!! Please delete these items IMMEDIATELY!

These accounts should not be furnished on my consumer report as they are in VIOLATION!!! Under, 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Application ID XXXX I applied for an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX card on an XXXX XXXX flight via my XXXX XXXX Phone Android Application, as instructed by the flight attendant, as Barclays is marketing heavily with XXXX XXXX to promote this credit card. 

To my surprise, and something that is misleading and makes no sense, the Barclays App asked for a one time passcode to confirm my identity after submitting the application, which was not possible in flight on Americans wifi app, as I can not receive SMS in flight due to airplane mode settings. I understand SMS phone verification is standard on a web credit card application for identity verification, but barclays should be aware that it not feasible in flight and customize this flow accordingly to not punish applicants with high decline rates. 
As a result, I received no update about this SMS failure from Barclays, I contacted Barclays who said my application triggered a fraud review due to failed SMS and required 3 forms of very sensitive document uploads, which i faxed 3 times, and have not heard any update from Barclays. 

My XXXX XXXX has been impacted significantly by this application and I would prefer to be approved for the card as resolution with promised XXXX sign up bonus offer, else at minimum if Barclays can not issue me the card which would upset me, my credit inquiries should be removed due to this application platform poor design at Barclays.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I received a digital American Express pre-paid " gift '' card around Monday, XX/XX/year>. Since then, I have repeatedly tried to use this card online without any luck. The card is declined everywhere, often with little-or-no detail as to why, so I finally called AmEx to see what the problem was. The agent on the phone did not have incredibly helpful information to share, other than to try attaching it to my apple wallet and use XXXX to fix things, or just " trying again '' until the transaction went through. 

THIS DID NOT WORK EITHER. 

I have tried using this card on XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and the XXXX store. I have tried to buy everything from holiday gifts to groceries without luck. I have tried adding to applepay and to my paypal wallet and it never works. The card is always declined and I am worried this whole thing is some sort of scam at this point. These are major retailers who say the problem is on AmEx 's side. AmEx has been completely unwilling to issue me a refund or even a physical card I could use instead of this useless digital one. Their only " resolution '' is to " try again. '' This has to be fraud, right? They get to keep my funds by issuing digital cards they know no vendor will accept despite XXXX claims all over their site and the card 's balance page, such as : " For online shopping, use at merchants that require the XXXX number, expiration, and security code. '' Ok, I did. It was rejected. Now what? 
and " Your American Express eGift Card may be used at US merchants that accept American Express Cards. No ATM use. '' Laughably and provenly untrue at this point. I have asked for EXACTLY what merchants are guaranteed to accept this card and have not received anything beyond a vague " anyone who takes AmEx '' handwave. 

That is false advertising! The first result from XXXX shows that XXXX does, in fact, accept american Express... so why is this digital card being rejected? No one I have spoken with at American Express seems to have an answer other than " just try again ''. 

This virtual card is declined online and in brick and mortar stores, at restaurants and at grocery stores. Neither XXXX nor XXXX wallets even process transactions with it - no one will take this card. AMEX customer service claims they can not offer me any resolution. They can not tell me where I can use the cards, they can not transfer my balance to a physical card, they can not offer me a refund. 

This system seems designed to skim money from American consumers. They hold our legal tender hostage and tell us there is nothing they can do about it. They falsely advertise that their gift cards can be used anywhere that accepts American Express cards to trick us into believing they're a flexible gift to someone instead of cash. Instead, I have a digital card and my money is inaccessible. 

All I want is the total balance on my card in cash/check at this point so I can cease all dealings with this fraudulent company. 

My card 's number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and there is a balance of {$400.00} on it. Check it! I am so confident no one can use this flippin ' thing anywhere I am putting it in this message. Please help me.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days.

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : Accounts : XXXX XXXX Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
Customer 's financed XXXX XXXX ( Manufacturer & Lienholder ) vehicle was rendered INOPERABLE from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX due to Manufacturer/Lienholder 's INABILITY TO PRODUCE a critical part necessary for driving.

Part was INDEFINTELY backordered, rendering the vehicle unusable for a sum of five months. Despite Customer inquiring via phone/email ~50+ times for various remedies, deferred payments were presented as the ONLY solution, effectively shifting the financial burden to the Customer for a situation entirely caused by Mercedes-Benz 's. Customer continued to escalate support cases relative to reimbursement of interest accrued on the loan and monthly payments for the period when the vehicle was unusable, due to no fault other than the Manufacturer/Leinholder . 

Subsequent to suffering a total loss in XX/XX/XXXX, Manufacturer/Lienholder ( Mercedes-Benz ) is demanding repayment of these deferred payments, threatening to transfer my loan to an external collection agency unless a payment plan is setup in the amount of {$12000.00}. This demand is unreasonable and unjust, as it disregards the basic expectation of vehicle usability under the financing agreement and warranty. These actions not only harm the Customer financially but also damage their credit standing, compounding the harm caused by Mercedes-Benz 's failure to resolve the situation ethically and promptly Customer escalated a final 'loss of use ' compensation case with the 'Executive Referral Manager ' Team at Mercedes-Benz, to no avail . Manufacturer/Lienholder denied any responsibility and compensation, explaining " Subsequent to suffering a total loss, Customer is no longer owner of vehicle '', in addition to " Customer should've asked for compensation sooner '' -- both reasons being grossly unethical and untrue, supported by my documentation.

Note : A myriad of Mercedes-Benz Customer Service Representatives are on record admitting that the Customer should not suffer a financial consequence due to the Manufacturer 's inability to produce a part necessary for driving.

Note : Customer was not supplied a loaner during this five month period and auto insurance rental coverage expired after 30 days, forcing Customer to find transportation out-of-pocket XXXX days.

Consumer complaint narrative: I deposited a large check in person with BANK OF AMERICA. They placed a 7-business day hold on the check and did not make any funds available the next day. This means the funds will not be available for 10 days. Two days later, I deposited two smaller checks, reasoning that federal law requires that some funds be made available the next day for checks of this size. The bank again placed a 7-business day ( 10 day ) hold. Two of the three checks come from other banks located in the same city and state. I have used this bank for decades and have deposited similar size checks with no holds dozens of times. I have never deposited a bad check or bounced a check in my life. I can not function without some of these funds being released. I will be charged late fees and fear my utilities will be cut off. The bank is placing unreasonable holds and BREAKING FEDERAL LAW without reason or justification.
