Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I became aware of a XXXX account that is being handled by Amsher Collection Services and is listed on my credit report as a delinquent or past due account with XXXX. I tried contacting XXXX regarding this matter because the only thing that this debt could pertain to is a router for my home internet service which I returned to a XXXX and was issued a receipt for the router approximately 9 months ago. XXXX explained to me that the router was not properly logged in to their main warehouse and for that reason, I was never given credit for the router and that I needed to wait for the router to now be located, logged in at their main warehouse and then the proper credit would be issued to my account. I tried to explain to the agent at XXXX that this is now way beyond that. I told the agent that the account has been placed with a 3rd party collection agency and it is adversely affecting my credit in significant ways. The agent at XXXX referred me to their collection agency Amsher Collection Services at XXXX. 
I called Amsher on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with an agent who did not speak XXXX well enough for me to understand her name. I asked to speak with her supervisor and she declined to transfer me to anyone and said could only take a message. I went ahead and spoke to the very difficult to understand woman who went through a verification process which was really a pre written script in order to obtain my current contact and location information. The agent informed me that her final verification question included me providing her with a valid debit or credit card and allow her to charge {$1.00} to the card in order to prove my identity. At that point I asked the agent to please allow me to speak and to listen carefully and take notes and to stop me at any point if she had any questions. I then explained to the agent that A ) I do not owe the debt that is erroneously listed on my credit report by Amsher Collection Services. B ) I am hereby putting Amsher on notice that I am disputing the validity of the debt and request any and all documentation that Amsher can provide. I told the agent that I have not received a single notice from Amsher regarding their handling of the matter which is required under the FDCPA and that they are in violation of several State and Federal laws pertaining to collection of debts in particular the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( among others ) and that I do not owe this debt and that I have disputed this debt to the original credit granter who also has failed to validate the debt and instead, turned it over to Amsher as an alternative to validating the debt which also is a violation of the Law. The agent then attempted to convince me that I needed to contact the credit bureau itself if I disputed the debt and that the only way I would get relief from Amsher was to pay the debt in full. I again informed the agent that I do not owe the debt and why and that it is not my responsibility to prove that I dont owe it but rather it is XXXX and Amshers responsibility to prove that I do by providing documentation to include a written contract or other pertinent documentation and they have not done that. I have not received a single document from Amsher such as the 30 day notice to dispute the debt or any correspondence at all. The Amsher agent told me to contact the credit bureau if I dispute the debt or whats on my credit report. I informed the agent that me contacting the XXXX credit bureaus is not appropriate at this time and that I have disputed the debt with XXXX and now Amsher and that Amsher is reporting it to the Bureaus not XXXX and not the Bureaus themselves. And that I realize Amsher is only reporting what XXXX tells them to report however, they are responsible and liable for their own reporting and errors and that if I take legal action, it will be against Amsher as they are the Agency that is in violation of the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act and again, under the law, I do not have to prove anything. Its not my responsibility under the law to prove I do not owe this debt, it is their responsibility to prove that I do by providing legal documentation in the form of a written contract or other prudent, tangible documents. Not their internal notes or records but something signed by me either in writing or virtual signature and that they have not done that and can not do that because such documentation does not exist. Rather than continue a debate over the law which this collection agent clearly does not understand nor adhere to, I again asked to speak to a supervisor and the agent refused and said would have someone from their legal department call me back. I told the agent to cease and desist all phone calls or other forms of contact unless or until they can provide me with validation of the debt. I also informed the agent I would be filing a complaint with the CFPB, the FTC and the AZ State Attorney General for their unlawful collection practices and for reporting a erroneous debt to my credit report and failing to validate the debt as per the FDCPA. She stated that she understood and would request someone from their legal department call me and could not promise the account would be removed from my credit report or not. After the call ended I sent an email to the corporate office of Amsher requesting validation of the debt and a phone call from the legal department and have not received a single thing from them.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
( XXXX XXXX ) ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ( XXXX, Wisconsin XXXX ) ( XX/XX/year> ) Midland Credit Managem XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, Michigan XXXX Re : Verification of alleged debt pursuant Section 809 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) covering validation of debts : Case # XXXX To Whom It May Concem : This letter is being sent to you in response to a notice sent to me on ( date ). Be advised that this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to Sec. 809 ( b ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act that your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above named Title and Section. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you.

Please provide me with the following : * The basis of the alleged debt or, in other words, what the money you say I owe is for * An explanation as to how you mathematically calculated what you say I owe * Copies of any papers that show I agreed to pay what you say I owe ; * A certified copy of any judgment if applicable; * The name and address of the original creditor; * Proof that the Statute of Limitations has not expired on this account; * Sufficient evidence that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and * Your license numbers and the name and address of your Registered Agent.

Please be advised that if your offices have reported any incorrect information to any of the three major Credit Bureau 's ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ), such an action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports as a result of your company 's actions, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ; Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ; and/or Defamation of Character ; If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist.

Also during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel as to when suit may be filed. This includes the giving of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated or verifying an account as accurate when in fact there is no proof provided that it is.

If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request must be sent to me immediately.

I also am requesting that no telephone contact be made by your offices with my home or my place of employment. If your offices attempt telephone communication with me, including but not limited to computer generated calls and calls or correspondence sent to or with any third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will have no choice but to file suit. All future communications with me MUST be done in writing and sent to the address noted in this letter by the United States Postal Service.

It would be advisable that you assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. This is an attempt to correct your records, and any information obtained shall be used for that purpose. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection

Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am writing to dispute the letter I received today regarding the coerced debt under my name due to financial fraud and identity theft. I have already disputed this debt multiple times with XXXX XXXX XXXX and the original creditor, XXXX XXXX. Both parties are fully aware of my situation. 
Please see the attached documentation from several U.S. law enforcement agencies that support my claim. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX NOTE : As for your awareness, this report will be included in the FTC database, I am requesting an immediate investigation and audit of this bank for violating U.S. Consumer Financial Protection laws. if you have time to address this issue before an audit is conducted, please keep in mind the following consequences under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) for not honoring an electronic identity theft report filed with the FTC by a victim of financial fraud : Civil Penalties : The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) can indeed fine companies that do not comply with consumer financial protection laws in the U.S. The FTC has the authority to impose civil penalties for violations of laws such as the FTC Act, which prohibits unfair or deceptive business practices. The FTC can impose significant fines on violators, with each violation resulting in fines up to {$51000.00}. Additionally, each day a violation continues can be considered a separate offense, potentially increasing the total fines significantly. Additionally, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) also oversees CRAs and can take similar enforcement actions. Damages : Victims can sue for actual damages, statutory damages, and punitive damages, including compensation for financial losses, statutory damages for willful non-compliance, and punitive damages to punish the violator. Corrective Actions : Credit reporting agencies are required to correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information. Failure to do so is a violation of the FCRA. Legal Orders : Courts can issue orders to prevent further violations, ensuring compliance with the law. These measures are designed to protect consumers and ensure the accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. Furthermore, since I am a California resident, it is important to note that in California, if a creditor sells the debt of a victim of identity theft to a debt collector, it would be a violation of the Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act under California Civil Code Section 1788.18. This section specifically protects consumers who are victims of identity theft from debt collection actions on debts not rightfully theirs. Essentially, it is considered an unfair debt collection practice to sell a debt stemming from identity theft. The CFPB has already provided you with my updated Identity Theft Report filed with the FTC, along with supporting documents submitted to the local police and an FBI letter to creditors. I have done my part already! I authorize the CFPB to publish this for transparency.
Company: Law Office of Michael J. Scott, PC

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXXt has not only done this to just me but to others as well. I open my account and change my direct deposit through my job as I was waiting I didnt even have my card in the mail yet when I received an email saying that there was suspicious activity. They blocked my account until I provided an ID through email. I called first to make sure that this was real and the man on the phone made me send my ID to him and he unblocked my account, although he did not have an explanation as to how there was suspicious activity when there wasnt any transactions or any card even given to me yet. 
My wife sent me money over after I got my card so that I could get lunch one day. As soon as I use the card that day, they closed my account and said that due to suspicious activity, my account was permanently closed could not be reopened with XXXXXXXX XXXX  left inside. I called and had a fit and said that they were just discriminating against me because there was nothing that I did wrong and I told him that they could keep the XXXXXXXX XXXX. That evening I got an email saying that they were very sorry for the inconvenience and the mistake and they opened my account back up. You know the one that they said could not be opened back up again. My wife then sent me money to pay bills which was {$250.00}. As soon as I used XXXX XXXX to pay XXXX of the bills and close my account permanently again however, this time they will not open it back up and there is still {$100.00} left in there. Check in the mail I sent them verification. Needed to get the check in the mail however Im not receiving an answer. 
My first issue with this is the opening and closing of my account is just tampering with my funds. My second issue is the absolute discrimination towards me since I verified myself the first time and there is nothing I did wrong with my account for them to say anything was suspicious at all. They dont do these kinds of things to my wifes account. They just pick and choose who they want to scam. My last issue is my wife personally called and said that she wanted her money returned back to her instead of a check and they said that that wasnt possible. They just took our money when we are already struggling. 

Im not sure why after all of these complaints, Nobody has done anything about this company to protect us. I will do whatever it takes to shut this company down for what they did to us. The way they spoke to us and they are keeping every dollar that we have right now. 
This wasnt fair.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), to cease all communication with me regarding the above-referenced account. This request applies to any and all forms of communication, including but not limited to telephone calls, text messages, emails, letters, and any other medium of communication. Additionally, this directive explicitly includes any communication via my consumer report, as defined by the term " communication '' within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 2 ).

As per the FDCPA, once a debt collector receives a written request to cease communication, they are required to comply, except to notify the consumer that further collection efforts are being terminated or that specific actions may be taken as allowed by law. Any further communication in violation of this request will be reported to the appropriate regulatory agencies, and I will pursue all available legal remedies.

This letter is not to be construed as an acknowledgment or validation of any alleged debt. Please provide written confirmation that you have received and will comply with this cease-and-desist request. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I accidentally made a duplicate payment of {$110.00} on a loan I have. The vendor associated with this payment appears as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my checking account. 

The following day, XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted my bank, USAA, to request a stop payment on one of the payments. USAA informed me that they are unable to stop, cancel, or block an authorized direct draft until it posts to my account. They advised that once the payment posts, I can dispute it and place a stop payment on future charges from that merchant. 

I sought clarification from the USAA agent, specifically asking if I had to wait until the payment is deducted from my accountcausing my account to overdraft and resulting in a {$29.00} overdraft fee. The agent confirmed this, stating : " Yes, once authorized it can not be stopped, and stop payments only affect charges three business days forward of the date you request it. '' " It only affects future payments, not past or pending charges. Once it is pending on the account or posted, you may dispute it and stop payment only on future payments. '' I also informed the USAA agent that I had contacted the merchant directly but have not received a response from them regarding this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, American Express National Bank sent me emails confirming that the two IRS direct debit transactions I initiated from my savings account were successful. ( Attachment A ) One payment was for my XXXX income tax balance ( {$60000.00} ), and the second was for my XXXX first quarter estimated tax payment ( {$24000.00} ). ( Note to CFPB : Please redact the payment amounts if publishing this complaint. ) I had already confirmed that my savings account had more than sufficient funds for both payments.

Much to my surprise, on XX/XX/XXXX American Express National Bank froze my savings account due to fraud concerns and rejected both of my tax payments to the IRS. I only became aware of the rejected transactions when the IRS informed me that my account had been frozen. ( Attachments B, C ) Earlier that day, I had received a brief voicemail from the American Express fraud department asking me to call them back ( XXXX XXXX  Eastern ). I called American Express customer service twice on the same day, XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXXXXXX XXXX Eastern and XXXXXXXX XXXX Eastern, but the fraud department did not pick up my transferred calls even though they were still open until XXXXXXXX XXXX Eastern. The fraud department only answered my call the next day on XX/XX/XXXX. During my call with the fraud department, they were satisfied that no fraud had occurred, and they unfroze my account. I was then able to re-initiate both tax payments to the IRS, and the transactions were successfully processed on the same day. ( Attachments D, E ) I have provided my American Express XX/XX/XXXX account statement showing my beginning balance, all of the transactions I just described, and my ending balance. ( Attachment F ) However, as a result of American Express 's decision to freeze my account and reject the IRS payments from XX/XX/XXXX, the IRS assessed me dishonored payment penalties ( aka " bad check penalties '' ) of {$1200.00} for the {$60000.00} rejected payment and {$490.00} for the {$24000.00} rejected payment. ( Attachments G, H ) After I submitted a request to remove the penalty due to reasonable cause, the IRS informed me that in order for my bad check penalties to be removed, I must submit a letter from American Express National Bank explaining the circumstances that caused the dishonored payments. ( Attachment I ) Over the past seven months, I have provided many other supporting documents to the IRS in an effort to have the penalties removed for reasonable cause, yet the IRS is still insisting that they need a letter of explanation from American Express. ( Attachment J ) I have also spent countless hours on the phone with the fraud department at American Express trying to obtain such a letter. While the American Express customer service and fraud department employees have been sympathetic, they were unable to provide me with a vetted letter that said my account was frozen due to fraud concerns. They informed me that any custom letter must be generated by the bank 's legal department. The legal department never provided a letter that I could submit to the IRS despite the fraud department requesting such a letter on my behalf.

My last XXXX transactions were flagged and held by venmos AI run system which means they hold the funds from me for 5 days. When I request support they say there is nothing they can do. I requested a refund of the fees since their platform did not perform as promised and have been denied each time in the basis that its not a Venmo fee. Well it is, they make a profit off the transaction and its their system that keeps the transaction from completion. An AI should not govern in totality the transaction. I understand the need for security and quality control but holding peoples money after collecting a fee for a transaction that was never completed due solely to their own system is robbery, fraud and misrepresentation of what I am paying the fee for. I am not paid interest in the amount withheld or refunded even a portion of the fee. I works hard for my money and institutions like XXXX and Venmo have no right to withhold funds or collects fees for transactions that are never completed.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of the following account ( s ) on my consumer credit report, which constitutes violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq., and the Privacy Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. 68016802. This letter serves as both a formal dispute and a demand for the correction of these inaccuracies. 

Account in Dispute Collection Account : Central Portfolio Control Repeated reporting of the same delinquency months. 
Lack of documentation regarding the first delinquency date. 

Violations of Federal Law Failure to Ensure Accuracy Under the FCRA The FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ) requires furnishers of credit information to ensure accuracy and completeness. Your repeated reporting of duplicative, inconsistent, and inaccurate details about the account violates these provisions. Consumers are entitled to accurate and fair credit reporting, as emphasized in 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ). 

Invasion of Privacy The Privacy Protection Act ( 15 U.S.C. 68016802 ) mandates financial institutions to safeguard consumers nonpublic personal information. The dissemination of incorrect financial data on my credit report violates these privacy protections and constitutes an unlawful invasion of my privacy. 

Harassment and Unlawful Collection Practices Under the FDCPA As a survivor of XXXX XXXX, your attempts to collect on this debt and inaccurate reporting violate the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692d ), which prohibits oppressive and abusive practices. Federal law, specifically 18 U.S.C. 1595, provides protections for XXXX XXXX, rendering debts incurred under coercion or duress unenforceable. 

Case Law Support : Doe v. Debt Collector confirms that debts incurred under such circumstances are nullified and unenforceable. 

Demands Cease-and-Desist Communication Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I demand an immediate cessation of all communications regarding this account. Any further communication must be conducted solely through written correspondence or via the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. 

Immediate Correction of Reporting Errors Remove all inaccurate entries from my credit report, including duplicative delinquency months, repeated charge-offs, and incorrect balances. Additionally, provide documentation to substantiate the accuracy of the reporting, including : The date of the first delinquency. 
The date of the last payment. 
A detailed payment history. 
Validation of Debt Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, you must cease reporting this account until full validation is provided. Validation must include documentation from the original creditor and evidence of a reasonable and accurate investigation. 

Debt Forgiveness as a XXXX XXXX  Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1595 and federal protections for XXXX  of XXXX, I demand the immediate forgiveness and invalidation of all debts incurred under these circumstances. 

Acknowledgment and Compliance Timeline I require your written acknowledgment of this dispute within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to address these issues appropriately will result in further action, including filing a formal complaint with the CFPB and pursuing arbitration or legal proceedings. 

Conclusion Your continued failure to comply with the FCRA, FDCPA, and other applicable statutes is unacceptable.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally demand that you immediately remove the inaccurate and unauthorized credit reporting entry associated with my account. Transworld Systems I

nc. has violated my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, by failing to properly notify me of the debt before reporting it to credit bureaus. Under the FDCPA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a ), a debt collector is required to send a written notice within five days of their initial communication with the consumer, providing specific information about the debt. This includes the amount of the debt, the name of the creditor, and a statement that the consumer has the right to dispute the debt within 30 days. Transworld Systems Inc. has failed to provide me with this legally required notice before reporting this debt to the credit bureaus, which is a clear violation of my rights under the FDCPA.

Moreover, under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, any information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and substantiated. By failing to notify me of the debt prior to reporting it, Transworld Systems Inc. is reporting inaccurate and potentially misleading information that may harm my creditworthiness. The failure to verify and validate the debt before reporting it constitutes a violation of the FCRA.

This letter also serves as a formal 15-day notice of my intent to take legal action if these issues are not resolved. If Transworld Systems Inc. fails to remove the incorrect reporting from my credit report within the next 15 days, I will initiate a lawsuit under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) and FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692k ). I will seek statutory damages, actual damages, and legal fees incurred due to your noncompliance with the law.

Additionally, I will file a formal complaint with the Office of the Attorney General for the state of [ State ], as well as with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Transworld Systems Inc. 's failure to comply with the FDCPA and FCRA has violated both federal and state consumer protection regulations, and I will pursue all legal avenues to ensure that your company is held accountable.

Please treat this matter with the urgency it requires and take immediate action to remove the erroneous reporting from my credit file. Failure to comply will result in legal consequences, including the filing of the lawsuit and complaints to the Attorney General and other relevant authorities.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I joined Sofi in the fall of XXXX, attracted to its high interest savings account. In the following months I put money into a savings account, a checking account, and a couple investment accounts. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to deposit a check which was a reimbursement from my health insurance company for {$1800.00}. The following day, XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to use my debit card and it was declined. I called XXXX and they informed me my account was restricted. They told me I had violated the user terms, but refused to tell me what I had done which constituted a violation. They said my account was scheduled for closure pending an investigation. They refused to provide more details. They refused to provide a timeline for the investigation and directed me to check the app regularly for more details. On the app, a red banner is displayed above my account details which reads : " Account restricted " Your account is currently restricted. Please reach out to us as soon as you can for more information. '' There is an in-app support chat feature called Sofi Virtual Assistant. When I enter this chat, I received the following series of messages : " We take the safety and security of your account very seriously. In reviewing your SoFi Bank Account, there appears to have been activity which indicates that the account may have been used in violation of the authorized activity guidelines described in XXXX SoFi Bank Deposit Account Agreement.

" For your protection your account has been temporarily restricted., We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience, but during this time you will not be able to deposit or withdraw from the account, transfer funds, m or make purchases with your debit card. 
" We need to speak with you to discuss your account details. Please call us at : " XXXX '' Over the course of the next month, I periodically checked the app for updates. Although I continued to receive notifications from the app about my investments, credit score, and monthly spending ( from other accounts ), these notifications I have quoted above remained unchanged. All the person at the phone number said was to check the app, and all the app ever said was to call the phone number. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I called them again. This was a Sunday ; I have an irregular schedule and didn't think about that until I was already on the phone. Someone did answer though, and whoever it was, was the only person I ever spoke to who sounded earnest in trying to help. They still couldn't provide me with much more information, but they said they would make a note for " the investigation team '' that I had called. Just before getting off the phone, they asked about a " beneficiary '', XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX is my stage name, under which I have a XXXX account, which had been connected to my SoFi account. I assured the person on the phone that XXXX XXXX was myself, not a third party. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I called them again, having heard nothing from them in the interim between calls. The person I spoke to chastised me for not calling sooner. They said the investigation team needed the contact information for XXXX ( my health insurance company ) and they have needed that information for months, with an attitude as if I had been purposefully withholding that information. I said that no one had ever contacted me to request that information, nor had anybody mentioned that on the previous XXXX phone calls I had made, but I did provide the information. They refused again to provide a timeline for the investigation. They again directed me to check the app for updates. The app continues to direct me to the phone number. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I called them again. This time I was told, almost verbatim, the exact same thing I was told on the very first phone call. My account was restricted due to a terms violation and scheduled for closure. I asked if the investigation had concluded, and they said it had. They refused to provide a timeline for closure. They refused to confirm if I would actually get my money when my account was closed. They once again directed me to check the app for updates. 
Today is XX/XX/XXXX. I have heard nothing from them since, and the notifications on the app remain unchanged. I have {$230.00} in banking accounts with SoFi and {$150.00} in investment accounts with them, all of which I am unable to access.

Product: Checking or savings account

Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/year>, I discovered that my Chase debit card was missing. Upon logging into my online account, I was astounded to find numerous unauthorized transactions, comprising multiple large ATM and debit transactions, originating from XX/XX/year>, through XX/XX/year>. To prevent further fraudulent activity, I promptly blocked my Chase debit card through my online account. Subsequently, I contacted Chase customer service to report the loss or theft of my card and also informed them that the PIN number was written on the back of the missing debit card. 
I also confirmed that the most recent authorized transaction was on XX/XX/year>, for gasoline, which declined. Immediately after, Chase notified me via email asking me to confirm if I authorized the transaction. I promptly responded affirmatively, and I was able to retry the transaction successfully around XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/year>. I have included a screenshot of the relevant email for your reference. The unauthorized transactions started to occur the following day on XXXX XXXX. Claim was filed on XX/XX/year> for all XXXX unauthorized transactions. 
Two days after filing my claim, I received multiple letters from Chase on XXXX XXXX & XXXX XXXX informing me that my claim had been denied but I received provisional credit for only one of the ATM transactions. I contacted Chase claims department on XX/XX/year> to inquire as to why my claim was denied, I was informed it was due to two reasons : the main one being the PIN number being written on the back of the card and the second one is inability of Chase to validate if the transactions were unauthorized. However, I find these reasons untenable, as I did not give my debit card to another individual nor did I authorize any of the disputed transactions. Chase didnt send me any fraud email or text alerts in regard to the disputed transactions. Simply because my PIN number was written on the card does not absolve Chase from the responsibility of reversing these unauthorized transactions. This constitutes a clear violation of my rights as a consumer. I promptly reported these transactions and also took proactive measures, such as blocking my card, to minimize potential losses.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Financial Fraud, Mishandling of Personal Information, and Unauthorized Sale of Data by Portfolio Recovery Associates Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Portfolio Recovery Associates ( PRA ) for the illegal mishandling of my personal information and potential financial fraud. I believe that PRA has committed serious violations of consumer protection laws, including the unauthorized sale of my personal data and debt collection practices that may be unlawful under federal and state law. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to address these issues and ensure that PRA is held accountable for their actions. 

Summary of Violations : On XXXX, I discovered that Portfolio Recovery Associates had illegally mishandled my personal information and may have sold or transferred it to third-party entities without my explicit consent. This mishandling appears to include, but is not limited to, my Social Security Number ( SSN ), address, and other sensitive financial information. This action constitutes a clear violation of my privacy rights and consumer protection laws.

Moreover, I believe that PRA has engaged in fraudulent activities by either misreporting the status of my debt, failing to provide accurate documentation to validate the debt, or participating in deceptive practices surrounding debt collection. Additionally, the unauthorized sale of my personal and financial information to third parties is an egregious violation of consumer privacy laws and financial regulations. 

Key Violations : Unauthorized Sale and Transfer of Personal Data : The sale or unauthorized transfer of my personal information, including my SSN, address, and financial details, constitutes a breach of privacy under multiple federal and state laws. 
Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692-1692p : PRA, as a debt collector, must follow strict guidelines regarding the handling of consumer information. Any unauthorized disclosure or sale of personal data is prohibited under the FDCPA.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. : The mishandling of my personal information by PRA may have resulted in inaccurate or incomplete information being reported to credit bureaus, violating my rights to accurate credit reporting and privacy.

Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) 15 U.S.C. 68016809 : The GLBA protects consumers ' personal financial information from unauthorized sharing or selling. The sale of my personal information by PRA is a clear violation of the protections outlined in this act.

Fraudulent Debt Collection Practices : PRA has failed to provide me with valid proof of debt as required by law, and I believe they have misrepresented the debts status in violation of the FDCPA.

FDCPA 1692g : Debt collectors must provide written validation of the debt upon request. PRA has either failed to comply with these requirements or misrepresented the status of my debt.

Misreporting and Inaccurate Credit Reporting : If PRA has incorrectly reported information to the credit bureaus regarding the status of the debt or its collection activities, they may be violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Penal Codes and Potential Consequences : The illegal sale and mishandling of my personal information by Portfolio Recovery Associates may subject the company to the following penalties : Civil Penalties and Damages under the FDCPA : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), consumers can recover statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} for violations of the Act, such as illegal debt collection practices, the sale of personal data, or failure to provide debt validation.

Punitive Damages and Compensation under the FCRA : If Portfolio Recovery Associates has misreported my credit or mishandled my personal data, I may be entitled to actual damages for harm to my credit, punitive damages ( if the violation is willful ), and attorneys fees under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Penalties under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) : If PRAs actions violate GLBA privacy protections, they could face substantial fines and penalties for improperly disclosing consumer information.

State Law Violations : Depending on my state of residence, PRA may also face penalties under state consumer protection laws that prohibit the sale of personal information without consent, including the California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ), which protects against unauthorized sales of consumer data.

Civil Penalties : Some state laws may impose penalties of up to {$2500.00} per violation for selling consumer information without consent.

Requested Action : Given the severity of these violations, I am requesting that the CFPB take the following actions : Investigate the illegal mishandling of my personal data and the unauthorized sale of my financial information by Portfolio Recovery Associates.

Remove any negative marks related to this debt from my credit reports, as this debt was likely mismanaged and mishandled.

Ensure that PRA takes corrective action by deleting my personal information from their records and from any third-party collection agencies or entities to whom it may have been sold.

Enforce appropriate penalties for violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and GLBA, including statutory damages, punitive damages, and reimbursement for financial harm caused by this misconduct.

Provide me with written confirmation that the debt has been properly validated, all errors have been corrected, and any adverse actions on my credit report have been removed.

Conclusion : I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to investigate this matter and hold Portfolio Recovery Associates accountable for its illegal actions. I look forward to a timely resolution of this issue, and I am prepared to pursue all legal remedies available to me if this matter is not addressed.

Thank you for your attention to this complaint. I am confident that your agency will take the necessary steps to protect my rights as a consumer and ensure that Portfolio Recovery Associates is held accountable for their misconduct

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), to cease all communication with me regarding the above-referenced account. This request applies to any and all forms of communication, including but not limited to telephone calls, text messages, emails, letters, and any other medium of communication. Additionally, this directive explicitly includes any communication via my consumer report, as defined by the term " communication '' within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 2 ).

As per the FDCPA, once a debt collector receives a written request to cease communication, they are required to comply, except to notify the consumer that further collection efforts are being terminated or that specific actions may be taken as allowed by law. Any further communication in violation of this request will be reported to the appropriate regulatory agencies, and I will pursue all available legal remedies. 

This letter is not to be construed as an acknowledgment or validation of any alleged debt. Please provide written confirmation that you have received and will comply with this cease-and-desist request. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear JPMorgan Chase & Co., I am writing to formally dispute your claim of ownership and collection rights over the debt associated the account : ( XXXX ). After conducting a thorough review of the records pertaining to this account, I have identified the following issues : 1. Transfer of Debt to Chase Issuance Trust : I have clear and indisputable evidence that the debt in question was transferred to the Chase Issuance Trust under filing number XXXX. As such, ownership of this debt was legally transferred to the trust, and there is no record indicating that it was subsequently reassigned or transferred back to you. Therefore, you no longer have the legal standing to collect on this debt. 
2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The continued reporting of this debt under your name is a direct violation of the FCRA. Reporting inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies undermines the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile, causing unnecessary harm to my financial standing. 
I am formally requesting that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this debt and ensure that all references to this debt are removed from my credit reports with all consumer reporting agencies. Failure to comply with this request may leave me with no choice but to pursue legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and any other applicable laws. 
Please confirm in writing within 30 days of receiving this letter that : You have ceased all collection activities related to this account. 
All references to this debt have been removed from my credit reports. 
If you believe this matter requires further clarification or documentation, please contact me in writing at the address provided above. I expect your prompt attention to this matter and resolution in accordance with applicable laws. 
Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

They requested ownership documents linking my name to the business, which I already provided when I opened the account. They informed me they did not have these documents to refer to. I now have to call several vendors and tell them not to cash checks for payment that is due from my company. This damages my business reputation and I am being penalized while doing nothing wrong. The checks are legal and earned legally and written out to my company. I have had transactions related to this business paying vendors for over 4 months with other large transfers into and out of the account. The issuer of the check is a large publically traded company who vetted me and my company as well. My business produces and sells crude oil and these transactions are normal for this type of business and production level. They informed me this freeze may last 30 days which is completely unnecessary and shows no regard for my business or reputation. My legally earned funds are being unjustly withheld for an excessive amount of time for no good reason. Please help

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, Account # XXXX This letter serves as a formal Notice of Dispute and Pre-Arbitration Demand regarding the alleged debt you claim I owe. Since you purchased this alleged debt from XXXX, you are subject to the arbitration agreement included in the original XXXX agreement. 

I am well aware that initiating arbitration under this agreement will cost your company thousands of dollars. Additionally, I understand that this alleged debt was likely purchased for pennies on the dollar. Given these circumstances, I am extending you an opportunity to resolve this matter amicably. 

Settlement Offer : I demand a payment of {$XXXX} as compensation for the XXXX, emotional distress, and financial hardship this alleged debt has caused me. 
You must delete this tradeline from all credit reporting agencies and any other parties to whom it has been reported.

Documentation Request : To validate your claim, you must provide the following : 1. The chain of assignment or title of the debt, showing how and when you acquired it.

2. The date of first delinquency.

3. The amount of my last payment and supporting records.

If you fail to provide this information, it will constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and demonstrate that your reporting is inaccurate. 

Please be aware that if this matter escalates to arbitration, I am fully prepared to proceed, understanding that the initiation fees alone will cost your company over {$XXXX}. 

You have 14 days from the receipt of this letter to respond with the requested documentation and confirm whether you accept this settlement offer. Failure to respond appropriately within the specified time frame will leave me no choice but to initiate arbitration and pursue all legal remedies available to me. 

This letter is not a waiver of any rights under federal or state law. I urge you to take this opportunity to resolve this matter efficiently and avoid further financial and reputational consequences.

Consumer complaint narrative: My mortgage has an escrow account, and First Citizens did not use it to pay my home insurance dues. My home insurance company spoke to them on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX and were told payment would be made through escrow, no problem. The bill and policy were confirmed to be received by first citizens on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX my insurance company and my husband called because our payment was past due and our policy was going to be cancelled. Both were told on the phone the check was in the mail overnighted and would arrive ups the next day. No check arrived. I called back four times on the XXXX the day our policy was to cancel and was told the check was never sent and that first citizens had not yet made any attempt to pay the bill. I was denied speaking to a supervisor, waited on hold over three hours between all the calls, and had to demand the bill be paid that day. I was told a check would be mailed by XXXX on the XXXX, which would be after the policy was already canceled. I was then told they could pay by credit card and that the bank would pay the fee. I called back two hours later and was told that the information I was given was a lie, that the credit card fee would be paid by me - for the banks mistake. They entered a request for the fee to be covered by the bank as it was the banks error and I was told I couldnt speak to the department that handles payments and that the representative I was on the phone with also was not willing to call them to get an update or to push for the payment to be made immediately. This was at XXXX on a Friday night, going into a weekend and a week with two bank holidays. No one in the office said Im sorry we will get this fixed immediately. On each call I asked for confirmation that the bill would be paid and was never given it. I called back after close of business in Texas and it still hasnt been paid. I was told Id get a call before XXXX when it was done and never got a call. My insurance company also called first citizens twice on the XXXX and emailed twice. On the phone I was never told Im sorry for our mistake we will get the payment made today. I was only ever told that it was noted that it hadnt been paid. I want my escrow account closed so that I can pay my taxes and insurance as the bank is not responsible enough to do it. I am not willing to let a bank hold my money hostage and allow me to lose my home insurance. Given that this is all the banks error I will not pay any fees to have my escrow account closed.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Gateway Financial Solutions XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, MI. XXXX Subject : Notice of Securities Fraud and Violations of 16 CFR 433.1 and Truth in Lending Act Dear Gateway Financial Solutions, I am writing to formally address and notify you of significant legal concerns regarding my account. Specifically, the financing arrangement between myself, Gateway Financial Solutions, and the car dealership XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated applicable laws and regulations, including 16 CFR 433.1 and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ).

1. Violation of 16 CFR 433.1 ( The Holder Rule ) According to 16 CFR 433.1, a car dealership acting as a seller is required to offer a money purchase loan or cash advance rather than a finance loan. The contract provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to comply with this requirement, as no money purchase loan or cash advance was offered or extended to me. This failure constitutes a clear violation of the Holder Rule, which protects consumers from deceptive lending practices.

2. Invalid Contractual Arrangement Under 16 CFR 433.1, a contract is valid only between the seller, the creditor, and the finance company. At no point did I, as the consumer, directly engage in a contractual agreement that properly meets the formal or informal requirements of this regulation. It is unclear how and at what stage I entered into this financial arrangement, as the retail installment sale contract fails to adequately reflect the legal standing of all parties involved.

3. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violations The contract in question discloses compliance with the Truth in Lending Act. However, the failure to provide me with a money purchase loan or cash advance renders the contract invalid under TILA provisions. The terms of fi
nancing were misrepresented, leading to a lack of transparency and informed consent on my part.

4. Language Fraud in the Retail Installment Sale Contract The contract presented by XXXX XXXX XXXX contains misleading and fraudulent language regarding the nature of the financial arrangement. The terms and conditions fail to clarify the proper legal and financial relationship between the seller, the creditor, and the consumer. Such deceptive language amounts to fraud and violates my rights as a consumer. 

Conclusion and Request for Resolution Based on the above points, I firmly believe that Gateway Financial Solutions and XXXX XXXX XXXX have participated in securities fraud and deceptive lending practices. I request immediate action to address these violations, including a full review and cancellation of the fraudulent contract. 

Please provide a written response within 15 days acknowledging receipt of this notice and outlining the steps you will take to resolve these issues. If no satisfactory resolution is provided, I reserve the right to pursue further legal action and file complaints with relevant regulatory authorities. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

In a letter dated XX/XX/year> from Citibank that I received in the mail, I was informed that a credit line for Wayfair had been opened in my name. A week or so later I noticed through my credit monitoring with XXXX that this card now appeared on my credit report. I did not open this account. Someone stole my identity to open it and then immediately charged items to the full limit of the credit on the account. I dont know where the items were shipped because the billing statements I have received do not divulge that information. 

My wife and I were away in XXXX when this all happened so I did not take any action until XXXX when we returned home. I immediately froze my credit at all 3 bureaus, initiated a fraud report and filled out an FTC Identity Theft report. 

I called Citibank in XXXX and in a letter dated XX/XX/year> the account had been officially closed. However I still was not discharged the responsibility of paying for this balance which I did not accrue. 

For the last 4 months I have called multiple times and have been given the run-around by Citibank. I have filed a police report, at Citibank 's request, with my local sheriff. I have furnished Citibank with this report multiple times by fax, online submission and even through the mail. They have told me on the phone that they have never received this report or any other materials they have asked me to send them. 

I am currently attempting to rectify this directly through XXXX. They are working on my case and will forward the police report to Citibank and hopefully that will end this nightmare.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ESURGENT CAPITAL SERVICES XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX RE : XXXX Dear Customer Service of RESURGENT CAPITAL SERVICES Because you have not provided a valid contract containing my wet ink signature agreeing to this alleged debt this Letter shall serve as formal notice of my Intent to file a lawsuit against your company, due to your blatant and objectionable disregard of the law and I request that you CEASE and DESIST in your efforts to collect on the above-referenced account. It is my personal policy as a private civilian not to deal with collection agencies and I will only deal with the original creditor of this account. You are hereby instructed to cease all collection efforts immediately or face legal sanctions under applicable Federal Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( c ) and ( k ) and State law. The items must be deleted from my credit files with the four major credit reporting bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX ) within 72 hours, you shall forward a Letter stating it has been removed and will not reappear on the principals credit reports again by you or another collection agency. I will file a lawsuit for multiple violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. I will be seeking civil liability for {$1000.00} per violation. 
Please inform any credit reporting agencies to which you have reported this debt to, that this debt is currently in dispute. I will require proof that you have done this. You are also required to cease and desist from contacting me in this and any related matters unless it is by United States Mail, and only to inform me that you are terminating all efforts to collect or that you are taking specific court legal action. The FDCPA states you must cease collection activity until you have produced verification of the alleged debt if so requested. As per the FTC, this includes reporting to the credit bureaus, which you have done illegally. It is quite evident that no such proof of this alleged debt exists or you would have provided it in the previous 4 months since it was requested. Also, when an alleged debt is disputed, a notation must be entered on the Principal 's credit report showing the item as in dispute. Again, this was not done. Im sure you are aware of the consequences of violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act as well as the multiple violations your company is now responsible for.

FCRA 1. 623. Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies [ 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ] ( a ) ( 3 ) Duty to provide notice of dispute.

2. 611. Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information.

FDCPA 1. 805. Communication in connection with debt collection [ 15USC1692c ] ( c ) Ceasing Communication 2. 809. Validation of debts [ 15 USC 1692g ] As per the FDCPA : 813. Civil liability [ 15 USC 1692k ] ( a ) Except as otherwise provided by this section, any debt collector who fails to comply with any provision of this title concerning any person is liable to such person in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) any actual damage sustained by such person as a result of such failure ; ( 2 ) ( A ) in the case of any action by an individual, such additional damages as the court may allow, but not exceeding {$1000.00}. 

GIVE THIS LETTER THE IMMEDIATE ATTENTION IT DESERVES. 
In Good Faith THIS IS AN ATTEMPT TO BRING AN ACTION IN COURT, ANYTHING WRITTEN OR SAID WILL BE USED AGAINST YOU

Consumer complaint narrative: To Whom It May Concern : Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Cease and Desist Request Under FDCPA Section 1692XXXX ( c ) | Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern : This letter serves as a formal demand under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C . 1692c ( c ), that you immediately cease and desist all attempts to collect the alleged debt associated with the account number XXXX. You are prohibited from contacting me by any means, including phone, email, postal mail, or other forms of communication, except as permitted by law to notify me of the termination of collection efforts or any legal action you intend to pursue. 

In addition, I request full validation of this alleged debt to ensure its accuracy. If you intend to assert that this debt is valid, you must provide the following documentation : 1. A complete account history, including itemized charges, fees, and payments made on the account.

2. Evidence that Absolute Resolution Investments has the legal authority to collect this debt. 
XXXX. A copy of the original signed agreement that created this debt. 

Failure to provide the requested documentation substantiating the validity of this alleged debt will be considered further evidence of unlawful and deceptive practices. 

I also remind you of the legal precedent set in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which held that reporting a debt to credit reporting agencies constitutes a form of communication under the FDCPA. Any continued reporting of this alleged debt to credit bureaus without proper validation will be considered a violation of the FDCPA. 

Please be advised that noncompliance with this demand or any continued attempts to collect this alleged debt without proper validation may result in legal action being taken against you. I reserve the right to pursue all remedies available under federal and state law, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), state regulatory agencies, or initiating a lawsuit for damages and attorneys fees as permitted under the FDCPA. 

I expect written confirmation within 15 days of receipt of this letter that you will comply with my cease-and-desist request and provide the requested documentation if you claim this debt is valid.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am resubmitting this issue due to the recent articles in the press regarding Wells Fargo and XXXX. I would like our issue to be used to address and resolve this problem with the banks. 

BELOW IS A COPY OF THE ORIGINAL SUBMISSION : I recently placed an item for sale on XXXX XXXX XXXX, a potential buyer contacted me to let me know that she was interested and would be sending a bank guaranteed check via registered mail. When the check for {$XXXX} arrived to cover the purchase price and transportation I deposited the check electronically into my Wells Fargo account on Sunday XXXX XX/XX/year>. While checking my bank account on Tuesday XXXX XXXX I noticed that the check had been cleared which concerned me that it had been cleared so quickly as I had read that checks can take XXXX days to clear. I then phoned the bank ( XXXX approximately XXXX ) to confirm that the check had been fully cleared and approved, I was told that it had, and everything was in order and the funds where available to be used. 

Soon after this call the buyer contacted me to say that her child had been involved in an accident and she needed to cancel the transaction and asked me to return {$XXXX} of the funds. I then transferred {$XXXX} via XXXX into her account in the evening of Tuesday XXXX XXXX. 

On the XXXX XXXX, midday, I was checking my bank details again and I noticed that the check was now showing as pending. I drove directly to my Wells Fargo bank in XXXXXXXX XXXX  to find out what was going on. I was told by Wells Fargo that the check now looked suspicious, hence the revert back to pending status, and at their recommendation I cancelled my old account checking account and created a new one as this now looked like a scam. 

At the bank they created an incident report and contacted the banks fraud department who said that they would get back to me within XXXX to XXXX  days. Due to the lack of response, I phoned Wells Fargo on several occasions to follow up on the status of the {$XXXX} I am out of pocket. I was transferred between the fraud department, customer complaints and the XXXX department XXXX XXXX trying to find out who could help me with this issue. I asked XXXX if they could contact the receiving bank and was told that they had sent a request and that is all they could do. All departments said they could not help me and that I had been scammed. The original deposit was reversed by the fraud department which I totally agree on. On XXXX of the calls, I was put through to a claims dispute department and they said they would follow up. I then received a call from them and they said there was nothing they could do about it. I again told them that Wells Fargo was responsible for allowing me to transfer {$XXXX} from the check and that I would like a copy of the voice recording where Wells Fargo assured me that the check was cleared and there was no problem with it. Again, they said they would get back to me. I received an email Monday, XXXX XXXX stating that I would need a court order to obtain a copy of the recording and if I felt I was a victim of a financial crime I should contact law enforcement. 

By nature, I am a very cautious person, and I would never have transferred the funds if I had not received confirmation directly from the bank that the check had been fully cleared, as such I believe that the bank is accountable and as such should refund the {$XXXX}. 

Please do not hesitate to call me on XXXX XXXX XXXX or contact me via email XXXX if you require any more XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

I requested the information that must have or possess by law in order for you to furnish a payment as late.

This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX ) has previously revoked and rescinded power of attorney and security interests that may have been provided to AMERICAN EXPRESS through any agreements/contracts/CMA-if this was unclear , let it now be known and applied, any and all security interest ( whether through primary or secondary markets, insurance, principal or interest proceeds ) that may have been previously offered or provided to AMERICAN EXPRESS through any agreement/contract, acquiescence , ignorance/lack of knowledge in/of the matter, is hereby rescinded and shall be applied to XXXX XXXX immediately for all past, current and future securities, as XXXX XXXX is now competent to understand the rights and contractual agreements made between AMERICAN EXPRESS and XXXX XXXX and how those rights may have been given to AMERICAN EXPRESS to counter their own obligations of this indebtness as guarantor of debt as described in their SEC filings. 

While XXXX XXXX may have agreed to transfer of securities by AMERICAN EXPRESS, which resulted in these securities being traded on the secondary market as described in AMERICAN EXPRESS SEC filings and XXXX XXXX may have previously given authority or permission for AMERICAN EXPRESS to keep the proceeds and/or interest on this account, XXXX XXXX is now demanding a refund for all interest of any and all security interests of this account in accordance with the 80/20 rule whereas XXXX XXXX is entitled to 80 % of the proceeds of the securities on this account and AMERICAN EXPRESS is afforded 20 % for their efforts in transferring these securities. XXXX XXXX demands that AMERICAN EXPRESS abide by their SEC filings, The Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as well as their prospectus, XXXX and XXXX forms provided to the SEC regarding their responsibility of guarantor on the accounts held by AMERICAN EXPRESS including their duty to repay all indebtness and obligations and their fiduciary duties to act within the best interest of the beneficiaries ( XXXX XXXX ) -IMMEDIATELY. 
Certified documentary evidence that AMERICAN EXPRESS is not in fact in violation of the IRS IRM by not providing copies of 1099s on this account to XXXX XXXX as the IRS PUBLICATIONS require. If AMERICAN EXPRESS has certified documentary evidence to the contrary, it must be provided to XXXX XXXX in writing via certified mail to the address on file, otherwise, it will be assumed these pertinent tax documents were not filed and copies not provided to XXXX XXXX as IRM requires ( any debt over {$600.00} charged off to be reported as income. ) Please provide copies of all tax documents filed or that shall be filed in accordance with IRM/US Code.

Certified GAAP accounting ( including bookkeeping entries ) and tax documents are required evidencing AMERICAN EXPRESS has not been issued any funds or write offs ( credits, currency, monies, securities or any other form ) of payment, discharge or setoff forgiveness, etc., on behalf of this account for the obligation whether that be from the US Government in accordance with 31 U.S. Code 3123, IRS Publication of 1099s, profits and proceeds from any transfer or exchange on primary or secondary markets or any insurance/s on this account that AMERICAN EXPRESS has in conjunction with this account. Given this information, with special attention to 31 U.S. Code 3123, please lawfully explain how AMERICAN EXPRESS was not " paid '' and the liability of this debt not resolved, and as a result, this account has not been a billing error and reflected inaccurately to CRAs.

Evidence that the payment of liability of this debt has not been provided, afforded, negated OR had the potential to be paid, discharged or the like, based off of the proceeds of said securities, insurance, the current laws, regulations, requirements or acts, to be applied to the said indebtness had the trustee appropriately applied their guidance and acted within their fiduciary duties with regards to the best interests of the beneficiary/conservatorship account as promised in their SEC filings and required as a basic function of the accepted role as trustee rather than intentionally misrepresenting information, misleading and directing or otherwise diverting funding away from beneficiaries that were in or may have been in a conservatorship relationship due to their infancy, ignorance or lack of knowledge, yet, still rightfully entitled to said proceeds and all benefits of account in question.

In regards to the reporting of this account accurately, please explain how AMERICAN EXPRESS is reporting this account accurate considering the copies of statements provided by AMERICAN EXPRESS qualify as nonmailable matter and therefore can not be in compliance with:15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ; as a result, this account should have never been reflected/reported as late and it should never have been closed.

After careful review of the statements provided by AMERICAN EXPRESS coupled with review of 15 U.S. Code 1666d - Treatment of credit balances : Credit Balance-A credit balance ( designated CR ) shown on this statement represents money owed to you. If within the six-month period following the date of the first statement indicating the credit balance you do not request a refund or charge enough to use up the credit balance, we will send you a check for the credit balance within 30 days if the amount is {$1.00} or more.

( C ) make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order any part of the amount of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months, except that no further action is required in any case in which the consumers current location is not known by the creditor and can not be traced through the consumers last known address or telephone number. With this being said, XXXX XXXX is now demanding this account be refunded for all past, current and future statements and a check mailed to the account on file for this account-immediately. 

Lastly, AMERICAN EXPRESS has taken adverse action on this account against XXXX XXXX in violation of FCRA as the negative reporting and closing of this account is adverse to the interests of the consumer. This account shall be reopened as AMERICAN EXPRESS CMA states it can be, at the account holders request. 
AMERICAN EXPRESS is in violation of their fiduciary duties and custodianship of this account as they have failed to act in the best interest of the account holder and investor XXXX XXXX. Should AMERICAN EXPRESS continue to ignore or otherwise not honor any and all requests made by the holder and beneficial owner of this account and the interest herein in accordance with the securities exchange act and their own prospectus provided within their XXXX and XXXX forms to the SEC, XXXX XXXX is prepared to pursue any and all legal and lawful means of remedy regarding this account including reporting to regulatory agencies such as the CFPB, FTC and any and all other regulatory agencies.

No one can or will give me any information. XXXX keeps saying they are waiting on the Dept of Education, but that is not true. Dept of Education sent them the info a long time ago. There has been a standing order for months to discharge the terminal loans for class members. 

I am not the only one waiting on Mohela to do what is required from the court settlement. There are thousands. The other servicers are making progress. Not a single person with Mohela has seen anything happen with their loans. They have been in constant violation of the courts order since the settlement was agreed on in XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX has repeatedly instructed them to do what is required of the settlement and they are not. 

The most recent excuse is that they are building a new system. Three years into the settlement. Frankly, this is not my problem or the problem of any other class member. If they want a new system for future use, that is their problem. We should not be forced to wait longer on this manufactured delay. It is another stall tactic.

Consumer complaint narrative:
As part of the process of applying for a loan, I found an item on my Experian credit report that I did not recognize. On XX/XX/year>, I sent a letter by Certified Mail asking for Experian to remove the item as it was incomplete ( original creditor and account number missing ). 

I received no response to that letter, but when my credit report was updated the following month, the name and address of the creditor had been added. I wrote by Certified Mail on XX/XX/year> to the creditor, XXXX XXXX XXXX, for validation. '' Specifically, evidence showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay. I also requested that XXXX provide the record that reflects the process by which my signature was generated/executed. 

More than 30 days passed without receiving the information I requested. However, the item was ( and is ) still appearing on my credit report. On XX/XX/year>, I again wrote to Experian to request a re-investigation into the inaccurate record in my credit report. I asked that they respond with the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information ; the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding the alleged account ( NOT e-OSCAR or other electronic means of authentication ) ; and any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed. That letter to Experian was delivered by Certified Mail on XX/XX/year>. To date ( XX/XX/year> ) I have received to response, and the item remains on my credit report. 

I believe this to be a violation of the FDCPA and FCRA, respectively, as neither entity can demonstrate that I am responsible for this alleged debt.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>, XXXX was managing my account. They had the wrong debt amount and informed me they would submit a dispute to confirm the correct balance. However, I never received a follow-up regarding this dispute or any resolution. In XX/XX/year>, my account was updated as a charge-off on my credit report, even though the dispute remained unresolved. In XX/XX/year>, XXXX sent me an email stating that the account was being returned to Sezzle. However, when I logged into my account after this point, it still reflected that XXXX was managing it, creating further confusion. 

This lack of clarity and mismanagement directly impacted my ability to resolve the account in a timely manner. While I acknowledge the debt, I believe Sezzle has a responsibility to address the harm caused by these communication failures. I am requesting that Sezzle investigate the handling of my account, remove the charge-off status from my credit report as a goodwill adjustment. 

I have made multiple attempts to resolve this matter with the company through phone and email. While I am willing to pay the debt in full, I want assurance that the negative mark will be removed from my credit report upon payment. The company reported the account as a charge-off during an unresolved dispute process, and at the time, the account was no longer being handled by them. This mismanagement, coupled with their lack of clear communication and accountability, has unfairly damaged my credit score.
