Consumer complaint narrative:
This is regarding the ongoing complaint with Barclaycard and their continued non resolution of the issue that I have now reported twice. I have received a response from Barclaycard but it does not close the issue nor give me any proper response to my concerns. Barclaycard has removed the charges and found me not liable, but then nullify that by saying that if the merchant can prove the charges, they will add them back on my account. Prove how? I want video of the criminal perpetrator impersonating me, or phone records or the ip address from which they placed the fraudulent charge on a cancelled card. They have vaguely worded their response and it does not close the issue. They also said that they have closed/cancelled the card in question now in XX/XX/year>, when they told me in early XX/XX/year> in a phone conversation, that they were closing my card immediately and issuing me a new card which I received in mid XX/XX/year>. The fraudulent charge that was made on my account used the card that they had verbally told me was closed in early XXXX. They tell me that they are closing it now? They told me on the phone in early XXXX, prior to the fraudulent charge that the card was closed then. I have requested the phone records of my conversation in early XXXX, which they have not provided. 

My complaint is that they have not fully resolved this issue and put it to rest. On the one hand they are saying that I am not responsible for the fraudulent charges and on the other hand they are nullifying that statement and not taking responsibility or giving me any explanation for placing a complete and unknown stranger on my account, that they did not notify me about it in any manner, not providing any of the records of how and where they placed this stranger on my account, and not acknowledging the fact that they had cancelled the card in question at the beginning of XX/XX/year>, yet placed this fraudulent charge on my account on XX/XX/year> on the card that they had cancelled in early XXXX that they are now telling me that they are closing right now in XX/XX/year>. The level of ineptitude and lack of transparency is beyond pathetic and the response is extremely negligent and contradictory, it does not give me a proper explanation. And they further note that they have not put this issue to rest and may charge my card again.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX JPMorgan Chase & Co . 

This complaint addresses the improper handling of account receivables by JPMorgan Chase XXXX XXXX ( JPMC ), including its subsidiaries Chase Bank USA, NA ( the Servicer ) and Chase XXXX XXXX ( the Issuer ), with XXXX XXXX XXXX  as Trustee. Specifically, XXXX has failed to address the following issues : Non-Compliance with Fiduciary Duties : Chase Bank USA, NA, as a Servicer under JPMCs operational structure, failed to adhere to fiduciary obligations as outlined in its regulatory filings. Their actions include pooling and securitizing receivables for profit without providing reasonable compensation to the account holder. 

Securitization and Lack of Disclosure : Forensic audit findings confirm that the complainants account was securitized under XXXX XXXX : XXXX and subsequently traded domestically and internationally under XXXX : XXXX. The securitization has generated over {$1.00} XXXX in profits, yet JPMC has failed to disclose these activities or provide compensation for the receivables value. 

Failure to Process Receivables : Submitted International Bills of Exchange were not processed as directed, constituting a further breach of fiduciary duties.

Tax Discrepancies : Audit findings suggest potential violations of tax laws, including failure to file requisite SEC and IRS documentation for revenues derived from trading pooled receivables.

Breach of Consumer Rights : JPMC failed to provide GAAP-compliant accounting, transparency in account securitization, and disclosures required under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), further mismanaging the account. 

Timeline of Events XXXX : The complainants account was securitized under XXXX XXXX : XXXX, pooled for asset-backed collateral, and traded on primary and secondary markets. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Notice of revocation of Power of Attorney ( POA ) was sent to JPMC, formally asserting fiduciary control over the account. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Forensic audit was initiated, revealing gross mismanagement, non-compliance with tax laws, and undisclosed securities trading. 

XX/XX/XXXX : First Presentment was issued to JPMC, demanding GAAP-compliant accounting, return of funds, and proper processing of receivables. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Second Presentment was issued after JPMC failed to respond, reiterating demands and highlighting findings from the forensic audit. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Third Presentment will be issued, incorporating findings from JPMCs filings and forensic audit. The document escalated claims of willful misfeasance, bad faith, and gross negligence by JPMC and its subsidiaries.

Consumer complaint narrative:
From XXXX to XXXX XXXX, a series of wire transfers were done from Wells Fargo Bank to what I was led to believe was a legitimate Crypto Currency Platform known as XXXX. 
I was over the age of XXXX when these transfers were done. All of the funds were personal retirement funds accumulated over my working life. The total funds wired was approximately {$150000.00}. Some of the Wells Fargo wires were done on my phone with the direct involvement of the scammer. Subsequently, the wires were done at the Wells Fargo branch. I had rarely taken any money from my retirement accounts. After several wire transfers, Wells Fargo did perform an investigation and advised that this was something called a " pig butchering '' scam. I contacted law enforcement who confirmed this. My issue is that there were not sufficient safeguards on the Wells Fargo Platform to prevent this fraudulent scam activity. Wells Fargo Bank and specifically the wire department should have discovered the fraudulent scheme sooner. By the time, the scam was discovered the damage was done. My financial loss is {$150000.00}. The wires went to Banks like XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. al. The receiving banks should also have alerted Wells and in turn me about the scam.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I have unauthorized accounts and inaccurate information being placed on my credit report. I have disputed these accounts multiple times by mail and online. I am in financial hardship with XXXX kids. I am being denied because of my credit report. I'm unable to receive financial support/ gains due to the inaccuracies on my credit. I also look to see if my personal information was impacted by the data breach, and it was. It's too late file a claim. I AM IN NEED OF IMMEDIATE ATTENTION. I need these items removed from my credit. It's unfair and causing so much stress. 

As I study my consumer laws, I have to come to understand the rights and protections afforded to me under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other federal regulations. These laws are designed to ensure the accuracy, fairness, and privacy of information in the credit reporting system. It is disheartening to see these rights violated, as unauthorized accounts and inaccuracies on my credit report remain unsolved despite my efforts to dispute them. I am determined to hold the credit bureaus accountable to ensure compliance with these laws and protect my financial stability. 

1. ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : The credit bureaus have failed to conduct a proper reinvestigation of my disputes within the required 30-day period.

2 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : The credit bureaus are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report, yet unauthorized and unverified accounts remain on my report.

3. ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : The FCRA requires credit bureaus to block fraudulent or unauthorized information upon receipt of sufficient proof, which I have provided, but no action has been taken.

4. ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) Consumers can dispute a debt and request verification before further collection efforts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I went to mainland Investment located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX phone number XXXX I was refused a test drive after asking several times. The sales person kept making excuses on why the vehicle was at the location for a test drive.

The manager by the name of XXXX went over the contract which we both wet signed. 

The very next day, I had to set an appointment to enter the vehicle into the dealership service center. The car started to jerk at stop lights or turn off at the lights. 

After getting the vehicle from the shop, the next morning the car started smoking under the hood. I reached out to the dealership who instructed me to bring the vehicle back. 

I reached out the lender Credit Acceptance XXXX to get assistance. I was advised to request the dealership to exchange the vehicle or go to another shop. The vehicle supposedly had a warranty. 

After a few days at the new repair shop XXXX XXXX also located on XXXX XXXX. XXXX reached out to inform me the engine was faulty and the cost to break down the engine to locate the issue would cost me {$4400.00}. 

I then reached back out to the lender credit acceptance to request the contract. 

After reviewing the contract the dealership submitted. I noticed it was electronically signed, verse the wet sign between XXXX and I, the creditor/seller name was XXXX XXXX XXXX and not XXXX and the finance amounts were different. 

I requested an investigation on the forged documents and the lender declined. They are allowing forged documents because they want money just like the dealership just money hungry at the cost of the consumer. I never used a key pad to electronically sign or did I have knowledge of the difference until I received the email from credit acceptance. The forged document and scammed me out of my money.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to dispute and request an update to my personal information in your records. I recently obtained a copy of my credit report and discovered that some of the personal information listed is inaccurate or outdated. I kindly request that you investigate and make the necessary updates to ensure the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile. 

Please find below the specific details of the incorrect or outdated information : 1. Name : My current legal name is XXXX XXXX XXXX, but it is listed incorrectly on my credit report as XXXX XXXX XXXX. I request that my name be updated to reflect the correct information. 

2. Address : My current residential address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX, but my credit report shows an outdated address as [ Old Address ]. I request that my current address be updated accordingly. 

3. Contact Information : The phone number listed on my credit report, XXXX, is no longer in use. I request that my new phone number, [ Your Current Phone Number ], be updated as my primary contact number. 

I have enclosed copies of supporting documents to verify the accurate information provided above. The documents include : A copy of my SSN or passport displaying my correct name. 
A recent utility bill or bank statement showing my current address. 
A copy of my phone bill or any other official document that displays my correct phone number. 

Additionally, please provide me with a written confirmation once the updates have been made, and send me an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the changes. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Should you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at [ Your Phone Number ] or via email at [ Your Email Address ]. Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear Equifax Customer Service, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of information being reported on my credit file, as per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, I have identified an account that is being inaccurately reported, which includes an address and name that do not correspond with my Driver 's License or rental agreement.

According to 15 U.S. Code 1681, consumer reporting agencies are required to conduct a fair and reasonable investigation upon receiving a written dispute. Inaccurate credit reporting not only undermines my creditworthiness but also violates my rights as a consumer. 

I request that you investigate this matter promptly and remove the inaccurate account from my credit report. Please find attached any supporting documentation that verifies my claim, including copies of my Driver 's License and rental agreement. 

I am looking forward to your swift response and resolution of this matter. If you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at the phone number or email address provided above. 

Thank you for your attention to this important matter. 

Sincerely CFPB PLEASE REVIEW FOR VIOLATIONS

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you Problem Description : These inquiries were not authorized by me and have negatively impacted my credit score. After reaching out to the companies listed, they confirmed that they have no record of performing these inquiries, which suggests a possible error or potential fraud. 

Legal Basis : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I have the right to dispute the accuracy of any information on my credit report. These sections establish that : -Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Credit bureaus must investigate disputes filed by consumers.

-Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) : Consumers have the right to access information in their credit reports.

-Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Regulates the circumstances under which a credit bureau can furnish a credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Escalation of Dispute Regarding Account Number : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing in response to your reply via the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal regarding the alleged debt associated with my former lease at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Your response fails to address or resolve my concerns and further misrepresents the facts of the situation. 

To reiterate : XXXX. I vacated the property on XX/XX/year>, under an agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX to move out early due to an armed break-in at my unit in late XX/XX/year>. This release was granted based on police advisement for my safety. XXXX XXXX XXXX explicitly agreed there would be no penalties or fees associated with my early move-out and agreed it was in everyones best interest. Police records can be provided. 
XXXX. I have had no financial or contractual obligations to XXXX XXXX XXXX since my move-out date. I have been residing in a new apartment complex since XX/XX/year>, and fulfilled all terms of my tenancy prior to this release. My final month as a tenant at this address was XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX due to my safety. 
XXXX. The alleged debt is therefore entirely invalid, as I was released from any further obligations under my lease, and no charges were ever communicated to me at the time of my departure. 

Failure to Provide Validation of Debt Your claim that a Lease Agreement and Resident Ledger were provided as validation is misleading and insufficient. These documents fail to explain : How the alleged debt was calculated. 
What charges or fees are included in the balance and why they are owed. 
Why I was never informed of these charges before they were sent to collections. 

This lack of transparency is a violation of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( validation of debts ) and 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( false or misleading representations ). 

XXXX XXXX to Resolve I request the following information within 14 days of receipt of this letter : XXXX. A complete, itemized breakdown of the alleged charges, including dates, descriptions, and amounts. 
XXXX. Proof that these charges are consistent with the terms of the lease agreement and the early move-out agreement. 
XXXX. Evidence of any communication from XXXX XXXX XXXX informing me of these charges prior to sending the account to collections. 

If this information can not be provided or if the alleged debt is not withdrawn, I will escalate the matter further. My next steps will include : Filing a formal complaint with the state Attorney XXXX office and any applicable housing authorities. 
XXXX with a consumer protection attorney to pursue legal action for damages under the FDCPA and state-specific tenant protections. 
Ensuring that this matter is contested with all major credit reporting agencies to prevent or remove any negative impact on my credit report. 

This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter amicably by providing the requested information and withdrawing the alleged debt. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information : ( A ) In general, if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Urgent Request Fraudulent and inquiries block under section XXXX of the FCRA Account in Dispute : Reported Balance : {$500.00} Account in Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$810.00} Account In Dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Reported Balance : {$400.00} To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to urgently request the removal of fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report due to identify theft. The inaccurate information is causing significant harm to my credit, and I expect immediate correction action.

Per section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), the following fraudulent accounts must be blocked and permanently removed from my credit file. I am invoking my right to have fraudulent information blocked and permanently removed from my credit report within ( 4 ) business days from the date of receipt of this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XXXX of XXXX, I have been trying to get the credit agencies to publish any accurate credit report for me by having them verify inaccurate information. Whenever I asked for a correction, they would state Verify. I had to write six to seven letters to get any action, but it wasnt until I contacted the State Attorney 's office. I contacted XXXX XXXX and the courts, asking them to verify the information they supplied to the credit agencies. XXXX XXXX and the court stated there had been no response from XXXX, Equifax, or XXXX. 

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) requires that each time a consumer reporting agency receives a dispute, it shall reinvestigate free of charge, record the current status of the disputed information or delete the item from the file within 30 days, beginning on the date the dispute was received unless the account is determined to be frivolous or irrelevant.

Based on the previous information, I am hereby demanding the reinvestigated Bankruptcy with the XXXX Courts or delete of the above accounts from my XXXX file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ). The FCA law states : Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 

XXXX, Equifax ( XXXX XXXX ), or XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) have violated my consumer rights. I am working with XXXX XXXX from the State Attorney 's office to build a case against all three agencies. Based on the evidence I have, the public record should be deleted. 
There is a fact Equifax has been involved in a lawsuit for not following procedures to ensure accurate credit reporting. 

Case # XXXX Inaccurate Credit Reporting Result : 2nd-largest settlement ever under Fair Credit Reporting Act Year : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Information Solutions In XX/XX/XXXX, the Court approved a {$45.00} XXXX settlement on behalf of XXXX claimants against the nations three largest repositories of consumer credit information, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Equifax Information Services XXXX XXXX. Plaintiffs charged that defendants violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by recklessly failing to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accurate reporting of debts discharged in bankruptcy and by refusing to adequately investigate consumer disputes regarding the status of discharged accounts. The {$45.00} XXXX settlement constitutes the second-largest settlement ever in a lawsuit alleging violations of the FCRA. 

During the litigation Credit reporting agencies must now reconcile creditors information against available public bankruptcy records to assure maximum possible accuracy. 

I am writing this letter because I have evidence Equifax has not investigated any dispute letter that I send in or phone. I have been trying to get Equifax to verify the information that is appearing on my credit report, which I know is inaccurate. Each time the report comes back verified.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Response to Your Letter Dated XX/XX/XXXX Account No. XXXX Dear Customer Resolutions Unit, I am writing to address your response to my client 's CFPB complaint. After thorough review, several issues remain unresolved or inadequately addressed. Below, I reiterate key concerns and provide additional legal grounds for my client 's position.

1. Debt Validation Under FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) Your response failed to fully satisfy the debt validation requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1692g. Specifically, you did not provide : Documentation establishing the chain of title and servicing rights for the debt. 
An itemized breakdown of the balance, including principal, interest, and fees. 
Certified evidence validating the debt as required under federal law. 
As stated in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), a creditor must substantiate their claims adequately when challenged. Your inability to provide this documentation calls into question the legitimacy of the debt. 

2. Protections Against Debt Derived from XXXX XXXX ( 18 U.S.C. 1595 and 1596 ) My client is a victim of XXXX XXXX, which impacts the legitimacy of debts incurred under coercion. Under 18 U.S.C. 1595, victims of XXXX  are entitled to remedies, including voiding coerced financial obligations. Any debt linked to XXXX, coercion, or exploitation is subject to discharge. 

Furthermore, under Title 15 and the FDCPA, continuing collection on such debts violates public policy, as it perpetuates harm against victims. In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX courts acknowledged the financial exploitation of trafficking victims as a critical area warranting intervention. 

3. Discharge Provisions Under the Higher Education Act ( HEA ) You referenced discharge provisions under the HEA but did not provide a comprehensive list or address their application to my client 's circumstances. My client seeks specific clarification on the following : Application of Borrower Defense to Repayment under 34 C.F.R. 685.206.

Eligibility for discharge under circumstances of fraud, coercion, or other violations of law. 
As outlined in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, agencies must act in good faith to address borrower rights under federal student loan programs. 

4. Compliance with Consumer Protection Laws ( FCRA and FDCPA ) Your response did not address compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) regarding accurate reporting and dispute resolution. Additionally, as per the FDCPA, continued reporting or collection activities without adequate validation may constitute unlawful harassment.

5. Processing Delays for IDR Plans and SAVE Applications You acknowledged delays in processing SAVE and IDR plan applications but failed to clarify : How these delays impact accrued interest and eligibility for forgiveness.

Steps taken to mitigate harm to borrowers due to administrative backlogs. 
Delays resulting in harm to borrowers violate due process rights under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX6. UCC 3-60
3 and Tender of Payment You did not address whether the debt could be discharged under UCC 3-603 if tender of payment was made and refused. Please clarify your policies regarding tender and discharge.

Next Steps I request that you provide the following within 14 days : Complete documentation validating the debt under 15 U.S.C. 1692g.

Explanation of discharge provisions under the HEA and their applicability to my clients case. 
Confirmation of compliance with Title 15, Title 18, and all applicable consumer protection laws.

Remediation of any adverse credit reporting or collection activities until full validation and resolution of this matter.

Failure to provide a comprehensive response may result in escalation to the CFPB, legal action, or both. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Synchrony Bank closed my CareCredit account, which had only been open for six months. The reason stated in the letter dated XX/XX/year> from the bank is as follows : " Activity on account ( s ) with Synchrony Bank indicative of high risk of failure to pay. '' This statement is false. During the short time I had the account, I used it only a couple of times for small amounts and paid off the entire balances before the due date. 

When I called their support line to inquire about the activity they deemed indicative of high risk, their agents stated that the decision was based on my credit information supplied by XXXX. They instructed me to reach out to XXXX for clarification. 

This claim is also false. During this time, my XXXX credit score increased from XXXX to XXXX. I had no new accounts or inquiries. Additionally, XXXX rates all the key indicators with a high impact on my credit score ( i.e., payment history, credit card use, and derogatory marks ) as excellent. All my accounts are in good standing. 

I requested an investigation into this closure because any activity deemed " risky '' must have been unauthorized, considering my excellent credit history with both the bank and other creditors. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received a letter signed by a Credit Bureau Specialist. The letter stated that, according to their terms, they could close my account at any time and that my payment history may not have necessarily influenced their decision. However, if they are allowed to close accounts without reason, why did they fabricate a false reason, implying that my activities were risky? This is a baseless assertion that they can not substantiate, as all evidence contradicts it. 

The adverse action notice I received was required to comply with the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ). Under this law, the bank must disclose an accurate and specific reason for taking adverse action ( pursuant to 12 CFR 1002.9 ( b ) ( 2 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1691 ( d ) ( 3 ) ). The bank failed to provide an accurate and specific reason, violating this law. Providing a false reason constitutes an unfair and deceptive practice, as well as a poor business practice in general. 

I urge the CFPB to investigate this clear instance of legal noncompliance. Please also consider that CareCredit is not just a credit cardit serves as a vital resource for underprivileged and underinsured individuals like me. Closing such accounts without valid justification can leave people without access to necessary medical treatment, potentially causing harm or forcing them into bankruptcy. This unfair, deceptive, and discriminatory practice exacerbates healthcare inequality in this country, putting individuals at risk of not receiving the care they need. 

Additionally, I am a minority as defined under the Fair Housing and Equal Credit Opportunity Acts ( FECOA ). I believe one of the reasons Synchrony Bank closed my account may be due to my protected characteristics.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Collector, I am writing in response to your { letter or phone call } dated { insert date of letter or phone call }, copy enclosed. 

On { insert date of initial dispute letter } I sent you a letter explaining that I do not believe I owe what you say I owe and, in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g ( Validating Debts ) : ( b ) If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. 
I must remind you that in my previous letter I requested the following information : ( 1 ) the amount of the debt ; ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( 3 ) Provide a verification or copy of any judgment ( if applicable ) ; ( 4 ) Proof that you are licensed to collect debts in ( insert name of your state ) I also requested that if you have reported me to any credit reporting agency, that you inform them that I have placed this debt in dispute and to provide me with proof that you have done so. Furthermore, I asked that you immediately send a copy of that dispute letter to the company ( creditor ) that you say I owe money so they are also aware of my dispute with this debt. 

As of today, you have failed to respond to my requests! For your convenience, I have included a copy of my previous letter and a copy of the mail receipt showing that you received my letter on { insert date from mail receipt }. 

Since you have failed to respond I assume that you have been unable to validate the debt and therefore, I consider this matter closed. You may consider this letter your official notification that I do not intend to correspond with you on this matter again unless you comply with my requests, the FDCPA and the FCRA. 

I must remind you that any attempt to collect this debt without validating it, violates the FDCPA and that I am recording all phone calls and keeping all correspondence concerning this matter. Be advised that I will not hesitate to report violations of the law to my State Attorney General, the Federal Trade Commission and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unfair Late Payment Reporting by Bank of America Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint regarding an unfair negative remark on my credit report caused by Bank of Americas failure to process my account closure request properly. Despite multiple attempts to resolve this matter with the bank and XXXX, the issue remains unresolved, and I am requesting your assistance in addressing this violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Details of the Issue In XX/XX/year>, I requested the closure of my Bank of America account via a phone call. At the time of my request, the account balance was XXXX. I was assured that the account would be closed. However, due to the bank 's failure to process my closure request, the account remained open, and I was subsequently charged two {$15.00} fees. These fees resulted in late payments being reported to the credit bureaus, unfairly damaging my otherwise exceptional payment history. 

I have disputed these late payments with XXXX, requesting verification of their accuracy. XXXX has responded, claiming the information is accurate. However, the negative remarks on my credit report are the direct result of Bank of Americas failure to process my account closure request as promised, making this reporting unfair and inaccurate. 

Impact These unfairly reported late payments have caused a significant drop in my credit score and tarnished my impeccable credit history. This is unjust, given that the fees and subsequent late payments resulted solely from the banks error in failing to close my account as instructed. 

What I Am Requesting I request the CFPBs assistance to : 1Investigate this matter with Bank of America and XXXX. 
2Require Bank of America to remove the late payment reports from my credit history across all major credit bureaus. 
3Ensure compliance with the FCRA and prevent further harm to my creditworthiness. 

Supporting Documentation I have attached : A summary of my account history, including the timeline of the account closure request. 
Copies of correspondence with XXXX regarding the dispute. 
My XXXX  credit report showing the late payment remarks. 

Conclusion I believe this issue stems from Bank of Americas error and failure to act on my account closure request, making the late payments unjust and inaccurate. I appreciate the CFPBs attention to this matter and look forward to a resolution that restores the accuracy of my credit report. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to request that my previous complaint against Ally Bank be reopened in light of a recent article detailing a lawsuit filed by the CFPB against three major banks for failing to protect consumers from XXXX payment scam fraud. I believe Ally Bank should also be held liable for similar activity and refund my lost funds. 
Details of My Complaint : Victim of an Online Scam : I have been the victim of an online scam involving the fraudulent purchase of a XXXX XXXX XXXX through the website XXXX The sequence of events leading to this complaint is as follows : XXXX. Transaction Initiation : On or about XX/XX/year>, I entered into a transaction with an individual purporting to be a XXXX named XXXX XXXX, also known as XXXX XXXX. The transaction was confirmed through text messages and emails. The breeder provided contact information including phone number ( XXXX ) XXXX and email XXXX. 
2. Payment Details : The agreed price for the kitten was {$750.00}, with an additional {$70.00} for delivery, totaling {$820.00}. The payment was made via XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, using the email XXXX. The recipient 's name appeared correctly, and XXXX XXXX confirmed receipt of the payment. 
XXXX. Scam Realization : Following the payment, I received a call claiming the kitten was on hold due to an obligatory purchase of an Air-Conditioned Pet Travel Crate costing {$3400.00}. Realizing this was a scam tactic, I attempted to contact XXXX XXXX, who became unreachable. 
XXXX. Report to Ally Bank : I immediately reported the fraud to Ally Bank and requested to stop the {$820.00} XXXX transaction. The bank representative opened an investigation, asked me to file an internet fraud report with the FBI, and report the fraud with XXXX. The Ally dispute number is XXXX. 
XXXX. Lack of Action by Ally Bank : Despite my efforts and uploading all requested documents to Ally Banks messaging portal, the bank did nothing to stop the payment. On XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from Ally Bank, backdated to XX/XX/year>, stating that the transaction was authorized and without error. The letter also noted that the recipient had confirmed the transaction as authorized, which led to the denial of my refund. 
I have reason to believe that the bank representative failed to properly flag this matter as fraud or notify the bank 's fraud department to take necessary action against the scammer. 
Given the recent actions taken by the CFPB against other banks for failing to protect consumers from XXXX payment fraud, I request that the CFPB reevaluate my case against Ally Bank. It is essential for consumers to receive adequate protection and support from financial institutions, particularly in cases of evident fraud.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the information reported on my ChexSystems consumer report regarding an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ). The entry for this account was reported as " Account Abuse '' and " XXXX XXXX, '' but the balance and charge are the result of fraudulent activity, and the creditor failed to conduct an appropriate investigation, as required by federal law. 
Here are the relevant details regarding this dispute : Account Number : XXXX Reported Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Reported Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, KS XXXX Date of Closure : XX/XX/year> Reported SSN/ID : XXXX Facts of the Case : 1. Fraudulent Activity : I closed the account on XX/XX/year> with a zero balance. However, after the closure, a fraudulent charge was processed on the account, despite it being closed. 
2. Failure of Proper Investigation : I disputed the charge with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, but they refused to conduct an appropriate investigation of the fraudulent charge, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The creditor failed to follow the required procedures for addressing fraud, and as a result, the charge remains incorrectly reported on my ChexSystems report.

3. Violation of Federal Law : Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), creditors are required to properly investigate disputes, especially when fraud is suspected. I have complied with the requirements for disputing fraudulent activity and expected the creditor to investigate and resolve the issue. Instead, they improperly allowed the fraudulent charge to remain on the account and were negligent in their duties.

I request that ChexSystems conduct a thorough investigation into this matter, as I have not authorized or incurred the fraudulent charge, and I was not involved in any
activity related to this charge. I also request that you update my consumer report to reflect the removal of this incorrect entry as soon as possible, in accordance with federal law. The results of your investigation should also produce a detailed transaction history of the account as well as all of the dispute letters I sent to the credit union.

Please inform me of the results of your investigation, and provide me with a copy of my updated report once the dispute is resolved. I am available to provide any additional documentation or information that may be necessary.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of this dispute. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files.

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX/ Balance : XXXX XXXXXXXX Opened : XXXX. XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX/ Balance : XXXX XXXXXXXX Opened : XXXX XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX Balance : XXXX XXXX Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX Identity Theft Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$840.00} /Opened : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX / Identity Theft It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. I am also pursuing complaints at federal levels to address these violations because my consumer rights have been violated and belittled.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally address ongoing and unresolved issues regarding the servicing of my mortgage account in XXXX, Texas. As a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX veteran with a limited income, as documented in the enclosed Veterans Benefits letter, the mishandling of my account has caused undue financial hardship. Below, I detail the key concerns : 1. Unauthorized Escrow Conversion My mortgage account was converted to an escrow account without prior notification. Shellpoint, as the mortgage servicer, failed to provide either written or electronic notice of this significant change, which is a violation of applicable regulations, including the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ), which requires servicers to provide proper notice of any changes affecting a borrowers payments. 

2. Failure to Notify of Delinquent MUD Tax A delinquent Municipal Utility District ( MUD ) tax balance arose due to a communication error. While my property tax bill was sent to my correct mailing address, the MUD tax bill was sent to the rental property address and was not forwarded, leaving me unaware of the delinquency. This oversight resulted in an inaccurate escrow analysis and a dramatic increase in my monthly mortgage payment from {$2100.00} to {$4700.00}. Under Texas Property Code 32.06, servicers are obligated to ensure accurate tax payment management. 

3. Escrow Payment and Denial of Non-Escrow Request On XX/XX/year>, I made a {$7800.00} payment to reconcile the escrow balance based on assurances from Shellpoint representatives that this payment would resolve the issue. However, the elevated mortgage payment remains unchanged. Furthermore, my request to revert to non-escrow status was denied without notification or explanation, violating transparency requirements under RESPA. 

4. Escrow Balance Discrepancy and Communication Issues The most recent escrow analysis reflects an inflated balance, despite Shellpoint receiving both a refund from the MUD utility and my escrow-only payment, along with multiple elevated mortgage payments. The lack of clear communication regarding these matters violates the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), which mandates accurate and transparent disclosures to borrowers. 


Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/year>XXXX  Name : XXXX XXXX Creditor Name : Bounce AI Creditor Address : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, NY XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Debt and Credit Reporting Account XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally dispute the account referenced above, which has been reported to credit bureaus and is being pursued for collections by Bounce A.I. This account was originally owned by XXXX and has already been charged off. Additionally, XXXX has received a tax credit from the IRS for this charge-off, rendering further collection attempts inappropriate and potentially unlawful. 
Under IRS regulations, creditors who charge off debts and receive a tax benefit are required to issue a Form 1099-C to the debtor. I have not received such a form, and without this documentation, any further collection efforts would be in violation of IRS guidelines and could constitute fraud. 
Furthermore, there has been no proof provided of my ownership of this debt since it was charged off. Without legal validation of ownership, XXXX XXXX. has no rights to pursue collection efforts or to report this debt to credit bureaus. 
I demand that this account be immediately removed from my credit reports and that all collection activity cease. Failure to comply with this request within 14 days of receipt of this letter will leave me with no choice but to take the following actions : XXXX. File a formal complaint with the IRS regarding this fraudulent activity. 
XXXX. Pursue legal action against XXXX XXXX. and any other involved parties for inaccurate and illegal reporting of information to credit bureaus. 
I trust that XXXX XXXX. will act promptly to rectify this matter. Please confirm in writing that this account has been removed from my credit reports and that no further collection attempts will be made. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as formal notice and demand for resolution regarding the account transferred from XXXX in the amount of {$6500.00}. The transfer of this account was not conducted in accordance with federal and state law. Additionally, XXXX did not have, and never will have, my consent to transfer or assign this account to you or any other party. 

I am holding you accountable for violations of the following applicable laws : Federal Laws Violated : XXXX Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq.

Misrepresentation of debt ownership and improper account transfer without my consent.

2 Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.

Reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information to credit bureaus.

3 Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq.

Failure to provide required disclosures regarding the assignment of the debt.

Florida State Laws Violated : 1 Florida  Consumer Collection Practices Act ( FCCPA ), Fla. Stat. 559.72 ( 9 ) : Claiming or attempting to enforce a debt that is not legitimate or authorized.

2 Fla. Stat. 559.77 : Allowing recovery of damages for violations of the FCCPA.

Due to your actions, I have suffered actual damages in the amount of {$6500.00}. Under state and federal law, I am entitled to recover damages up to the actual amount due to the unlawful transfer, misrepresentation, and inaccurate reporting.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally demand that you immediately remove the collection entry from my credit report, which I believe is in violation of my rights under multiple legal statutes, including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Firstly, I was never informed by your company about any potential violation of the HIPAA Law in relation to the collection of my debt. Under HIPAA ( 45 CFR 164.502 ), you are prohibited from disclosing any medical information without my explicit consent. It appears that Synerprise Consulting Services has violated this provision by sharing or attempting to collect information regarding my healthcare, which I have not authorized. Your failure to comply with HIPAA regulations, coupled with your improper use of my personal health information, is a clear violation of my rights. 
Additionally, I previously made a payment towards the balance owed, yet I find that my account remains listed as a collection on my credit report. I will not be making any further payments to Synerprise Consulting Services as a result of your failure to comply with the legal requirements set forth under both federal and state laws. This constitutes a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1692 ), particularly under 1692e, which prohibits false or misleading representations regarding a debt. The continued listing of this collection on my credit report is misleading and unsubstantiated by my current payments, and I demand that it be removed immediately.

This letter also serves as a formal 15-day notice of my intent to take further legal action if these issues are not resolved. If Synerprise Consulting Services fails to remove this incorrect collection from my credit report within the next 15 days, I will initiate a lawsuit under 
both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I will also pursue claims for any damages and legal fees incurred due to your unlawful actions.

Furthermore, I will be filing a formal complaint with the Office of the Attorney General for the state of Texa. Your actions appear to violate both federal and state consumer protection regulations, and I will not hesitate to pursue all available legal avenues to hold your company accountable.

I trust that Synerprise Consulting Services will take immediate action to resolve this matter and comply with all applicable laws. Failure to do so will result in legal consequences, including the aforementioned lawsuit and complaints to the Attorney General and other relevant authorities. 

Please treat this matter with the urgency it requires.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Dept of EdXXXX XXXX Account Ending in XXXX ) Dear Equifax Dispute Department , I am writing to dispute inaccuracies in the reporting of the Dept of Ed/XXXX  account XXXX Account XXXX in XXXX ) on my Equifax credit report. Upon reviewing my report, I identified multiple inconsistencies and errors that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Disputed Inaccuracies 1. Unjustified 90-Day Late Payment ( XXXX ) : The payment history lists a 90-day late payment in XXXX without any progression ( 30- or 60-day late payments ). This is inaccurate and inconsistent with standard reporting practices, and no supporting documentation has been provided to verify this delinquency.

2. Inconsistent Reporting of Balance and Payments : The account reports an increasing balance, yet the scheduled and actual payments for each month are missing or listed as {$0.00}. This is contradictory and does not align with the nature of the account. 
3. Misleading Pays As Agreed Status : While the account is marked as Pays As Agreed, the inclusion of the 90-day late payment in XXXX  is misleading and unjustly harms my creditworthiness. 
4. Omissions in Payment Details : The payment history does not include scheduled or actual payments for multiple years ( XXXX ). This incomplete reporting fails to provide a complete and accurate account overview. 

FCRA Violations 1. FCRA 1681e ( b ) Failure to Ensure Accuracy : Equifax is required to ensure maximum possible accuracy, but the listed discrepancies demonstrate otherwise.

2. FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Duty to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation : Previous disputes failed to resolve these inaccuracies, indicating a lack of a thorough reinvestigation.

3. FCRA 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Obsolete Information : The XXXX late payment, if unverifiable, should no longer be reported or factored into the accounts status.

4. FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) Furnishers Responsibility to Correct Errors : The furnisher ( Dept of Ed/XXXX ) has failed to ensure the accuracy of the reported data. 

Requested Actions 1. Conduct a Reinvestigation : Verify the accuracy of the 90-day late payment and provide supporting documentation or remove the late payment entirely. 
2. Correct or Delete the Account : Update the balance, payment history, and status to reflect the correct information or remove the account if the information can not be verified.

3. Provide Verification Documentation : Supply all supporting evidence used to verify the late payment and account history.

Supporting Documentation 1. Screenshots of the accounts balance and payment history. 
2. My identification documents : Drivers License Social Security Card Proof of Address Your Responsibility Under FCRA 1681i ( a ), Equifax must resolve this dispute within 30 days. If the inaccuracies can not be verified, the account must be corrected or deleted.

Continued failure to address these issues may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies under the FCRA for damages caused by this inaccurate reporting. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding my student loan account. My loans are serviced by Nelnet, and I enrolled in the SAVE ( Saving on a Valuable Education ) Plan, which was supposed to have 0 % interest accrual on unpaid monthly interest. However, despite being enrolled in this program, I have noticed that interest has accumulated on my account during the time I was in the program.

Details of My Complaint : 1. Enrollment Confirmation : I was informed by my loan servicer that my loans were enrolled in the SAVE Plan.

This program is supposed to ensure that no interest accrues on my account if my monthly payments are insufficient to cover the accruing interest.

2. Interest Accumulation : Despite this, I have noticed a significant increase in my loan balance due to accrued interest during the period I was enrolled in the SAVE Plan. 
I have reached out to my loan servicer multiple times, but they have either failed to provide an adequate explanation or have ignored the issue. 
3. Financial and Emotional Impact : This has caused unnecessary financial strain and confusion, as I trusted the terms of the SAVE program.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I request that you provide the following documentation to verify the legitimacy and enforceability of this alleged obligation. 
Requested Documentation 1. Certified Copy of the Original Promissory Note A true and complete Certified Copy of the original promissory note bearing my signature, which forms the basis of this alleged debt. 
2. Full Chain of Title ( Proof of Assignment ) Documentation showing all assignments or transfers of this debt from the original creditor including dates, endorsements, and all intermediary parties involved. 
3. Full Statement of Payment History, including : A detailed history of the account Dates and amounts of each required payment. 
Payments made, their application, and any penalties or interest charged. 
A detailed calculation of the outstanding balance.

4. Start Date of Delinquency The specific date when the account allegedly became delinquent, and an explanation of how delinquency was determined.

5. Name and Contact Information of the Original Creditor The name, address, and contact information of the original creditor, along with the date this debt was incurred. 
Legal Basis for My Request Promissory Note Requirement : Under the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) Article 3, the party seeking to enforce a negotiable instrument ( e.g., promissory note ) must provide proof of possession of the original instrument. 
Case law : XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) established that the promissory note is the principal obligation, and without it, the mortgage or security interest can not be enforced. 
Chain of Title Requirement : Courts have held that an unbroken chain of title is necessary to prove standing in debt collection or foreclosure cases. 
Case law : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) invalidated foreclosures where lenders failed to provide documentation showing they were the rightful holders of the loans. 
Debt Validation Requirement : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I have the right to request validation of this debt, including the identity of the original creditor and evidence of the amount owed. 
Important Notice Debt collection activities must be suspended until this debt is validated, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ).

Failure to provide the requested documentation may be a violation of federal and state consumer protection laws and could result in further legal action or complaints with regulatory agencies.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a college student credit card account with Discover Bank. At the time, I was a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I had a great part time XXXX  job that paid extremely well. However, I quickly began dealing with significant XXXX XXXX XXXX  distress because of my challenging coursework as well as personal matters that were incredibly challenging to deal with. As a result, I was laid off from my XXXX  job for a no-call-no-show. Ever since, I have struggled to find adequate employment to support myself while keeping up with my credit card bills and I now find myself receiving SNAP and XXXX benefits through the state of Virginia. In XXXX, approximately six months after opening my account and after already beginning to accrue a running balance, Discover chose to increase my credit limit from {$1500.00} to {$3000.00}, which I believe was a business practice in violation of federal law due to my heavy spending habits typical of a college student coupled with a complete lack of stable income. Nevertheless, I continued to struggle. Multiple times I reached out to chat with a live agent to discuss hardship options ( attached ), but none were sufficient given the fact that I am still unemployed due to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. As such, I have not signed any agreement and the company continues to harass me, now threatening to report my account as a charge-off to the Bureaus should I not pay the minimum due balance of {$570.00}. This is simply unreasonable given my circumstances at the moment. In addition, Discover relentlessly called me from various phone numbers, blocked numbers, and VoIP numbers multiple times daily, usually in inconvenient situations or while driving my car for the entire six months during which my account has been considered delinquent. I finally chose to block all numbers and send written correspondence once again outlining my financial hardship, to which I received no response. All evidence for the above claims will be attached.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Escalation of Dispute Regarding Account Number : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing in response to your reply via the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal regarding the alleged debt associated with my former lease at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Your response fails to address or resolve my concerns and further misrepresents the facts of the situation. 

To reiterate : XXXX. I vacated the property on XX/XX/year>, under an agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX to move out early due to an armed break-in at my unit in late XX/XX/year>. This release was granted based on police advisement for my safety. XXXX XXXX XXXX explicitly agreed there would be no penalties or fees associated with my early move-out and agreed it was in everyones best interest. Police records can be provided. 
XXXX. I have had no financial or contractual obligations to XXXX XXXX XXXX since my move-out date. I have been residing in a new apartment complex since XX/XX/year>, and fulfilled all terms of my tenancy prior to this release. My final month as a tenant at this address was XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX due to my safety. 
XXXX. The alleged debt is therefore entirely invalid, as I was released from any further obligations under my lease, and no charges were ever communicated to me at the time of my departure. 

Failure to Provide Validation of Debt Your claim that a Lease Agreement and Resident Ledger were provided as validation is misleading and insufficient. These documents fail to explain : How the alleged debt was calculated. 
What charges or fees are included in the balance and why they are owed. 
Why I was never informed of these charges before they were sent to collections. 

This lack of transparency is a violation of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( validation of debts ) and 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( false or misleading representations ).

Final Opportunity to Resolve I request the following information within 14 days of receipt of this letter : 1. A complete, itemized breakdown of the alleged charges, including dates, descriptions, and amounts.

2. Proof that these charges are consistent with the terms of the lease agreement and the early move-out agreement. 
XXXX. Evidence of any communication from XXXX XXXX XXXX informing me of these charges prior to sending the account to collections. 

If this information can not be provided or if the alleged debt is not withdrawn, I will escalate the matter further. My next steps will include : Filing a formal complaint with the state Attorney XXXX office and any applicable housing authorities. 
XXXX with a consumer protection attorney to pursue legal action for damages under the FDCPA and state-specific tenant protections. 
Ensuring that this matter is contested with all major credit reporting agencies to prevent or remove any negative impact on my credit report. 

This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter amicably by providing the requested information and withdrawing the alleged debt. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection

Consumer complaint narrative: Caine & Weiner continues to send me a printout of a bill or itemized document as debt validation. As per the FTC opinion letter from Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX, a printout of a bill or itemized document does not constitute verification. This company can not provide me any documents bearing my signature showing I have a legal binding contractual obligation to their company. I did not give permission under the FCRA, FDCPA, or congress law for them to report this account against me while violating my rights under the law. This account needs to be removed immediately from my credit from all credit bureaus. I have consulted with attorneys, the Attorney Generals Office, CFPB and XXXX  on this issue. Caine & Weiner has 30 days to delete the accounts in violation before I sue for violations.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, our organization, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, sent a wire transfer from our XXXX account to a US Bank account to pay XXXX XXXX for a vacation package to XXXX. The amount was {$16000.00}. The account was fake, set up by a scammer to intercept our payment. The scammer opened an account at US Bank under the name of XXXX XXXX, XXXX of the biggest XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in the US, to facilitate the transfer. US Bank did XXXX due diligence to verify that the person attempting to open the account was authorized to do so, and accepted an XXXX that didn't match the business. 

When the fraud was discovered in early XXXX, XXXX issued a recall against the wire transfer, but US Bank has refused, despite the fact that it was their gross negligence that facilitated this crime. Had they done even the minimum verification, such a a simple phone call to XXXX, the attempted fraud would have been discovered and thwarted, and the perpetrator likely apprehended. 

Instead, they have ceased all communication and refuse to make restitution or even discuss it, leaving a legitimate business and our small recreation club out a substantial amount of money.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt or credit management
Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX IS A SAAVY SCAM To be clear, I already see the loophole this organization uses. It is consumer legal group. They have a website and a phone number and it feels very legitimate when you read the actual document that you sign they specify they dont help with credit repair or debt settlement. They are a debt invalidation group. But I have just reached out to an account that I gave them 17 months ago and they have not made contact with them once. I signed up with this company in XXXX of XXXX for an 18 month term, and they have not notified me once about any action they have taken to communicate with any of my creditors. They have said they would negotiate etc, but have never let me know how any conversation went if they took place. They have become strident in conversation over the last couple months to just use the word invalidate not, repair/ settle etc But then, when talking to XXXX XXXX she will say but it is your debt right and we will probably have to do a settlement with your account when they say they dont do settlements or credit repair ..thats when red flag started flying because the actual service they provide has become increasingly unclear except to faithfully debit my checking account. 
I learned standing in court by myself from my creditors attorney that XXXX did reach out once and that was good to know, but thats a pretty crazy place to find out and from opposing counsel! 
I have two court cases going on right now which I was denied an attorney to go with me for, and that is in the agreement that an attorney will be provided if necessary. I felt very foolish standing there, unable to even give the judge an attorneys name. After the fact when I gave XXXX an account of the experience and asked that they still would not provide me an attorneys name. They say they fight to invalidate the debt but pretty much just let it go to court and then try to negotiate a lower amount. That is what they say, but they have not negotiated anything on my behalf and my program with them ends next month. 
The biggest issue is how they got my business by calling me what they said on the phone does not match what was in the agreement. They said 98 % of the clients they work with have their debts resolved at the end of their agreement term and their credit is better than when they started. It actually ended up doing the opposite for me. I will have completed payments with them ( if I continued ) before even going to trial, and my credit is worse than when I started. 
Its misleading its inconsistent and I have confirmed with one of my accounts that they have made ZERO contact in 17 months, so they have just collected a pretty large monthly payment from me for a year and a half, and judging by the one star reviews on the XXXX XXXX XXXX and their website a lot of people have had the same experience, definitely more than the 2 % they claim they cant help. 
I submitted this claim because I saw there was a similar sounding name related to mortgages consumer finance law group that had a settlement XX/XX/XXXX for almost {$12.00} XXXX because they did not deliver services promised to customers. This feels like a very similar situation and deserves a full investigation. They also say you have to resolve whatever you have with them within six months of filing a complaint. Its hard to file a complaint when you have very little information from them. Our communication was basically me calling them and them sending me reminders of when they were going to charge my account. I also continue to forward my financial documents to them that they requested and I would just get an email saying thank you its been uploaded to your account. I have an account Im supposed to be able to view online, but I dont know how to access it. I have requested that information. They provided a username and password when I signed up, but that doesnt work. It doesnt even match the type of prompt its looking for. This entire company is just a misleading way to take advantage of desperate people. I never missed a payment on my credit account until they advised me too, and now I am in a bigger mess than when I started with them. 

I requested they stopped billing me in XXXX because I was very distressed I would not have an attorney going with me to my first court appearance. In XXXX XXXX XXXX said she would process my request but also seemed vague as well, which is a common tactic. 
Im just disappointed, not only did they not invalidate ANY of my debt, not go to court, and not improve my credit, but also happily took almost {$6000.00} of my money to do nothing and run my credit into the ground. I dont think anyone would knowingly pay for that service and probably their five star reviews are people at the beginning or middle of the program who think they are actually being helped.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I retained a lawyer due to a possibility of a student case. This lawfirm charged me a {$5000.00} retainer. 
I did not receive any legal services or have any lawsuit. The firm refused to refund my money. I filed a dispute with my credit card company, capital one stating they did not provide the services paid for. I received a temporary credit. This lawfirm disputed this and Capital One requested further documentation. I provided everything and they refused, in violation of both State Bar Law in 5 states but also Consumer Protection Law to refund the money. They sided with the legal firm and then lied and said I did NOT provide them with the documentation. I not only provided everything asked for, but now they are lying and say they didn't receive it. 

They kept, my {$5000.00} and literally stole money from me.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was repeatedly solicited to refer this POS system to other potential clients in return for a {$750.00} referral bonus 90 days after the new client started service. I asked the company representative if we needed to keep our service with them open in order to receive the bonus. I was advised in writing that I did not need to be processing transactions with them in order to receive the {$750.00}. So, I went ahead and provided them with a successful referral which involved work on my part to convince the new client to use their service. I emailed the rep dozens of times to find out why I hadnt received my {$750.00}. Each time he assured me that it was coming and that he would not forget me. Finally, he informed that I was not eligible because I was no longer processing transactions and so after months of back and forth I would not be getting my bonus. Again, he assured me in writing that I would get the bonus even if I was no longer processing with them. I believe that this company has committed fraud and I would like my money now.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Equifax for failing to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by refusing to remove unauthorized credit inquiries from my credit report. On my XX/XX/year> credit report, I discovered several unauthorized credit inquiries on my Equifax credit report. I promptly disputed these inquiries, as I did not authorize any of them. However, Equifax advised me that I needed to contact the creditors responsible for these inquiries to obtain a letter from them acknowledging the unauthorized inquiry. 
This is in direct violation of the FCRA. As per the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete consumer reports. Equifax, as a consumer reporting agency, bears the responsibility of investigating my dispute and ensuring the accuracy of the information on my credit report. I am not responsible for obtaining any documentation from the creditors involved. By shifting the burden to me and refusing to remove the unauthorized inquiries, Equifax has failed to uphold its legal obligations under the FCRA. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and compel Equifax to remove these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I have had an account for some time with XXXX, it mostly sits idle to gain value. I received an email one day that my account was restricted due to suspicious activity, which seemed strange as I had had ZERO activity on my account for a couple months. They requested a couple documents from me and would return my account, per the email. So I sent the documents. Then almost a week later I received another email stating I needed to call them, I did an no one is available to take my call. I enter the cue on their app. It says 30 minutes. No one calls. I emailed back, again, they say they called and I didn't answer, to enter the cue again. No one ever called me! But I never the cue again, it says 30 minutes again. Over a DAY later I get another email saying they missed me on my call again. No, they absolutely never called. Each of these emails I requested over and over again to PLEASE just unlock my account so I can free my funds and place them somewhere safer. I get scripted emails back that say I must call or use the app to receive a call back, but I have attached my call log to show NO calls have come from them, I've been STUCK in the cue despite it telling me to join it again, and I've attempted multiple conversations via email as well. I just want to move my funds somewhere else. That's all at this point. I want nothing else in return from them, just what is mine.

I made a payment with my US Bank Debit card to my storage company Life storage for {$870.00} and the storage company said it did not receive the money but the bank has already debited my account. I then called my bank and my bank said it will revert after 5 working day.

For fear of late payment I made another payment to my storage for {$880.00}. and that was received. I also complained to my storage company about the first payment they provided me with account details and the payment for {$870.00} did not reflect. Its important to note that a similar incident has happened in the past with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX the payment bounced back the next day. 
For over one month US Bank has refused to credit my account with this amount {$870.00} and the keep charging me overdraft charges of {$36.00}. The issue now is the bank says the amount is with the storage company and the storage company say they dont have the money. Please help.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is your formal notice to cease your unauthorized hard inquiries into my credit report and, a formal demand that you immediately contact the credit reporting agencies and credit bureaus, where your organization has made inquiries into my credit history, to have your illegal inquiries removed. Be advised that I will be checking my reports to ensure you have had the following unauthorized inquiries removed : Made by : CBNA, THD/CBNA Made on : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX To my knowledge, I have not signed any documents authorizing your organization to view my credit history therefore, your inquiry into my credit report violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 1681b ( c ) : Transactions Not Initiated by Consumer.

If you are in possession of any document that you believe authorizes you or your organization to make inquires into my credit report, I respectfully request a copy of this document be sent to my address listed above so that I may verify its validity. Given the amount of identity theft, I'm sure you'll agree that verifying your information is in your best interest. 
Finally, assuming you do not posses inquiry authorization, I request that, after removing your unauthorized inquires from my credit profiles, you also remove all of my personal information from your records and send me confirmation that you have complied with my requests.
