Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally complain about a wire transfer I made to a fraudulent Citibank account ( Account Number : XXXX ) in the amount of {$90000.00}, intended to assist my sister with her home closing in the process of a house purchasing. 

The wire transfer was initiated through my bank, XXXX, on XX/XX/year>, around XXXX XXXX. Upon discovering that this account was fraudulent, I contacted XXXX on XX/XX/year>, at approximately XXXX XXXX to initiate a wire recall. Citibank subsequently requested a letter of indemnity and a police report. XXXX has provided the requested documents, sending the letter of indemnity on XX/XX/year>, and the police report on XX/XX/year>. 

However, on XX/XX/year>, XXXX informed me that Citibank had declined to return the funds. Citibank stated, " PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT WE HAVE CONTACTED OUR CLIENT FOR DEBIT AUTHORITY ON A NUMBER OF OCCASIONS, BUT AS OF TODAY, HAVE NOT RECEIVED A RESPONSE IN REGARDS TO YOUR RECALL REQUEST. WE RESPECTFULLY SUGGEST THAT THE REMITTER AND BENEFICIARY SETTLE THIS MATTER DIRECTLY. '' ( Reference number : XXXX ) Despite my and Chases efforts to provide evidence of the fraudulent nature of the transaction, Citibank has neither acknowledged the fraud nor responded to XXXX regarding the documents submitted.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: There is an account under the name WILLIAMS & FUDGE INC. attempting to collect {$10000.00} from me and reporting only on my XXXX credit report. The account was opened on XX/XX/year>. Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I owe no debt, this company violates a number of my consumer rights which include : 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ), these accounts must have a permissible purpose; under 15 USC 1681 ( 4 ), they must be accurate and verifiable; under 15 USC 6802, my financial information must remain private without proper authorization ; and under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), you are required to ensure maximum accuracy. An account was unlawfully opened in my name, resulting in unauthorized access to my personal information and misuse of my credit report. Additionally, the inaccurate reporting on my credit file reflects a failure to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy as required by federal law. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly and ensure corrective measures are taken.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the loan closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was threatened by the CEO that they would cancel my loan XXXX hours before we were scheduled to close. 

As mentioned in a previous complaint, everything was in great shape for our closing up until about 24 hours prior. Unfortunately, things went south and I attempted to contact District Lending to no avail. I then sat down and wrote a negative XXXX review primary to get attention. Later that evening, I was finally contacted by someone at District Lending. That conversation went like this : District Lending Rep : Did you post a negative review on XXXX about us? 

Me : Yes, I did. I had no other way to get your attention. 

District Lending Rep : Our CEO told me that if you do not take the review down, we will cancel your loan.

The CEO threatened to CANCEL OUR LOAN because I wrote an accurate ( if not negative ) review about his company.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Despite everything going smoothly with the loan process, 18 hours prior to our close on a Friday morning, things went south. We were suddenly told by our Title company that they still did not have the Clear to Close from the lender, and then District Lending disappeared. I called our Regional Sales Manager, I called the main District Lending office ( where I could only get some answering service who assured me someone would call me back soon ), I called the Founder/CEO ( whom I had talked to before ). I probably made 15-20 phone calls to try and talk to someone. Never happened. The entirety of Thursday afternoon passed, and we did not hear from ANYONE. All the while our closing fell apart and we had no clue as to why, nor what could be done about it. Simply unbelievable.

And, after everything settled down, we never received any type of follow-up. Not a phone call, not an explanation, not an apology, not a How Did We Do? customer survey ( that everyone seems to ask for these days ), nothing. To this day a few weeks later, I still do not know what happened and I have not talked to anyone since that fateful day.
